Outcome.Outcome1: Nowadays, the society is becoming more competitive and demanding, and people have to cope with various challenges and opportunities in their careers and lives. some people believe that working faster and more riskily is necessary to achieve their goals and improve their situations, while others think that it is harmful and stressful. in my opinion, working faster and more riskily has more advantages than disadvantages, and i will explain why in the following paragraphs.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the reasons why i agree with the statement that people should work faster and more riskily is that it helps them gain more skills by studying. in today's competitive world, having a higher education or a specialized qualification can open many doors and opportunities for career advancement. however, pursuing further studies often requires a lot of time, effort, and money, which may not be available for everyone. therefore, by working faster and more riskily, people can save more money and time to invest in their education and improve their knowledge and abilities. for instance, because applying to study abroad needs a lot of money, i am working in two organizations to gain more salary. the more money, the more chances.
Outcome.Outcome3: Another reason why i agree with the statement that people should work faster and more riskily is that it allows them to have more than one job. in today's competitive and expensive world, working in a single organization may not be enough to meet one's financial needs and goals. therefore, many people choose to work in two or three firms in a week, even if it means sacrificing their leisure time and facing more stress. by doing so, they can earn more money and pursue their dreams, such as studying abroad or buying a house. for instance, i am currently working in two organizations to save enough money for applying to study abroad, which is a long-term investment in my education and career. the more money i earn, the more opportunities i have.
Outcome.Outcome4: Another reason why i agree with the statement is that working faster enables people to handle more tasks in a given time. this can improve their efficiency, productivity, and competitiveness in the fast-changing market. for instance, by working faster, i can finish my assignments in the morning and then devote the afternoon to learning a new language or skill. this way, i can enhance my resume and increase my chances of getting a better job or scholarship. handling more tasks is the third benefit of working faster, even if it is more risky.
Outcome.Outcome5: Working in multiple firms in a week is one of the ways that people try to cope with the rising expenses and achieve their goals. however, this is not the only reason that people should work faster and take more risks. there are other advantages that can result from this approach, as i will explain in the following paragraph.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, working faster and taking more risks also has some drawbacks that should not be ignored. for instance, it can cause stress, burnout, health problems, and lower quality of work. moreover, it can reduce the satisfaction and loyalty of workers, as well as their opportunities for creativity and innovation. therefore, people should balance their work speed and risk level with their personal and professional goals, values, and well-being.

Context.Left: In the first place, children are free whatever they want to do, they are not restricted and their limitation are really rare. Because they are in the age of growth and they are allowed whatever they want to do to experience new stuffs. Therefore there is no argument and punishment for them.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain why children are free to do whatever they want and how that benefits them.

Outcome.Outcome1: Being free to do whatever they want gives children the opportunity to explore their interests, talents, and abilities, as well as to learn from their mistakes and successes. they can express themselves creatively, emotionally, and physically, without worrying about the expectations or judgments of others. they can also develop their social skills, friendships, and sense of belonging by interacting with peers who share their curiosity and enthusiasm. by doing so, they enrich their lives with joy, fun, and diversity, and prepare themselves for the future challenges and opportunities.
Outcome.Outcome2: In the first place, children are free to do whatever they want to do, they are not restricted and their limitations are really rare. because they are in the age of growth and they are allowed whatever they want to do to experience new stuffs. therefore there is no argument and punishment for them. for instance, children can play with their friends, explore their surroundings, learn new skills, express their creativity, and indulge their curiosity. they can also discover their interests, talents, and passions, and have fun without worrying about the consequences or responsibilities. these are some of the new stuffs that children can experience and enjoy. all in all, i would maintain that the best phase of people's life is their childhood. they not only free to do whatever they want without any confine or punishment, but also they are free and have a lot of time in their hands to try and experience new things and enjoy them.
Outcome.Outcome3: These are some of the reasons why childhood is such a wonderful and memorable stage of life for many people. children can explore their interests, learn new skills, and have fun without worrying about the consequences or the expectations of others. however, not all phases of life are as carefree and enjoyable as childhood. in fact, as people grow older, they face many challenges and responsibilities that can limit their freedom and happiness.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, childhood is a wonderful stage of life that offers many opportunities and benefits for people. children can explore the world with curiosity and creativity, without facing the pressures and responsibilities of adulthood. they can also enjoy the love and support of their families and friends, and have fun with their hobbies and interests. therefore, i suggest that we should cherish and appreciate our childhood memories, and also respect and encourage the children around us to pursue their dreams and passions. by doing so, we can foster a positive and healthy attitude towards life and learning, and also contribute to the happiness and well-being of our society.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, as children grow older, they face more challenges and responsibilities that limit their freedom and choices. they have to study hard, obey rules, follow social norms, and deal with various problems and pressures. they may also lose some of their innocence, curiosity, and joy as they encounter the realities and difficulties of life. therefore, many people look back at their childhood with nostalgia and wish they could relive those carefree and happy days.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, this freedom and flexibility that children enjoy may not last forever. as they grow older, they face more challenges and responsibilities that require them to follow rules, norms, and expectations. they may also encounter difficulties, conflicts, and pressures that affect their happiness and well-being. therefore, childhood is a precious and unique stage of life that should be cherished and appreciated.

Context.Left: With the development of technology, whether or not it is still necessary to protect the traditional skills and lifestyles leads to a drastic controversy which is becoming a public concern, especially considering the significant impact taken by technology. As far as I am concerned, the importance of traditions should be valued and paid attention to.
Context.Right: Some people who hold different viewpoints may advocate that protecting traditions consume too much financial budget compared with the incoming it takes. In spite of the fact this kind of business bring limited contribution to government finance, it should be emphasized that the expense is trivial compared with the potential value of traditions. Therefore the government authorities and education institutes should work closely together to promote the traditional skills and ways of life, so as to make people to realize the value of them.

Prompt.Prompt1: Determine the main argument of the left text and restate it in a clear thesis statement.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples of traditional skills and lifestyles that are endangered by technology and explain why they are valuable.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from the left text to the right text smooth. Acknowledge the opposing view and state your counter-argument.
Prompt.Prompt4: Support your counter-argument with some evidence or statistics that show the benefits of protecting traditions for the society and culture.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: However, not everyone agrees with the view that traditional skills and lifestyles are essential and need to be protected. some people argue that they are outdated and irrelevant in the modern world, and that they waste resources that could be better used for other purposes. they contend that protecting traditions does not generate much income or benefit for the society, and that it only serves the interests of a few nostalgic or sentimental groups. this paragraph will examine this argument and show why it is flawed and unconvincing.
Outcome.Outcome2: Traditional skills and lifestyles are not only the heritage of a nation or a culture, but also the source of inspiration and creativity for the present and the future. however, many of them are facing the threat of extinction due to the rapid development of technology, which often replaces or marginalizes them. for instance, the craftsmanship of pottery, weaving, carving, and embroidery, which reflect the aesthetic and artistic expression of different communities, are losing their market and appeal to the younger generations who prefer mass-produced or digital products. similarly, the lifestyles of nomads, farmers, hunters, and fishers, which are based on the harmony and adaptation to the natural environment, are being disrupted by the urbanization, industrialization, and globalization that impose new demands and challenges. these traditional skills and lifestyles are valuable because they enrich the diversity and identity of humanity, preserve the ecological and cultural balance, and offer alternative and sustainable ways of living and working.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, not everyone agrees with the necessity of preserving the traditional skills and lifestyles in the face of technological advancement. some people who hold different viewpoints may advocate that protecting traditions consume too much financial budget compared with the income it generates. they may argue that the government should prioritize more profitable and innovative sectors that can boost the economy and enhance the competitiveness of the country. moreover, they may claim that the traditional skills and lifestyles are outdated and irrelevant to the modern society and the needs of the people. these people may disregard the cultural and historical significance of the traditions and the diversity and richness they bring to the society.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, this argument overlooks the broader benefits of protecting traditions for the society and culture. traditions are not only a source of income, but also a way of preserving the identity, diversity and heritage of different groups and communities. according to a report by unesco, safeguarding intangible cultural heritage, such as traditional skills and lifestyles, can contribute to social cohesion, intercultural dialogue and sustainable development. moreover, traditions can also inspire creativity and innovation, as well as provide opportunities for learning and exchange. for example, a study by the smithsonian institution found that traditional crafts and arts, such as weaving, pottery and music, can enhance the cognitive, emotional and social skills of children and adults. therefore, protecting traditions is not a waste of resources, but a valuable investment for the future.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the main reasons why i believe that traditions should be valued and paid attention to is that they represent the cultural heritage and identity of a nation or a community. traditional skills and lifestyles are not only the products of historical accumulation and adaptation, but also the sources of inspiration and creativity for the present and the future generations. by protecting and preserving them, we can enrich our cultural diversity and promote mutual respect and understanding among different groups of people. moreover, traditional skills and lifestyles can also offer alternative solutions and perspectives to some of the challenges and problems that we face in the modern world, such as environmental degradation, social alienation, and spiritual emptiness.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, not everyone agrees with the necessity of protecting the traditional skills and lifestyles in the face of technological advancement. some people who hold different viewpoints may advocate that protecting traditions consume too much financial budget compared with the income it generates.

Outcome.Outcome1: Some people might argue that co-education, or the practice of educating boys and girls together, reduces their academic performance by creating distractions and conflicts. however, i believe that co-education has many advantages for both genders, such as enhancing their social skills, understanding, and motivation. in my opinion, boys and girls should study together in the sense that they have a chance to know each other and learn how to behave with an opposite sex. moreover, attending in the school having boys and girls might be beneficial for both to increase their motivation to study better. boys and girls will try to show their capabilities and abilities in the class, therefore they will study increasingly. indeed, boys do not like to seem weak in front of girls and vice versa. as a result, the productivity of the class will be increased.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the main advantages of co-education is that it can help students to know each other and learn how to behave with the opposite sex. for example, by studying together, boys and girls can develop their communication skills, respect, and empathy for different perspectives and experiences. they can also learn how to cooperate and collaborate in group projects, activities, and discussions. furthermore, co-education can expose students to a variety of role models and mentors from both genders, who can inspire and support them in their academic and personal goals. by interacting with the opposite sex in a friendly and respectful manner, students can also reduce their stereotypes, prejudices, and fears, and enhance their social and emotional intelligence.
Outcome.Outcome3: In my opinion, boys and girls should study together in the sense that they have a chance to know each other and learn how to behave with an opposite sex. moreover, attending in a school that has both boys and girls might be beneficial for both to increase their motivation to study better. boys and girls will try to show their capabilities and abilities in the class, therefore they will study increasingly. indeed, boys do not like to seem weak in front of girls and vice versa. as a result, the productivity of the class will be increased.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, co-educational schools can provide students with valuable opportunities to interact with the opposite gender and learn how to respect and cooperate with them. this can help them prepare for their future roles in society and enhance their personal development. i believe that boys and girls should study together, as this can also boost their academic performance by creating a positive and competitive environment. they will be motivated to impress each other and demonstrate their skills and knowledge, which will lead to higher productivity and quality of education.
Outcome.Outcome5: In addition to the opportunity to know each other and learn how to behave with an opposite sex, studying together in the same school can also have academic benefits for both boys and girls. by interacting with different perspectives and experiences, they can enrich their learning and develop their critical thinking and communication skills. moreover, attending in the school having boys and girls might be beneficial for both to increase their motivation to study better. boys and girls will try to show their capabilities and abilities in the class, therefore they will study increasingly. indeed, boys do not like to seem weak in front of girls and vice versa. as a result, the productivity of the class will be increased.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the reasons why boys and girls should study together is that they have a chance to know each other and learn how to behave with an opposite sex. this can help them to develop their social and emotional skills, as well as to respect and appreciate the diversity of perspectives and experiences that each gender can offer. furthermore, studying with the opposite sex can also foster a healthy and positive competition that can boost their academic performance.

Outcome.Outcome1: Exercise can be a powerful tool for coping with stress, as it can improve both physical and mental well-being. when we exercise, our body releases endorphins, which are natural chemicals that enhance our mood and reduce pain. exercise can also help us relax, distract us from negative thoughts, and increase our self-confidence and self-esteem. by exercising regularly, we can lower our blood pressure, strengthen our immune system, and prevent chronic diseases that can worsen our stress levels. therefore, exercise is not only a way to reduce stress, but also a way to promote our overall health and happiness.

Context.Right: Admittedly, the ability to adapt oneself to the new environment has been proven to be part of job. This ability is helpful in communicating with other workmates, cooperating with other workers needs this ability, too. But working alone is a longer-term job than communicating, that is, the ability of adapting oneself to a new environment may be necessary for a fresh worker, but the excellent knowledge of this job will be benefit till one leave.

Outcome.Outcome1: Many people think that the most important skill for a successful career is the ability to adapt oneself to the new environment. they believe that this skill is essential for building good relationships with colleagues and customers, and for adjusting to different situations and challenges. however, i disagree with this view and argue that working alone is a more valuable and lasting skill than adapting to the environment. in this essay, i will explain why working alone is a longer-term job than communicating, and why the excellent knowledge of this job will benefit one till one leaves.
Outcome.Outcome2: The ability to adapt oneself to the new environment is part of the job because it enables one to perform better and achieve the goals of the organization. for example, a worker who can adjust to different cultures, expectations, and norms of the workplace can build rapport with colleagues, clients, and stakeholders, and avoid misunderstandings and conflicts. moreover, a worker who can adapt to changing situations, such as new technologies, policies, or challenges, can demonstrate flexibility, creativity, and resilience, and cope with stress and uncertainty. therefore, the ability to adapt oneself to the new environment is a valuable skill that can enhance one's professional development and career prospects.
Outcome.Outcome3: Admittedly, the ability to adapt oneself to the new environment has been proven to be part of job. this ability is helpful in communicating with other workmates, cooperating with other workers needs this ability, too. however, adapting to the environment is not enough to ensure success in one's career. working alone is a longer-term job than communicating, that is, the ability of adapting oneself to a new environment may be necessary for a fresh worker, but the excellent knowledge of this job will be benefit till one leave. therefore, one should not neglect the importance of developing one's skills and expertise in the field, as they are the foundation of one's performance and reputation.
Outcome.Outcome4: Although adapting to a new environment is important for communication and cooperation, working alone has its own advantages for a job. working alone allows one to focus on the tasks at hand, develop one's skills and expertise, and avoid distractions and conflicts that may arise from teamwork. working alone also requires a high level of knowledge of the job, as one has to rely on oneself to solve problems, make decisions, and manage time. therefore, working alone is a more lasting and rewarding aspect of a job than adapting to a new environment, which may be temporary and superficial. however, working alone does not mean isolating oneself from others, as one still needs to communicate and cooperate with other workers when necessary, and learn from their feedback and suggestions. thus, a balance between working alone and working with others is essential for a successful career.
Outcome.Outcome5: Admittedly, the ability to adapt oneself to the new environment has been proven to be part of job. this ability is helpful in communicating with other workmates, cooperating with other workers needs this ability, too. however, adapting to the surroundings is not the only skill that matters in the workplace. working alone is a longer-term job than communicating, that is, the ability of adapting oneself to a new environment may be necessary for a fresh worker, but the excellent knowledge of this job will be benefit till one leave. therefore, one should not neglect the importance of mastering the professional and technical aspects of one's role, as they are the basis of one's performance and reputation.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, the ability to adapt oneself to the new environment is not the only factor that determines one's success in a job. in fact, it may be less important than having the relevant skills and knowledge that are required for the specific tasks and challenges that one faces in the workplace. working alone, for instance, demands a high level of self-discipline, motivation, and problem-solving skills, which cannot be easily acquired or replaced by being adaptable. therefore, while being adaptable is a valuable quality, it should not overshadow the need for professional competence and expertise.

Context.Right: First, attending a live football match is very fulfilling. Before the match starts, thousands of fans gathering outside of the stadium with team flags, colorful outfits, sound of trumpets and rattles... everywhere. As the game kicks off, the atmosphere inside the stadium is even more exciting. You are watching football stars play the game with your own eyes and sharing your feelings with about 4, people at the stadium, such an excitement you can never have when you are watching it at home. Everybody yells and sings together, the stadium is like bursted out whenever a goal is scored. See, you will be bored if you are watching it alone.

Prompt.Prompt1: Talk more about the benefits of attending a live football match.
Prompt.Prompt2: Elaborate on how attending a live football match can enhance your appreciation of the sport and the players.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from the benefits of attending a live football match to the drawbacks of watching it at home smooth.
Prompt.Prompt4: Explain why watching football at home can be less satisfying and enjoyable than attending a live match.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Attending a live football match is not only fulfilling, but also beneficial for your health and well-being. when you are at the stadium, you are exercising your body and mind by cheering, clapping, jumping and dancing. you are also releasing stress and tension by expressing your emotions freely and loudly. moreover, you are socializing with other fans who share your passion and enthusiasm for the game. you can make new friends, learn from each other and have fun together. attending a live football match is a great way to enjoy yourself and improve your mood.
Outcome.Outcome2: Attending a live football match is not only fulfilling, but also enlightening. you can witness the skills, tactics, and passion of the players on the pitch, as well as the strategies and decisions of the coaches on the sidelines. you can also learn from the reactions and opinions of other fans, who may have different perspectives and insights on the game. by being part of the crowd, you can feel the emotions and energy of the sport, and appreciate its beauty and drama. watching a live football match can enrich your understanding and enjoyment of the game, and make you a more informed and enthusiastic fan.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, attending a live football match is not always the best option for football fans. there are some disadvantages that you should consider before buying a ticket to the stadium. watching it at home, on the other hand, has some benefits that you might appreciate more.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, watching football at home can be less satisfying and enjoyable than attending a live match for several reasons. first of all, you may not be able to feel the same level of passion and enthusiasm that the fans at the stadium have. you may miss out on the chants, the cheers, the boos, and the emotions that create a unique atmosphere for the game. secondly, you may not be able to see the details of the players' skills, movements, and tactics that make football a fascinating sport. you may only rely on the camera angles, the commentators, and the replays that may not capture everything that happens on the pitch. thirdly, you may be distracted by other things at home, such as your phone, your family, your pets, or your chores. you may not be able to focus on the game and enjoy it fully. therefore, watching football at home can be less satisfying and enjoyable than attending a live match.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, watching a live football match also has some disadvantages compared to watching it at home. for example, you have to pay for the tickets, transportation, food and drinks, which can be quite expensive. you also have to endure the traffic jams, the crowds, the noise and the weather conditions, which can be unpleasant or even dangerous. moreover, you may not have a good view of the whole pitch or the replays, or you may miss some important details or commentary. therefore, watching a live football match is not always the best option for every fan.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, attending a live football match also has some drawbacks that you should consider before buying a ticket. for instance, you may have to deal with traffic jams, parking problems, long queues, high prices, bad weather, or rude fans. moreover, you may not be able to see the game clearly from your seat, especially if it is far from the pitch or blocked by other spectators. you may also miss some important details or replays that are shown on tv. furthermore, you may have to endure noisy or biased commentary, annoying advertisements, or technical glitches that interrupt the broadcast. therefore, watching a football match at home can also be enjoyable and comfortable.

Outcome.Outcome1: Many successful people attribute their achievements to their willingness to try new things and learn from their experiences. trying new things can help them develop new skills, discover new opportunities, and overcome challenges. moreover, trying new things can expose them to different perspectives and situations that can enrich their knowledge and understanding of themselves and others. for instance, one way to try something new and learn how to communicate effectively with people is to engage in salesmanship in various settings.
Outcome.Outcome2: Trying new things can also help successful people to discover their talents and passions, and to pursue their goals with more confidence and enthusiasm. for example, oprah winfrey, one of the most influential and wealthy media personalities in the world, started her career as a news anchor and reporter, but she was not satisfied with that role. she decided to try something new and host a talk show, which turned out to be a huge success and launched her into stardom. by trying something new, she found her true calling and used her skills and charisma to inspire millions of people around the world.
Outcome.Outcome3: Trying new things can help develop skills, knowledge, and confidence that are essential for success in various aspects of life. by venturing outside of your comfort zone and exploring new possibilities, you can discover your strengths and weaknesses, learn from your mistakes and feedback, and expand your horizons and perspectives. for instance, by trying something new like salesmanship, you can improve your communication, negotiation, and persuasion skills, which are vital for building relationships, influencing others, and achieving goals. you can also gain insights into human psychology, market trends, and customer needs, which can enhance your analytical, creative, and problem-solving abilities. moreover, by trying something new like salesmanship, you can boost your confidence and self-esteem, as you overcome challenges, adapt to changes, and celebrate your achievements. therefore, trying new things can be a valuable source of learning and growth that can help you succeed in different situations and jobs in the future.
Outcome.Outcome4: Trying new things can help successful people learn valuable skills and insights that books cannot always provide. by venturing out of their comfort zone and taking on new challenges, they can gain practical knowledge and experience that can benefit them in their future endeavors. one example of such a challenge is salesmanship, which can teach them how to communicate effectively with different types of people. however, salesmanship is not the only way to try something new and learn from it. there are many other opportunities and activities that can offer similar benefits. in the next paragraph, we will explore some of these alternatives and how they can enrich the lives of successful people.
Outcome.Outcome5: Trying new things can not only enrich one's life, but also provide valuable lessons for success. there are always interesting and useful experiences that successful people can learn them only by trying new things. for example, if you want to know how to act effectively when communicating with people, you can try something new like salesmanship in various stores and places. by selling goods or other services, you will face different people with different behaviors and personalities and as a result you will learn how to behave people in different situations and jobs in the future. these experiences can only be obtained by trying new things and cant be always found in books. therefore, it is important to be open-minded and adventurous and to seize every opportunity to explore new possibilities and challenges. by doing so, one can develop new skills, gain new insights, and enhance one's confidence and creativity.
Outcome.Outcome6: Trying new things can not only help successful people to learn valuable skills, but also to discover new opportunities and possibilities for their personal and professional growth. for example, by working as a salesperson, one might find out that they have a talent or a passion for a certain field or industry, or that they can use their communication skills to network and build relationships with potential customers, partners, or mentors. these opportunities and possibilities can open new doors and paths for one's career and life, and can also increase one's confidence and self-esteem. therefore, trying new things can be a rewarding and enriching way to expand one's horizons and potentials.

Outcome.Outcome1: This trend of increasing educational opportunities is evident in the data from various sources. according to the world bank, the global gross enrollment ratio for tertiary education, which measures the number of students enrolled in higher education as a percentage of the relevant age group, rose from 19% in 2000 to 38% in 2018. similarly, the unesco institute for statistics reported that the number of students enrolled in higher education worldwide increased from 100 million in 2000 to 220 million in 2018. these figures show that more and more people have access to university education, which can enhance their knowledge, skills and career prospects.
Outcome.Outcome2: The opportunity to receive education from university has increased significantly for each generation of my family, and this has also improved our career prospects and choices. while my grandparents had limited access to education and had to work in low-skilled jobs, my parents were able to attend college and pursue professional careers in various fields. they also encouraged me to study hard and explore my interests, and supported me with their knowledge and experience. as a result, i was able to enroll in a prestigious university and pursue my dream of becoming a lawyer.

Outcome.Outcome4: Not only can our parents and other family members help us in our life, but they can also help us in our career. since they have received better education than the previous generations, they can offer us valuable advices and guidance in our professional development. they can share their experiences and insights with us, help us explore our interests and potentials, and support us in pursuing our goals. for example, my parents encouraged me to apply for a scholarship to study abroad, and they helped me prepare for the application and the interview. they also gave me useful tips on how to adapt to a new culture and environment. because of their help, i was able to achieve my dream of studying in a prestigious university.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, having more educated parents and family members can be a great advantage for us in pursuing our academic and career goals. they can not only offer us valuable advice and guidance, but also support us emotionally and financially. they can also share their experiences and insights with us, and help us avoid some mistakes and pitfalls. we can learn from their wisdom and achievements, and benefit from their networks and resources.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, having parents who received higher education than their grandparents did is a great advantage for us. they can not only offer us more guidance and support in our career, but also enrich our knowledge and broaden our horizons. they can share their experiences and insights with us, and encourage us to pursue our dreams and goals.

Context.Left: In my family, the argument topic between my father and mother always involves my father's job. Five years ago, he quitted his 2 years job as an architectural engineer, and became a landscape painter. Every time I asked him why, he will say, seriously," I am done, doing this same work for 2 years and I really want to try some different, that is all." While there are innumerous people will deem it ridiculous and argue doing the same task is the meaning of job, but from my perspective, I am on the side of my father.
Context.Right: Doing different tasks makes employees and employers much happier. Workers, who work for an ordinary company or industry, will be sick of same tasks day by day. Although they can be familiar with their job, changing of job is what serve to their happier. Changing the type of work will be fresh and elicit their potential to adapt a new environment, which, according to psychology theories, makes workers relaxed and happier. To set another example, consider every workers have ability to do several kinds of work, employers will be satisfied by the generating benefits. They both will be happy because the change of job, not the same task day by day.

Prompt.Prompt1: State your thesis statement that summarizes the main idea of your argument.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some background information on the topic of landscape painting and architectural engineering, and why they are different fields of work.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain how your father's decision to switch his career reflects his personal values and preferences, and how it affected your family life.
Prompt.Prompt4: Support your claim with evidence from psychology theories and examples of how changing the type of work can improve workers' happiness and productivity.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: My father's decision to quit his stable job and pursue his passion for painting may seem irrational and irresponsible to some people, but i believe he made a wise choice that improved his happiness and well-being. in fact, i think doing different tasks rather than the same task every day is beneficial for both employees and employers, as it can enhance their creativity, motivation, and satisfaction. this is the main idea of my argument, which i will support with evidence and examples in the following paragraphs.
Outcome.Outcome2: Landscape painting and architectural engineering are very different fields of work, requiring different skills, knowledge, and creativity. landscape painting is a form of art that captures the natural scenery and beauty of the environment, often using various techniques and materials to express the artist's vision and feelings. architectural engineering, on the other hand, is a form of engineering that applies scientific and technical principles to design, construct, and maintain buildings and structures, often following strict codes and standards to ensure safety and functionality. while both fields can be rewarding and challenging, they also have different demands and expectations from the workers and the society.
Outcome.Outcome3: My father's decision to switch his career from an architectural engineer to a landscape painter was not a rash or impulsive one, but a reflection of his personal values and preferences. he had always loved painting and nature, and he felt that he had reached a point in his life where he wanted to pursue his passion and creativity, rather than continue doing the same work for 20 years. he believed that doing different tasks would make him happier and more fulfilled, and he was willing to take the risk and face the challenges of changing his profession. however, his choice also affected our family life in various ways. my mother, who had supported him for so long, was worried about our financial stability and his future prospects. she often argued with him about his job, and tried to persuade him to go back to engineering or find a more stable and lucrative occupation. i, on the other hand, admired his courage and determination, and supported his dream. i also enjoyed seeing his paintings and learning from his artistic skills and insights. i understood that doing different tasks was not only a matter of personal happiness, but also a way of learning, growing, and expressing oneself.
Outcome.Outcome4: My father's decision to pursue his passion for painting reflects a psychological need for variety and challenge in his work. according to the self-determination theory, people are motivated by three basic psychological needs: autonomy, competence, and relatedness. autonomy refers to the sense of having control and choice over one's actions, competence refers to the sense of being able to master one's skills and tasks, and relatedness refers to the sense of belonging and connection with others. doing the same task for 20 years can undermine these needs, especially autonomy and competence, and lead to boredom, frustration, and dissatisfaction. on the other hand, doing different tasks can enhance these needs, especially autonomy and competence, and lead to curiosity, interest, and satisfaction. for example, a study by wrzesniewski and dutton (2001) found that hospital cleaners who crafted their jobs by adding variety and meaning to their tasks reported higher levels of motivation, well-being, and performance than those who followed the prescribed routines. similarly, a study by grant and parker (2009) found that job crafting, or the proactive shaping of one's job to align with one's values, strengths, and passions, increased employees' happiness, engagement, and productivity. therefore, doing different tasks can make employees and employers much happier, as they can experience more autonomy, competence, and relatedness in their work.
Outcome.Outcome5: My father's decision to pursue a different career path was not only a personal choice, but also a reflection of a broader trend in the modern workplace. many studies and surveys have shown that doing different tasks makes employees and employers much happier, as they can avoid boredom, burnout, and stagnation. (connect the left text and the right text by linking the father's example to the general claim)
Outcome.Outcome6: My father's decision to pursue a different career path may seem irrational to some, but it reflects his desire for more variety and creativity in his work. he is not alone in this preference, as many studies have shown that doing different tasks can enhance the well-being and performance of both employees and employers. here are some of the reasons why doing different tasks makes them much happier.

Context.Right: To begin with, it is vital that professors should assist students to acquire knowledge. The professors duty is to nurture students, and prepare excellent courses. If professors spend a lot of time on research, he will cut the time on preparing courses is reduced, which may decrease the quality of classes. The reason why people enter a university is that they want to learn cutting-edged technologies. In this way, professors should provide well-preparation courses to convey the state-of-art knowledge for college and university students. Therefore, professors should pay more attention on how to teach students rather than conduct research.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of whether professors should focus more on teaching or research in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some statistics or evidence to support your claim that professors' research activities may affect their teaching quality.
Prompt.Prompt3: Acknowledge the possible benefits of professors' research for students and society in the second paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize your main points and restate your position in the concluding paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the debates in higher education is whether professors should focus more on teaching or research. some people argue that teaching is the primary responsibility of professors, as they are expected to impart knowledge and skills to their students. others contend that research is equally or more important, as it contributes to the advancement of science and society. this essay will examine both sides of this issue and present some arguments for and against each position. to begin with, it is vital that professors should assist students to acquire knowledge. the professors duty is to nurture students, and prepare excellent courses. if professors spend a lot of time on research, he will cut the time on preparing courses is reduced, which may decrease the quality of classes. the reason why people enter a university is that they want to learn cutting-edged technologies. in this way, professors should provide well-preparation courses to convey the state-of-art knowledge for college and university students. therefore, professors should pay more attention on how to teach students rather than conduct research.
Outcome.Outcome2: There is empirical evidence that professors' research activities may affect their teaching quality negatively. for example, a study by hattie and marsh (1996) found that there was a negative relationship between research productivity and teaching effectiveness across 58 studies involving more than 13,000 academics. they suggested that research and teaching compete for the limited time and resources of professors, and that the reward system in academia favors research over teaching. another study by stack (2016) examined the impact of research grants on teaching evaluations of 1,300 professors in canada. he found that professors who received more research funding had lower teaching ratings than those who received less or none, and that this effect was stronger for junior than senior professors. these studies indicate that professors' research activities may compromise their ability or motivation to provide well-preparation courses to their students.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, this does not mean that professors' research has no value or relevance for students and society. on the contrary, professors' research can also enhance their teaching by bringing new insights, perspectives, and discoveries to the classroom. moreover, professors' research can contribute to the advancement of science, technology, culture, and public policy, which can benefit the wider community and address global challenges. therefore, professors' research can also be seen as a form of service and responsibility to their academic fields and society.
Outcome.Outcome4: In conclusion, i believe that professors should focus more on teaching students than on conducting research. teaching is the primary responsibility of professors, and it requires them to design high-quality courses that impart the latest knowledge and skills to students. research, on the other hand, may distract professors from their educational mission and compromise the effectiveness of their instruction. by prioritizing teaching over research, professors can better fulfill their role as educators and mentors for the next generation of scholars and professionals.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, some people may argue that professors should also focus on research, as it is an essential part of their academic career and contribution to society. they may claim that research can help professors update their knowledge, discover new insights, and enhance their reputation and influence in their fields. moreover, research can also benefit students, as they can learn from their professors' findings, participate in research projects, and develop their critical thinking and problem-solving skills. thus, research is not a distraction, but a complement to teaching, and professors should balance both aspects of their work.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, teaching students effectively is not the only responsibility of professors. research is also an essential part of their academic work, and it can benefit both themselves and their students in various ways.

Context.Left: Lastly, in the area of trade, no one can deny that poorer countries are lagging behind richer countries due to shortage of money. Trading are less active in poorer countries may also be caused by incomplete transportation infrastructure. For example, residents in rural areas still depend on their own farm for food production. As a token of goodwill, richer nations can provide financial service to poorer countries to encourage trading. The former can also give consultation on setting up a complete and efficient transportation infrastructure to support trading.

Prompt.Prompt1: Elaborate on the reasons why poorer countries are lagging behind richer countries in trade.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some statistics or examples to support your claim that trading is less active in poorer countries due to shortage of money and incomplete transportation infrastructure.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain how financial service and consultation from richer countries can help poorer countries to improve their trading activities and outcomes.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize the main points of your argument and restate your thesis statement in a different way.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the reasons why poorer countries are lagging behind richer countries in trade is that they lack the resources and skills to produce competitive goods and services that can meet the demand and standards of the global market. poorer countries often face challenges such as low productivity, limited innovation, weak institutions, and environmental degradation that hamper their economic development and diversification. richer countries, on the other hand, have more access to capital, technology, education, and research that enable them to create and maintain a comparative advantage in various sectors. therefore, poorer countries need not only financial assistance, but also technical assistance and capacity building from richer countries to improve their trade performance and potential.
Outcome.Outcome2: This situation of low trading activity in poorer countries has negative impacts on their economic development and poverty reduction. according to the world bank, the average trade-to-gdp ratio of low-income countries was only 47% in 2019, compared to 72% for high-income countries. this means that low-income countries are less integrated into the global market and have fewer opportunities to benefit from trade. moreover, incomplete transportation infrastructure hinders the movement of goods and people within and across borders, increasing the costs and risks of doing business. for instance, a study by the african development bank found that the average cost of transporting a container from mombasa to kampala was $2,500, more than twice the cost of shipping the same container from shanghai to mombasa. these factors limit the potential of trade to generate income, employment, and growth for poorer countries.
Outcome.Outcome3: By providing financial service and consultation, richer countries can help poorer countries to improve their trading activities and outcomes in several ways. first, financial service can enable poorer countries to access credit, insurance, and savings that can facilitate their participation in domestic and international markets. this can help them to diversify their products, increase their competitiveness, and reduce their vulnerability to shocks. second, consultation can help poorer countries to design and implement a complete and efficient transportation infrastructure that can support trading. this can help them to lower their transport costs, expand their market access, and enhance their connectivity. therefore, financial service and consultation from richer countries can be beneficial for both the development and the integration of poorer countries in the area of trade.
Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, it is clear that richer nations have a moral obligation to help poorer countries in terms of health, education and trade. by sharing their resources, expertise and technology, they can contribute to the well-being and development of the less fortunate nations. this will not only reduce the gap between rich and poor, but also promote global peace and cooperation. therefore, i strongly agree that the developed world should assist the developing world in various ways.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, it is clear that richer nations have a responsibility to help poorer nations in various aspects, such as education, health, and trade. by doing so, they can not only contribute to the global development and stability, but also foster a more equitable and harmonious world. however, the assistance from richer nations should not be imposed or exploited, but rather based on mutual respect and cooperation. poorer nations should also strive to improve their own capacities and potentials, and not rely solely on external aid. only then, can the gap between the rich and the poor be narrowed and the benefits of globalization be shared by all.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, trade is not the only aspect of development that poorer countries need to improve. another crucial factor is education, which can empower people to acquire skills, knowledge, and opportunities for a better future. unfortunately, many poorer countries face challenges in providing quality and accessible education for their citizens, especially for girls and marginalized groups.

Context.Left: Second, this generation is encountering the self-recognition issue which could not be experienced by the previous generation. The past generation was given less freedom and was usually asked to follow the paths their parents had prepared for them. In contrast, young people in this generation are exposed to more creative ideas and rather think individually. They are eager for finding who they are and what they really want. It is fortunate that they can struggle with these sweet worries and these worries are indeed never easy for them. They have to make decisions between so many possibilities and they are responsible for taking the consequences.

Outcome.Outcome1: However, the process of self-recognition is not without difficulties and challenges for this generation. they face various pressures and uncertainties from the society, the market, and themselves. they have to deal with the rapid changes and the fierce competition in the globalized world. they have to balance their personal interests and passions with their social expectations and obligations. they have to cope with the conflicts and contradictions between their diverse identities and values. they have to find their own voice and place in the complex and dynamic environment.
Outcome.Outcome2: This generation is exposed to creative ideas and individual thinking through various channels, such as the internet, social media, education, and entertainment. they can access diverse information, opinions, and perspectives from different sources and cultures, and they can express themselves in various ways, such as blogging, vlogging, podcasting, or art. they can also pursue their interests and passions, whether it is entrepreneurship, activism, travel, or spirituality, and they can challenge the norms and expectations of society. these opportunities and choices are different from the past generation, who had limited access to information and expression, and who had to conform to the traditional roles and values of their parents and communities.
Outcome.Outcome3: Having more freedom and possibilities in choosing their paths can be both a blessing and a curse for this generation. on the one hand, it can foster their creativity, individuality, and self-expression, as they can pursue their passions and interests without being constrained by external expectations or traditions. on the other hand, it can also create anxiety, confusion, and doubt, as they can face the paradox of choice and the fear of missing out. they may struggle to find their identity, purpose, and direction in a complex and competitive world, and they may question whether they have made the right decisions or whether they could have done better. therefore, it is important for them to balance their freedom and possibilities with their motivation and satisfaction, and to seek guidance, support, and feedback from others when needed.
Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, this essay has discussed how the current generation of young people is facing different challenges and opportunities than their predecessors. it has argued that they have to cope with the rapid changes in the society and the world, as well as the self-recognition issue that requires them to make choices and express their individuality. the essay has also suggested that they can benefit from the diversity and creativity of their generation, as well as the support and guidance of their elders. the thesis statement of this essay is that this generation is not lost, but rather exploring and discovering their potential and identity in a complex and dynamic environment.
Outcome.Outcome5: These two factors, the rapid change of society and the self-recognition issue, have a significant impact on the psychological state of this generation. on the one hand, they face the pressure of adapting to the new environment and the uncertainty of the future. on the other hand, they pursue their own identity and values in a diverse and complex world. therefore, they may experience various emotions such as anxiety, confusion, frustration, or excitement.
Outcome.Outcome6: These two factors, the rapid changes in society and the self-recognition issue, pose both challenges and opportunities for the young generation. on the one hand, they have to cope with the uncertainty and complexity of the world and adapt to the new demands and expectations of the market and the society. on the other hand, they have the chance to explore their own talents and passions and pursue their own goals and dreams. they have more freedom and creativity than their predecessors, but also more responsibility and pressure.

Context.Left: Technology, in the past two hundred years, has taken a dramatic progress in many fields of our society, such as telecommunications, manufacturing and buildings, etc. Certainly, technologies have also contributed to the great change of our daily lives. However, today some people consider that the range of technology regarding of public has a negative effect on increasing the gap between rich and poor. Personally, I find it hard for me to agree with this opinion by the following reasons.
Context.Right: Secondly, technical developments improve productivity, which help people to escape from daily chores, and invest more time and energy in studying and living a more meaningful life. With the development of Internet, we can enjoy the pleasure and conveniences which it brings about for us every day. In the past time, we had to spend a lot of time searching information and waiting for letters of our friends who lived far away from us. Nowadays, we can talk with our friends online, no matter where we are and how far between us. In addition, the Internet gives everyone access to the same information, this therefore leads to greater equality between individuals.

Prompt.Prompt1: Elaborate on the benefits of technology for public in terms of telecommunications, manufacturing and buildings.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples of how technology has reduced the cost and increased the quality of these fields.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain how these improvements have a positive effect on the living standards and opportunities of both rich and poor people.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add a connecting sentence that summarizes the main argument of the paragraph and links it to the next one.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the benefits of technology for public is that it enhances the quality and efficiency of telecommunications, manufacturing and buildings. for example, technology enables us to communicate faster and cheaper with people across the world, using various devices and platforms, such as mobile phones, email, social media, and video conferencing. technology also allows us to produce more goods and services with less resources and waste, using automation, robotics, artificial intelligence, and green technologies. furthermore, technology improves the design and construction of buildings, making them more safe, comfortable, and sustainable, using advanced materials, engineering, and architecture. these technological innovations not only benefit the public by providing them with more options and opportunities, but also by creating more jobs and income for the workers and entrepreneurs involved in these sectors.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the reasons why i disagree with the opinion that technology has a negative effect on increasing the gap between rich and poor is that technology has reduced the cost and increased the quality of many fields that are essential for human well-being and development. for example, technology has enabled the production of cheaper and more efficient energy sources, such as solar and wind power, which can benefit both the environment and the people who rely on them. technology has also improved the health care system, by providing more advanced and accessible diagnostic and treatment methods, such as telemedicine and artificial intelligence, which can save lives and reduce inequalities. technology has also enhanced the education sector, by offering more diverse and flexible learning opportunities, such as online courses and digital libraries, which can increase the access and quality of education for people from different backgrounds and locations. these are just some of the examples of how technology has contributed to the improvement of various fields that affect our daily lives.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the reasons why i disagree with the view that technology widens the gap between rich and poor is that it has a positive effect on the living standards and opportunities of both groups. for example, technological innovations in health care, education, transportation and entertainment have increased the quality and quantity of services and products that people can access and enjoy. these improvements not only benefit the wealthy, but also the poor, who can benefit from lower costs, higher efficiency and more choices. furthermore, technology can empower the poor by providing them with tools and platforms to communicate, learn, work and participate in social and economic activities. technology can also help to reduce poverty and inequality by creating new markets, jobs and income sources for the poor, as well as by enhancing their skills and capabilities. therefore, technology can be seen as a positive force that can improve the well-being and opportunities of both rich and poor people.
Outcome.Outcome4: First of all, i believe that technology is not the main cause of the gap between rich and poor, but rather a tool that can be used for different purposes. technology itself does not create inequality, but it depends on how people use it, and how the society distributes its benefits and costs. for example, some technologies can help to reduce poverty, improve health and education, and empower marginalized groups, while others can be used to exploit, oppress, and exclude people. therefore, the problem is not technology, but the social and economic system that shapes its development and application. secondly, technical developments improve productivity, which help people to escape from daily chores, and invest more time and energy in studying and living a more meaningful life. with the development of internet, we can enjoy the pleasure and conveniences which it brings about for us every day. in the past time, we had to spend a lot of time searching information and waiting for letters of our friends who lived far away from us. nowadays, we can talk with our friends online, no matter where we are and how far between us. in addition, the internet gives everyone access to the same information, this therefore leads to greater equality between individuals.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the reasons why i disagree with the opinion that technology widens the gap between rich and poor is that technology provides more opportunities for education and innovation. technology enables people to access various sources of knowledge and skills, such as online courses, e-books, podcasts, and digital tools. these resources can help people to enhance their human capital and creativity, and to pursue their personal and professional goals. furthermore, technology fosters a culture of entrepreneurship and collaboration, where people can create new products and services, and share their ideas and solutions with others. technology, therefore, can empower people to overcome the barriers of distance, time, and cost, and to participate in the global economy and society.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the reasons why i disagree with the opinion that technology increases the gap between rich and poor is that technology can actually reduce the costs of many goods and services that are essential for human well-being. for example, thanks to technology, we can enjoy cheaper and more efficient health care, education, transportation and communication, which can enhance our quality of life and opportunities. technology can also create new markets and industries that can generate more income and employment for people from different backgrounds and skills. therefore, technology can be a powerful tool for social and economic development, rather than a source of division and exclusion.

Context.Left: Education is undeniably pivotal for an individual. Although, it is agreed that learning by watching TV is more effective to some children, I find it difficult not to oppose against the idea of having students spend more time on TVs. The reason for this is traditional education has its stand for most appropriate method. Thus, physical inactivity should not be encouraged for the aim of bettering youngsters' skills.
Context.Right: Secondly, watching television is a very passive action and should not be promoted by increasing periods spent on it. On the other hand, children who have had such activities that interrelate to creativity, cooperation, competition tend to perform significantly better in general terms. For instance, a conducted experiment indicates out-performance in skills like differentiate types of plants or animals of a child that experienced various activities in nature to a child spent most of his time watching documentaries. As a result, such activities can equip a child necessary skill that is useful for his future career.

Prompt.Prompt1: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from the thesis statement to the first argument smooth.
Prompt.Prompt2: Talk more about the benefits of traditional education and how it fosters critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Prompt.Prompt3: Provide some examples of traditional education methods that are effective for different types of learners.
Prompt.Prompt4: Elaborate on the drawbacks of watching TV for learning and how it can affect children's attention span and memory.
