Outcome.Outcome2: Studying at home by using technology is convenient. the biggest advantage is that your classroom and instructor are available 24 hours a day. in addition, you could make your own schedule for completing the requirements of the course. you can study any time you want. this flexibility allows you to balance your studies with your other commitments, such as work, family, or hobbies. you can also save time and money by avoiding the hassle of commuting, parking, or paying for campus facilities. furthermore, you can access a variety of online resources, such as videos, podcasts, or interactive quizzes, that can enhance your learning experience and cater to your preferred learning style.
Outcome.Outcome3: Studying at home by using technology is convenient. the biggest advantage is that your classroom and instructor are available 24 hours a day. in addition, you could make your own schedule for completing the requirements of the course. you can study any time you want. however, studying at home also poses some challenges that require discipline and motivation. for instance, you may face distractions from your family, friends, or other activities that could interfere with your focus and concentration. you may also lack the support and feedback from your peers and instructors that you would get in a traditional classroom setting. furthermore, you may encounter technical difficulties or problems with accessing the online materials or platforms that could delay your progress or affect your performance. therefore, you need to have a clear plan, a reliable device, and a suitable environment to overcome these obstacles and succeed in your online course.
Outcome.Outcome4: Studying at home by using technology has both advantages and disadvantages. on the one hand, it offers flexibility, convenience, and accessibility for learners who want to pursue their education at their own pace and place. on the other hand, it requires a high level of self-discipline, motivation, and organization to stay on track and meet the deadlines and expectations of the course. therefore, before enrolling in an online course, learners should carefully weigh the pros and cons and assess their own readiness and suitability for this mode of learning. studying at home by using technology can be a rewarding and effective way to learn, but only if the learner is prepared and committed to succeed.
Outcome.Outcome5: Studying at home by using technology is convenient, but it also requires a lot of self-discipline and motivation. the biggest advantage is that your classroom and instructor are available 24 hours a day, so you can access the materials and feedback whenever you need them. in addition, you could make your own schedule for completing the requirements of the course, which gives you more flexibility and control over your learning pace. however, this also means that you have to be responsible for managing your time and staying on track with the assignments and deadlines. if you aren't extremely dedicated or have good time management skills, it may be very difficult to complete a course at home, as you may face distractions, procrastination, or lack of support. therefore, before you enroll in an online course, you should consider your learning style, goals, and preferences, and make sure you have the necessary tools and strategies to succeed.
Outcome.Outcome6: Studying at home by using technology is convenient, but it also requires a lot of self-discipline and motivation. the biggest advantage is that your classroom and instructor are available 24 hours a day, so you can access the materials and feedback whenever you need them. however, this also means that you have to set your own deadlines and stick to them, as well as balance your other responsibilities and distractions. you can make your own schedule for completing the requirements of the course, but you also need to have good time management skills and avoid procrastination.

Outcome.Outcome1: Smoking is a harmful habit that not only affects the smokers themselves, but also the people around them who are exposed to the harmful effects of secondhand smoke. many countries and cities around the world have implemented laws and policies to ban smoking in public places, such as restaurants, offices, parks, and public transport, in order to protect the health and well-being of the non-smokers and the environment. i strongly agree with this measure and believe that it is a necessary and effective way to prevent the spread of lung-related diseases and to promote a healthier lifestyle for everyone. firstly, it is well known and clinically proven that smoking is extremely hazardous to the smoker and others who have been exposed to the fume over a period of time. recent death statistic released by the malaysian ministry of health shows that the top killer was lung related diseases caused by smoking. a large proportion of death involved second hand smoker particularly young children and pregnant women who were vulnerable to these lethal diseases. therefore, the number of fatality can be significantly reduced if a total ban on public smoking is implemented. to sum up, the effort to prohibit people from smoking in public area is certainly helping in curtailing the associated health risks and to create a healthy nation. it is hoped that more businesses and governments will follow the same initiatives for the interest of the people and the country.
Outcome.Outcome2: Banning smoking in public places is not only beneficial for the health of the smoker, but also for the health of the non-smoker. by reducing the exposure to secondhand smoke, the risk of developing respiratory infections, asthma, heart diseases, and cancers is lowered. moreover, banning smoking in public places can also encourage smokers to quit or reduce their consumption, which can improve their overall health and well-being. furthermore, banning smoking in public places can also protect the environment from the harmful effects of cigarette litter and air pollution. therefore, banning smoking in public places is a positive and effective measure to promote public health and safety.
Outcome.Outcome3: Besides the health benefits, banning public smoking also has positive impacts on the environment and the economy. according to the world health organization, smoking is a major contributor to air pollution and greenhouse gas emissions, which affect the climate and the quality of life. moreover, smoking imposes huge costs on the society, such as medical expenses, productivity losses, and fire damages. a study by the university of malaya estimated that the total economic cost of smoking in malaysia was about 4.8 billion ringgit in 2004, equivalent to 1.2% of the gross domestic product. by enforcing a total ban on public smoking, the government can save resources, promote green development, and enhance public welfare. (who, 2014; aljunid et al., 2009)
Outcome.Outcome4: Hence, a total ban on public smoking is not only justified but also necessary to protect the lives and well-being of both smokers and non-smokers. by enforcing this policy, the authorities can prevent the spread of harmful substances and diseases, as well as promote a cleaner and safer environment for everyone. moreover, a total ban on public smoking can also encourage smokers to quit or reduce their habit, which can benefit their health and save them money in the long run. therefore, i strongly urge all citizens to support and comply with this measure, and to persuade others to do the same. together, we can make a positive difference for ourselves and our future generations.
Outcome.Outcome5: In addition to the health benefits of banning public smoking, there are also other positive impacts that can be derived from this policy. for instance, it can help to reduce the environmental pollution caused by cigarette butts and ashes, which are often discarded carelessly on the streets and parks. furthermore, it can also improve the quality of life and comfort of non-smokers, who can enjoy public spaces without being exposed to the unpleasant smell and harmful effects of tobacco smoke. by respecting the rights of others to breathe clean air, smokers can also demonstrate their social responsibility and civic awareness.
Outcome.Outcome6: Besides the health benefits, a total ban on public smoking also has other positive impacts on the society and the environment. for instance, it can reduce the littering of cigarette butts and ashes, which are not only unsightly but also harmful to the wildlife and the water sources. moreover, it can improve the air quality and the comfort level of non-smokers, especially in enclosed or crowded spaces such as restaurants, buses, or cinemas. furthermore, it can encourage smokers to quit or reduce their habit, which can save them money and improve their well-being. thus, a total ban on public smoking can be seen as a win-win situation for everyone.

Outcome.Outcome1: Traffic overload is a common problem that plagues many big cities nowadays, as they can be described as melting pots of diverse cultures and lifestyles. the congestion and pollution caused by overpopulation have aroused the interest of many city planners, who seek to find effective ways to cope with this challenge. some of them argue that only if the demand to go out on the street is cut down can we solve the seemingly insurmountable issue of traffic gridlock. however, i have to profoundly disagree with this idea, for there are still two viable solutions besides this way. in this essay, i will discuss how the development of public transportation and the relocation of urban areas can help to alleviate the traffic overload in big cities.
Outcome.Outcome2: One possible solution to deal with traffic overload is to improve the public transportation system and encourage people to use it more often. by providing more frequent, reliable, and affordable buses, trains, or subways, city planners can reduce the reliance on private cars and motorcycles, which often clog the roads and cause pollution. moreover, by promoting the benefits of public transport, such as saving time, money, and energy, as well as reducing carbon footprint and stress, city planners can persuade more people to choose this mode of travel over driving. this way, the demand to go out on the street can be moderated without sacrificing the mobility and convenience of the urban dwellers.
Outcome.Outcome3: Another feasible solution to the problem of traffic overload in big cities is to make use of the urban areas that surround the city centers. by relocating some of the major attractions and institutions that draw people from far and wide to the outskirts of the city, we can reduce the need for long-distance commuting and create more balanced and diversified urban development. for example, if some of the large shopping malls or universities were moved to the suburban areas, they would not only serve the local residents but also attract new businesses and services that would create more employment opportunities and improve the quality of life. this would also ease the burden on the city facilities, such as public transport, roads, parking, water, and electricity, that are often strained by the high demand and limited supply. by creating more livable and accessible urban areas, we can also enhance the social and cultural diversity of the city and foster a sense of community and belonging among the residents.
Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, i have refuted the claim that reducing the demand to go out on the street is the only way to tackle the problem of traffic overload in big cities. instead, i have proposed two alternative solutions that can address the root causes of this issue: improving the public transportation system and decentralizing the urban areas. by implementing these solutions, not only can we ease the traffic congestion and enhance the mobility of the citizens, but also we can improve the quality of life and the environment in the city and the surrounding regions. therefore, i urge the city planners and the authorities to consider these options and take action to make our cities more livable and sustainable.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the viable solutions that i would like to propose is to improve the public transportation system. this means not only expanding the network of buses, subways, and trains, but also making them more affordable, convenient, and environmentally friendly. by doing so, we can encourage more people to use public transport instead of driving their own cars, which would reduce the emissions, congestion, and accidents on the road. moreover, public transport can also facilitate the mobility and accessibility of people who live or work in different parts of the city, thus enhancing the social and economic opportunities for them. another benefit of public transport is that it can foster a sense of community and diversity among the passengers, who come from different backgrounds and cultures. this leads me to the second solution, which is to make use of the urban areas.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the viable solutions that i would like to propose is to improve the public transportation system. it is undeniable that many people choose to drive their own cars or motorcycles because of the lack of convenience, safety, and affordability of the buses, trains, or subways. if the government could invest more in expanding and upgrading the public transportation network, providing more incentives and subsidies for the users, and enforcing stricter regulations and penalties for the private vehicle owners, it would encourage more people to switch to the more eco-friendly and efficient mode of transport. this would not only reduce the traffic congestion, but also the air pollution and noise level in the city.

Outcome.Outcome1: Standardized tests are assessments that measure the knowledge and skills of students based on a common set of criteria and objectives. they are widely used in education to evaluate the performance of students, teachers, and schools. however, there are different opinions on whether standardized tests are beneficial or detrimental for the quality of education. in this essay, i will argue that standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students, reduce bias and subjectivity, and provide feedback and accountability. firstly, standardized tests are preferable due to the fact that they help teachers to fairly grade the students. for example, some students are not so active on the lessons, because they are already familiar with the issue. therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. in addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.
Outcome.Outcome2: Standardized tests are widely used in many educational systems to measure the learning outcomes of students and compare their performance across different schools, regions, or countries. these tests are designed to assess the knowledge and skills of students in various subjects, such as math, science, language, or history, using a common set of questions and scoring criteria. by using standardized tests, educators can have some benefits for improving the quality and equity of education. for instance, they can:
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the main advantages of standardized tests is that they help teachers to fairly grade the students according to their actual knowledge and skills. standardized tests are designed to measure the students' mastery of the curriculum objectives and to compare their performance with a large sample of peers. this way, teachers can avoid bias and subjectivity in their assessment and ensure that the grades reflect the students' true academic achievement. for example, some students may not participate much in class discussions or activities, but they may have a deep understanding of the subject matter and perform well on the tests. conversely, some students may seem engaged and enthusiastic in class, but they may lack the necessary content knowledge or problem-solving skills to succeed on the tests. therefore, exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students. in addition, many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class, so the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, standardized tests are a beneficial tool for assessing students' knowledge and skills in a fair and consistent manner. they allow teachers to evaluate the students who may not participate much in class, but have a good grasp of the material. they also simplify the grading process for teachers who base their marks on the exam scores. therefore, standardized tests are preferable to other forms of evaluation.
Outcome.Outcome5: Standardized tests are not only beneficial for teachers, but also for students who want to pursue higher education or apply for scholarships. right text is: this is because standardized tests provide an objective and comparable measure of the students' academic performance and potential. for instance, many colleges and universities require students to take standardized tests such as the sat or the act as part of their admission process. similarly, many scholarship programs use standardized test scores as one of the criteria to select the best candidates. therefore, standardized tests can help students to demonstrate their skills and knowledge and to access more opportunities for their future.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, standardized tests are not without drawbacks, and some critics argue that they are not an accurate or fair measure of student achievement. for instance, standardized tests may not account for the different learning styles, backgrounds, and interests of the students, and may impose a rigid and narrow curriculum that stifles creativity and critical thinking. moreover, standardized tests may create undue pressure and anxiety for the students, and may lead to cheating, teaching to the test, and reduced motivation. therefore, exams should not be the only way for teachers to evaluate the students' progress and potential.

Outcome.Outcome1: Some people may argue that police officers should be allowed to carry guns in order to defend themselves and the public from dangerous criminals. however, this essay will contend that arming the police with lethal weapons would have more negative than positive consequences for the society. first of all, we need to consider that police armed with guns or any other kinds of legal weapons just attempts to protect not only civilians but also himself. as a result, criminals todays are very sophisticated so they spend a large amount of money to acquire modern weapons to cope with the police and serve their own nefarious needs. thus, citizens in that society can be shot by both police and offenders accidentally. moreover, while on duty, not only are private citizens affected but facilities such as cars, houses, streets are likely to be destroyed by guns. therefore, a society that its police force carries guns will be definitely seen as a highly violent one. in the following paragraphs, i will present some further arguments and evidence to support my claim that police should not be armed with guns.
Outcome.Outcome2: Police carrying guns is a controversial issue in some countries, as it raises questions about the balance between security and human rights, the effectiveness and accountability of law enforcement, and the impact of firearms on public safety and social order. some people argue that police carrying guns is necessary to deter and respond to violent crime, especially when criminals are armed with sophisticated weapons. they claim that police carrying guns can protect themselves and civilians from harm, and uphold the rule of law and justice. however, others contend that police carrying guns is excessive and dangerous, as it increases the risk of accidental or intentional shootings, abuse of power, and escalation of violence. they assert that police carrying guns can harm innocent people and damage property, and undermine the trust and cooperation between the police and the community. therefore, police carrying guns is a complex and contentious issue that requires careful evaluation and regulation.
Outcome.Outcome3: There are many cases where police armed with guns have caused harm to civilians and facilities, either intentionally or unintentionally. for example, in the united states, where police routinely carry firearms, there have been numerous incidents of police shooting unarmed or innocent people, such as breonna taylor, george floyd, and jacob blake, sparking widespread protests and outrage. in addition, police armed with guns can also trigger violent responses from criminals or suspects, leading to shootouts and standoffs that endanger bystanders and damage property. for instance, in 2019, a police chase and shootout in florida resulted in the deaths of four people, including two innocent hostages, and the injury of several others, as well as the destruction of vehicles and buildings. therefore, police armed with guns can create a vicious cycle of violence and fear in society.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, some might argue that having a police force that carries guns is necessary and beneficial for maintaining law and order, deterring crime, and ensuring public safety. they could point out that police officers who are armed with guns can respond more effectively and decisively to dangerous situations, such as terrorist attacks, hostage situations, or armed robberies. they could also claim that police officers who are armed with guns can protect themselves and their colleagues from being overpowered or killed by armed criminals, and that they can use their guns as a last resort when other means of force or persuasion fail. furthermore, they could suggest that police officers who are armed with guns can project authority and confidence, and that they can gain respect and trust from the public and the criminals alike.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, some people may argue that police carrying guns is a necessary measure to deter crime and ensure public safety. they may point out that police officers face many dangerous situations and need to be able to defend themselves and others from armed criminals. they may also claim that police guns can prevent more serious violence by intimidating potential offenders or stopping them before they harm more people. according to this view, a society that its police force carries guns is not necessarily a highly violent one, but rather a realistic and pragmatic one.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, some people may argue that police armed with guns can deter crime and maintain order more effectively than those without them. they may point out that criminals would be less likely to commit violent acts if they knew that the police could respond with lethal force. they may also claim that police with guns can protect themselves and their colleagues from dangerous situations and prevent criminals from escaping or harming others. furthermore, they may suggest that police with guns can uphold the law and the rights of the citizens more confidently and assertively than those who rely on other means of persuasion or coercion.

Prompt.Prompt1: Provide some background information on the advantages and disadvantages of other communication methods, such as phone calls, letters, or face-to-face conversations.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain how writing e-mail helps people express honestly with an example from your own experience.

Outcome.Outcome1: Writing e-mail is not only a time-saving and honest way of communication, but also a fluent and persuasive one. however, other methods of communication may have some advantages and disadvantages that should be considered. for example, phone calls can convey the tone and emotion of the speaker, but they may also be interrupted by noise or poor signal. letters can show the personality and care of the writer, but they may take a long time to arrive or get lost in the mail. face-to-face conversations can allow for immediate feedback and nonverbal cues, but they may also cause embarrassment or conflict if the topic is sensitive or controversial. therefore, depending on the purpose and context of the communication, e-mail may be the best choice for some people.
Outcome.Outcome2: Writing e-mail helps people express honestly not only when they have to deal with sensitive issues, but also when they want to share their opinions or feelings more freely. for example, when i was in college, i had a group project with some classmates who were not very cooperative or responsible. i felt frustrated and angry, but i did not want to confront them directly in class or in front of the professor. so i decided to write them an e-mail, explaining why i was dissatisfied with their performance and what i expected from them. i was able to express myself clearly and politely, without being interrupted or influenced by their reactions. i also gave them a chance to respond and improve their work. writing e-mail helped me communicate honestly and effectively with my group members.
Outcome.Outcome3: Writing e-mail not only helps people express honestly, but also enhances their fluency and persuasiveness in communication. by composing e-mail, people can organize their thoughts, choose the right words, and avoid interruptions or distractions. they can also revise and edit their messages before sending them, making sure they convey their ideas clearly and effectively. for example, if i want to persuade my boss to approve my project proposal, i can write a detailed and convincing e-mail that highlights the benefits and feasibility of my plan, instead of relying on a brief and nervous oral presentation.
Outcome.Outcome4: In conclusion, writing e-mail has many advantages for people who want to communicate effectively and honestly. e-mail allows us to express our thoughts clearly and avoid the awkwardness and pressure of face-to-face conversations. it also helps us to save time and resources by avoiding unnecessary travel and phone calls. therefore, i recommend that people use e-mail as a primary mode of communication for personal and professional purposes. however, e-mail communication is not perfect and may have some drawbacks, such as misinterpretation, lack of emotion, and security issues. thus, further research is needed to explore how to improve the quality and safety of e-mail communication and how to balance it with other forms of communication.
Outcome.Outcome5: Writing e-mail also allows people to communicate with others who are far away or have different schedules. for example, if i want to share some news with my friend who lives in another country, i can just send him an e-mail and he can read it whenever he has time. i don't have to worry about the time difference or the phone bill. moreover, e-mail can help me keep in touch with my classmates or colleagues who work on different projects or assignments. i can easily exchange information, feedback, or suggestions with them through e-mail. therefore, e-mail is a great way to maintain and enhance relationships with people who are not physically close.
Outcome.Outcome6: Writing e-mail not only helps people express honestly, but also fluently. unlike face-to-face conversations, which can be influenced by emotions, gestures, or interruptions, e-mail allows people to organize their thoughts and choose their words carefully. they can also revise and edit their messages before sending them, which can improve their clarity and accuracy. e-mail also gives people more time to think and respond, which can reduce misunderstandings and conflicts. therefore, e-mail can be a powerful and effective way of communication for many purposes and situations.

Context.Left: While debating about generation issues, people always have different opinions. Context.Right: Second, this generation is encountering the self-recognition issue which could not be experienced by the previous generation. The past generation was given less freedom and was usually asked to follow the paths their parents had prepared for them. In contrast, young people in this generation are exposed to more creative ideas and rather think individually. They are eager for finding who they are and what they really want. It is fortunate that they can struggle with these sweet worries and these worries are indeed never easy for them. They have to make decisions between so many possibilities and they are responsible for taking the consequences.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the main argument of the essay, which is that generation differences are presented in every way.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain how these generation differences affect the relationships and interactions between people of different ages, and what challenges or benefits they bring.
Prompt.Prompt3: Start a new paragraph with a topic sentence that introduces the first specific challenge for this generation, which is the environmental crisis.
Prompt.Prompt4: Elaborate on the environmental crisis and how it poses a threat to this generation's future, as well as how this generation is responding to it differently from the previous generation.

Outcome.Outcome1: The generation differences are presented in every way, not only in the external aspects such as technology, culture, and lifestyle, but also in the internal aspects such as values, attitudes, and aspirations. each generation faces its own challenges and opportunities, and has to cope with the changing environment and expectations. in this essay, i will discuss two major challenges that this generation is facing, which are different from the last generation. the first challenge is the global competition and the second challenge is the self-recognition issue.
Outcome.Outcome2: These generation differences not only shape the personal identities and goals of young people, but also affect the relationships and interactions between people of different ages. on one hand, young people may face more conflicts and misunderstandings with their parents or elders who have different values and expectations. they may also feel more pressure and competition from their peers who have diverse talents and ambitions. on the other hand, young people may also benefit from the diversity and creativity of this generation. they may learn from the experiences and wisdom of their elders, and collaborate with their peers to solve the problems and challenges of the modern world. they may also have more opportunities and resources to pursue their passions and interests, and to express their individuality and voice.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the most distinctive challenges for this generation is the environmental crisis that threatens the future of the planet and humanity. unlike the last generation, who enjoyed the benefits of rapid economic growth and technological development without much regard for the ecological consequences, this generation is facing the harsh realities of climate change, biodiversity loss, pollution, and resource depletion. this generation has to cope with the impacts of these problems on their health, livelihoods, and security, as well as take actions to reduce their environmental footprint and advocate for sustainable solutions. this challenge requires not only scientific knowledge and innovation, but also ethical awareness and global citizenship.
Outcome.Outcome4: One of the most evident ways that the challenges for this generation are significantly different from the last generation is the environmental crisis. the previous generation witnessed the rapid development of industrialization, urbanization, and globalization, which brought about many benefits but also many harms to the natural environment. the current generation is facing the consequences of climate change, biodiversity loss, pollution, and resource depletion, which threaten their health, security, and well-being. unlike the previous generation, which was largely unaware or indifferent to the environmental problems, this generation is more aware and active in seeking solutions. they are more conscious of their ecological footprint, more willing to adopt sustainable lifestyles, and more vocal in demanding environmental justice and action from governments and corporations. they are also more innovative and collaborative in using technology, science, and social media to address the environmental challenges. however, the environmental crisis is not only a technical problem, but also a moral and cultural one. it requires this generation to question their values, beliefs, and identities, and to find a balance between their individual and collective interests. this leads to the second challenge that this generation is encountering, which is the self-recognition issue.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the main aspects that show the generation differences is the challenges that each generation faces. the last generation had to deal with the aftermath of wars, economic crises, and social conflicts that threatened their survival and stability. they had to work hard, sacrifice, and adapt to the changing world. they had to cope with the lack of resources, opportunities, and information. they had to follow the norms, values, and expectations of their families and society. however, this generation is facing a different set of challenges that are more related to their identity, creativity, and diversity.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the main aspects that illustrate the generation differences is the challenges that each generation faces. the last generation had to deal with the hardships of war, poverty, and social unrest, while this generation is enjoying the benefits of peace, prosperity, and globalization. however, this does not mean that this generation has no problems to overcome. on the contrary, this generation has its own unique and complex challenges that require different skills and attitudes.

Outcome.Outcome1: Technology has altered the way people communicate with each other in various ways. for instance, it has enabled people to overcome the barriers of time and distance and to exchange information and ideas with anyone, anywhere in the world. moreover, it has created new platforms and channels for social interaction, such as social media, online forums, chat rooms, and video calls. these platforms and channels allow people to express themselves, share their interests, opinions, and experiences, and to form communities and networks based on common goals and values.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the main reasons why i think technology has improved communication is that it offers a variety of options for people to interact with each other. for instance, people can use social media platforms, such as facebook, instagram, or twitter, to share their opinions, interests, and experiences with a global audience. they can also use instant messaging apps, such as whatsapp, telegram, or signal, to chat with their friends and family anytime and anywhere. moreover, people can use video conferencing software, such as zoom, skype, or google meet, to have face-to-face conversations with their colleagues, classmates, or relatives who live in different countries. these communication tools not only facilitate information exchange, but also foster social relationships.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the main benefits of using technology for communication is that it enables people to overcome the barriers of distance and time. technology allows people to share information, opinions, emotions, and experiences with others across the globe, regardless of their location and time zone. for example, people can use video calls, social media, and online platforms to interact with their family, friends, colleagues, and customers in real time or asynchronously. this can enhance their personal and professional relationships, as well as their cultural awareness and understanding. however, technology also has some drawbacks for communication. for instance, some people may rely too much on technology and neglect face-to-face interactions, which can affect their social skills and emotional well-being. moreover, technology can also create misunderstandings, conflicts, and privacy issues, as people may misinterpret the tone, intention, and context of the messages they receive or send. furthermore, technology can also expose people to cyberbullying, fraud, and harassment, which can harm their mental and physical health. therefore, technology for communication has both advantages and disadvantages, and people should use it wisely and responsibly.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, not everyone agrees that technology has improved the quality of human relationships. some people argue that making friends via the internet is not as meaningful or satisfying as face-to-face interactions. they claim that online communication lacks the emotional and physical cues that are essential for building trust and intimacy. moreover, they point out the risks of cyberbullying, fraud, and deception that can occur in the virtual world.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the main advantages of technology in communication is that it has enabled people to overcome the barriers of distance and time. nowadays, the earth has become like a small village, where people can interact with each other across continents and cultures. through various platforms such as social media, video calls, and online forums, people can share their opinions, experiences, and interests with a wider audience. this can enhance their knowledge, awareness, and empathy for different perspectives and issues.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the main benefits of technology is that it has enabled people to communicate across distances and cultures that were previously unimaginable. through various platforms such as social media, online forums, video calls, and instant messaging, people can share their opinions, experiences, and interests with others who may live in different countries or continents. this can foster a sense of global awareness, understanding, and solidarity, as well as enrich one's personal and professional life.

Context.Left: Television and movies nowadays contain a lot of advertisements. These advertisements build ideal images that make people to feel bad about themselves and want to be more like these images. When people see beautiful women and men on the advertisements, they think that they are ugly. Thus they spend a lot of money to buy a lot of beauty products or go to gym to get better appearance or body. When a cool hero characters in a movie smokes and yet a lot of people like him, then people who idolize him may also begin to smoke although they dont prefer it.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of how advertisements influence people's behavior and self-image.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples of how advertisements create unrealistic and harmful standards of beauty and success.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that summarizes the negative impacts of advertisements and introduces the idea of media literacy as a possible solution.
Prompt.Prompt4: Discuss what media literacy is and how it can help people to critically analyze and resist the messages of advertisements.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Advertisements are everywhere in our modern society, especially in television and movies. they often present unrealistic and idealized images of beauty, success, and happiness that can affect how people view themselves and their choices. in this essay, i will discuss how television and movie advertisements can make people feel dissatisfied with their appearance and lifestyle, and influence them to buy products or adopt habits that may not be beneficial for them.
Outcome.Outcome2: Advertisements not only influence people's consumption habits, but also their self-esteem and identity. by constantly showing images of perfect and glamorous people, they create unrealistic and harmful standards of beauty and success that most people cannot attain. for example, women may feel pressured to have flawless skin, thin bodies, and fashionable clothes, while men may feel insecure about their muscles, height, or wealth. these standards can lead to low self-confidence, body dissatisfaction, eating disorders, depression, or anxiety. moreover, advertisements can also manipulate people's values and preferences by associating certain products or behaviors with desirable outcomes. for example, a movie may portray smoking as a sign of coolness, rebellion, or romance, and make people who do not smoke feel left out or inferior. thus, advertisements can have a negative impact on people's mental and physical health, as well as their social and moral choices.
Outcome.Outcome3: Advertisements in television and movies not only influence people's buying decisions, but also affect their self-esteem, health, and values. by creating unrealistic and idealized images of beauty, success, and happiness, they make people feel dissatisfied with their own appearance, abilities, and lifestyles. moreover, they often promote harmful behaviors, such as smoking, drinking, or violence, as cool or attractive, without showing the consequences or alternatives. these effects can have serious implications for people's mental and physical well-being, as well as their social and environmental responsibility. therefore, it is important for people to develop media literacy skills, which can help them to critically analyze and evaluate the messages and motives behind the advertisements. media literacy can empower people to resist the manipulation and persuasion of the advertisers, and to make more informed and ethical choices.
Outcome.Outcome4: Advertisements are not neutral messages that simply inform people about products or services. they are persuasive techniques that use various strategies to appeal to people's emotions, desires, fears, and values. they often create unrealistic and distorted images of beauty, success, happiness, and health that can influence people's self-esteem, choices, and behaviors. therefore, it is important to develop media literacy, which is the ability to access, analyze, evaluate, and create media in various forms. media literacy can help people to critically analyze and resist the messages of advertisements by asking questions such as: who created this message and why? what techniques are used to attract and manipulate the audience? what values, lifestyles, and ideologies are promoted or hidden? what are the effects and consequences of this message on individuals and society? by being media literate, people can become more aware of their own needs, preferences, and goals, and resist the pressure to conform to the ideal images that advertisements sell.
Outcome.Outcome5: Advertisements in television and movies not only influence people's buying decisions, but also affect their self-esteem and identity. by creating unrealistic and idealized images of beauty, success, and happiness, they make people feel dissatisfied with their own appearance, abilities, and lifestyle. as a result, people may try to imitate or emulate these images, even if they go against their own preferences or values. for example, some people may start smoking because they see their favorite movie characters doing so, even though they know the health risks and the costs of this habit.
Outcome.Outcome6: Advertisements in television and movies are not only a source of income for the media industry, but also a powerful tool of persuasion and influence. they use various techniques to appeal to the emotions, desires, and insecurities of the viewers, and to convince them that they need to buy or do certain things to achieve happiness, success, or social acceptance. however, these advertisements often create unrealistic and harmful standards of beauty, health, and lifestyle that can have negative effects on the self-esteem, well-being, and behavior of the audience.

Context.Right: To begin with, type of temper is one of the reasons that make me to choose individual work instead of team one. Being by nature introvert, I have to spend much time and efforts on adjusting to surroundings and especially new people. Therefore, my productivity boosts when style of work is appropriate with my type of temper.

Prompt.Prompt1: State your main argument and the purpose of your writing in the introduction.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some evidence or examples to support your claim that individual work suits your temper better than team work.
Prompt.Prompt3: Compare and contrast the advantages and disadvantages of individual work and team work in different situations or contexts.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize your main points and restate your thesis in the conclusion.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Some people prefer to work individually, while others enjoy collaborating with others in a team. the choice of working style may depend on various factors, such as personal preferences, skills, goals, and situations. in this essay, i will argue that individual work suits me better than team work, because of my type of temper, learning style, and sense of responsibility. to begin with, type of temper is one of the reasons that make me to choose individual work instead of team one. being by nature introvert, i have to spend much time and efforts on adjusting to surroundings and especially new people. once, when i was working on presentation with strangers, i sat aside and so prepared more than half of work myself instead of making attempts to get acquainted with unknown people. therefore, my productivity boosts when style of work is appropriate with my type of temper.
Outcome.Outcome2: Not only do i feel more comfortable working alone, but i also achieve better results when i do so. individual work allows me to focus on my own strengths and interests, and to manage my own pace and deadlines. for example, when i had to write a research paper for a course, i chose a topic that fascinated me and did a thorough literature review, analysis, and discussion on my own. i received a high grade and positive feedback from my instructor, who praised my originality and depth of understanding. in contrast, when i had to collaborate with others on a group project, i often faced difficulties in communicating my ideas, resolving conflicts, and meeting expectations. i felt frustrated and stressed by the lack of coordination and clarity among the team members, and the quality of our work suffered. therefore, individual work suits my temper better than team work.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, individual work is not always the best option for every task or context. sometimes, team work can offer more benefits and opportunities than working alone. for example, when the goal is to generate diverse ideas, solve complex problems, or complete large-scale projects, team work can provide more perspectives, creativity, and resources than individual work. additionally, team work can foster communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills that are essential for many careers and situations. therefore, depending on the nature and purpose of the work, i might prefer team work over individual work or vice versa.
Outcome.Outcome4: In conclusion, i prefer individual work to team work because of my introverted personality. working alone allows me to focus on the task without the stress of socializing and adapting to unfamiliar environments. moreover, i can achieve better results when i work at my own pace and according to my own preferences. therefore, my type of temper is a key factor that influences my choice of work style.
Outcome.Outcome5: In addition to the type of temper, another factor that influences my preference for individual work is the level of autonomy and creativity that i can enjoy. when i work alone, i can set my own pace, goals, and methods without having to compromise or negotiate with others. i can also explore different ideas and perspectives that might not be shared or appreciated by teammates. for instance, when i was assigned to write a report on a topic that i was passionate about, i was able to research and analyze various sources and arguments that enriched my understanding and writing. therefore, i feel more satisfied and motivated when i can exercise my own judgment and initiative in my work.
Outcome.Outcome6: Another factor that influences my preference for individual work is the level of control and responsibility that i have over the tasks. when i work alone, i can plan, organize, and execute the work according to my own standards and expectations, without depending on others or compromising on quality. i also feel more accountable and motivated to achieve the goals that i set for myself, as i know that the results depend solely on my efforts and skills. on the contrary, when i work in a team, i often face challenges such as communication gaps, conflicting opinions, unequal workloads, and unclear roles and expectations. these issues can hamper the efficiency and effectiveness of the team work and cause frustration and dissatisfaction. therefore, i prefer to work individually when i have the autonomy and authority to manage the work as i see fit.

Outcome.Outcome1: In today's world, having and raising children can be a very difficult task for families, the smallest component of the society. while mother's role is essential in a child's life, i completely agree with the idea that fatherhood is as vital a part of a healthy parentage as much as motherhood. in this essay, i will explain why i think that fathers have a significant impact on the physical, emotional, and social development of their children, and why the dynamics of the relationships today require a more balanced and equal involvement of both parents in childrearing.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the main reasons why i believe that fatherhood is as important as motherhood is the emotional and psychological impact that fathers have on their children. numerous studies have shown that children who grow up with involved and supportive fathers tend to have higher self-esteem, better academic performance, lower rates of depression and anxiety, and more positive social skills. fathers can also provide a different perspective and a complementary role model for their children, especially for boys who need to learn how to respect and treat women. moreover, fathers can share the joys and challenges of parenthood with their partners, creating a stronger bond and a more balanced family environment.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the main reasons why i agree with the statement that fatherhood is as vital as motherhood is the impact of fathers on children's development and well-being. numerous studies have shown that children who have a positive and supportive relationship with their fathers benefit from various aspects, such as higher self-esteem, better academic performance, lower risk of delinquency and substance abuse, and more resilience to stress and challenges. for example, a recent research by the university of oxford found that fathers who are involved in their children's early education and play activities have a lasting positive effect on their cognitive and social skills. moreover, fathers can provide a different perspective and role model for their children, especially for boys who may need a male figure to identify with and learn from. therefore, fathers play a crucial role in shaping their children's personality, values, and aspirations.

Outcome.Outcome5: One of the main reasons why fatherhood is as vital as motherhood in a healthy parenthood is the emotional and psychological impact that fathers have on their children. numerous studies have shown that children who grow up with involved and supportive fathers have higher self-esteem, better academic performance, lower risk of behavioral problems, and more positive social skills than those who lack a father figure. moreover, fathers can provide different perspectives, experiences, and role models for their children, especially for boys who need to learn how to be responsible and respectful men in the society. therefore, fathers play a crucial role in shaping their children's personality, identity, and values.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the ways that fatherhood is essential in a child's life is the emotional and psychological support that a father can provide. a father can be a role model, a mentor, a friend, and a protector for his children, and help them develop their self-esteem, confidence, and identity. a father can also complement the mother's role by offering a different perspective, a balance of discipline and affection, and a diversity of interests and skills. moreover, a father can contribute to the well-being of the whole family by sharing the responsibilities and challenges of parenting with the mother, and by fostering a harmonious and respectful relationship with her. however, fatherhood is not only important for the children and the mother, but also for the father himself and for the society. the second reason why i believe that fatherhood is as important as motherhood is the dynamics of the relationships today.

Context.Left: Started in the late eighteenth century, the industrialization and urbanization witnessed the explosion in number of automobiles. The very fuel that they rely on, oil, has now become the dominant pollution of cities' environment. While critics castigating about the exorbitant use of oil and other insisting to charged drivers with extra fee during the rush hours for their selfish conducts, I hold the contention that no additional payment should be charged on them. The reasons are the followings.
Context.Right: Buying a car spends hundreds of thousand; paying for all sorts of fee takes another several-these are all ready too much for most of the families to bear. Charging drivers one more fee makes no sense and is ridiculous. Majority of the families buy cars simply for a safer and easier conveyance, and charging them too much fee adds a lot to their burden and is actually jeopardizing their rights.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain the main contention that no additional payment should be charged on drivers.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some evidence or examples to support the contention.
Prompt.Prompt3: Acknowledge the possible counterarguments or objections to the contention.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize the main points of the argument and restate the contention in different words.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: The main contention that no additional payment should be charged on drivers is based on the premise that they have already paid enough for owning and using their vehicles. it is unfair and unreasonable to impose another fee on them for driving during the rush hours, when they may have no other choice but to commute to work or school. such a fee would not only discourage car ownership, but also create more hardship and inequality for the lower and middle income families who rely on cars for their daily transportation.
Outcome.Outcome2: One might argue that drivers should pay more for using the roads during peak hours, as they contribute to traffic congestion and air pollution, which affect the quality of life and health of other city dwellers. however, this argument ignores the fact that drivers are not the only ones who benefit from the convenience and mobility of cars. for many families, especially those who live in suburban areas or have to commute long distances for work or school, cars are a necessity rather than a luxury. they enable them to access more opportunities and services, such as education, health care, entertainment, and social activities, that might not be available or accessible by public transport. moreover, drivers already pay a significant amount of taxes and fees for owning and operating their cars, such as registration, insurance, maintenance, and fuel. these costs reflect the social and environmental impacts of their car use, and also help to fund the development and improvement of road infrastructure and public transport. therefore, imposing an extra fee on drivers during rush hours would be unfair and unreasonable, as it would penalize them for exercising their right to mobility and freedom of choice.
Outcome.Outcome3: Some might argue that charging drivers extra fee during the rush hours is a necessary measure to reduce traffic congestion and air pollution, which are serious problems that affect the health and well-being of urban residents. they might claim that drivers should pay for the negative externalities of their choices, such as greenhouse gas emissions, noise, and accidents, and that the fee would encourage them to use public transportation or other alternatives. they might also point out that the fee would generate revenue for the government to invest in improving the infrastructure and services of the city.
Outcome.Outcome4: Therefore, the argument that drivers should pay extra fee during the rush hours is not convincing. it ignores the fact that drivers have already paid a lot for buying and maintaining their cars, and that they use them for legitimate and reasonable purposes. it also fails to consider the negative impacts of such a policy on the drivers' welfare and rights. my contention is that drivers should not be subject to any additional payment for using their cars in the peak hours, as this would be unfair and ineffective.
Outcome.Outcome5: In addition to the environmental concerns, some critics also argue that charging drivers extra fee during the rush hours would reduce the traffic congestion and encourage the use of public transportation. however, this argument ignores the practical difficulties and unfairness that such a policy would entail.
Outcome.Outcome6: One might argue that drivers should pay extra fee during the rush hours to discourage them from using cars and to reduce the traffic congestion and air pollution. however, this argument overlooks the fact that drivers have already paid a lot to own and use their cars, and that they have legitimate reasons to choose this mode of transportation.

Context.Right: Primary, it is easy to know the history of the new place. Last year, I went to Ellis Island and the immigration museum, where is a symbol of American immigration and the immigrant experience in the New York. Through the exhibit, I found that the Statue of Liberty symbolized freedom, and Ellis Island may be the place, where the immigration took their dreams and fears. Thus, museums can help us know the history and the customs of a new place.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain why it is easy to know the history of the new place by visiting museums.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide an example of another museum you visited and what you learned from it.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from the benefits of museums to the disadvantages of online travel guides.
Prompt.Prompt4: State your opinion on whether online travel guides can replace the experience of visiting museums or not.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Visiting museums is a good way to learn about the history of a new place, because they display artifacts, documents, and stories that reflect the past and the culture of the people who lived there. museums can also provide context and interpretation for the historical events and social changes that shaped the present situation of the place. for example, when i visited ellis island and the immigration museum, i learned how millions of immigrants came to america in search of freedom and opportunity, and how they faced challenges and contributed to the diversity and development of the country. the statue of liberty and ellis island are not only landmarks, but also symbols of the american immigration and the immigrant experience. therefore, museums can help us understand the history and the customs of a new place.
Outcome.Outcome2: Museums are a great way to learn about a new place when traveling. by seeing the artifacts, documents, and photos that show the culture and the events of the left text is primary, it is easy to know the history of the new place. last year, i went to ellis island and the immigration museum, where is a symbol of american immigration and the immigrant experience in the new york. through the exhibit, i found that the statue of liberty symbolized freedom, and ellis island may be the place, where the immigration took their dreams and fears. thus, museums can help us know the history and the customs of a new place. for example, when i visited washington d.c., i went to the national museum of african american history and culture, where i learned about the struggles and achievements of african americans throughout the history of the united states. i saw the exhibits that displayed the artifacts of slavery, segregation, civil rights, and cultural expressions. i also learned about the contributions of african americans to the fields of science, art, sports, and politics. the museum gave me a deeper understanding of the diversity and the resilience of the american people.
Outcome.Outcome3: Museums are not only sources of knowledge and culture, but also attractions that enrich our travel experience. however, some people may prefer to rely on online travel guides to plan their trips, rather than visiting museums in person. online travel guides may seem convenient and accessible, but they also have some disadvantages that can limit our understanding and enjoyment of a new place.
Outcome.Outcome4: Online travel guides can provide useful information and tips for travelers who want to explore a new place, but they cannot replace the experience of visiting museums. museums offer a deeper and more authentic insight into the history, culture, and art of a place, as well as a chance to see and touch artifacts and exhibits that online sources cannot replicate. for example, when i visited ellis island and the immigration museum in new york, i learned about the symbolisms of the statue of liberty and the struggles and hopes of the immigrants who passed through there. online travel guides could not convey the same emotions and impressions that i felt when i saw the actual documents, photographs, and objects that told their stories. therefore, i think that museums are still valuable and irreplaceable sources of learning and enjoyment for travelers.
Outcome.Outcome5: When i travel to a new place, i like to visit museums to learn more about the culture and the history of the area. museums can provide me with valuable information and insights that i cannot get from other sources. for example, when i visited new york last year, i went to ellis island and the immigration museum, which is a symbol of american immigration and the immigrant experience. through the exhibit, i found out how the statue of liberty symbolized freedom, and how ellis island was the place where immigrants brought their dreams and fears. thus, museums can help us know the history and the customs of a new place.
Outcome.Outcome6: Besides learning from museums, another way to explore a new place is to experience the local culture and lifestyle. by interacting with the people, tasting the food, and joining the activities, we can gain a deeper understanding of the diversity and richness of the world. for example, when i visited new york, i enjoyed walking along the streets, watching the broadway shows, and trying the famous pizza and bagels. i also met some friendly and helpful locals who shared their stories and opinions with me. therefore, experiencing the local culture and lifestyle can make our trips more enjoyable and meaningful.

Outcome.Outcome1: The effect of technology on transportations and communications is not limited to the airplane and the telephone, which have enabled people to travel and talk across long distances. technology has also facilitated other forms of mobility and connectivity, such as the internet and online paying systems. these innovations have opened up new opportunities and challenges for people who want to access information, education, and services from different parts of the world.
Outcome.Outcome2: These changes in transportations and communications have brought many benefits to society in terms of convenience, efficiency, and diversity. for example, people can travel faster and farther with airplanes, which enables them to explore different cultures, exchange ideas, and expand their horizons. similarly, people can communicate more quickly and cheaply with telephones, which facilitates social and professional interactions, as well as access to information and education. furthermore, people can transfer money more securely and easily with credit cards and online paying systems, which simplifies financial transactions, reduces paperwork, and supports global trade and cooperation. therefore, technology has improved the quality of life and the opportunities for people in various aspects.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the benefits of technology on communications is that it enables people to access information and services from anywhere in the world. this has opened up new opportunities for education, business, and personal development. however, communication is not the only aspect that technology has improved. another important aspect on technology is transferring money.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, using technology for transferring money also has some challenges or drawbacks that need to be addressed. for example, security is a major concern for online transactions, as hackers or fraudsters may try to steal personal or financial information, or intercept payments. privacy is another issue, as some online platforms may collect or share data about users' habits, preferences, or identities, without their consent or knowledge. moreover, reliability is not always guaranteed, as technical errors, network failures, or power outages may disrupt or delay the process of sending or receiving money. therefore, users of technology for transferring money need to be aware of the potential risks and take precautions to protect themselves and their money.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the other effects of growing technology on transportations and communications is the facilitation of international education. nowadays, everyone can see the effect of technology on their life, especially on the way of transportations and communications such as the airplane and the telephone. these devices enable students to travel to different countries and cultures, and to communicate with their families and friends. however, traveling and studying abroad also require financial resources, which can be challenging for some students. another important aspect on technology is transferring money. today, students can apply for foreign universities much easier than before. not only with the help of sending email, but also using credit cards to pay all necessary fees online. therefore, with the advent of internet and online paying systems, you can do many thing at your home easily.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the effects of growing technology on transportations and communications is the expansion of educational opportunities across the globe. nowadays, everyone can see the effect of technology on their life, especially on the way of transportations and communications such as the airplane and the telephone. these means of travel and contact enable students to access different cultures, languages, and knowledge systems that enrich their learning and career prospects. however, technology also facilitates other aspects of pursuing higher education abroad, such as transferring money. today, students can apply for foreign universities much easier than before. not only with the help of sending email, but also using credit cards to pay all necessary fees online. therefore, with the advent of internet and online paying systems, you can do many things at your home easily.
