Context.Right: First of all, I do support the idea that advertising alcohol, cigarettes, goods and services with adult content should be prohibited because these kind of ads will have negative effect to our children. Youngsters might be tempted to buy cigarettes or alcohol and later to start consume it on a daily basis. Fortunately, some countries take this issue seriously and advertising alcohol, cigarettes and materials with adult content is banned on those countries.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of advertising regulation and state your thesis statement in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some background information on why advertising alcohol, cigarettes and adult content is harmful to society and children in particular.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that summarizes your main points and prepares the reader for the counterargument in the next paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt4: Acknowledge the opposing view that banning ads is a violation of free speech and consumer choice and refute it with evidence and logic.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Advertising is a powerful tool that can influence people's behavior, preferences and values. however, not all kinds of advertising are appropriate or beneficial for the society, especially for the young and vulnerable groups. in this essay, i will argue that advertising alcohol, cigarettes, goods and services with adult content should be prohibited because these kind of ads will have negative effect to our children. youngsters might be tempted to buy cigarettes or alcohol and later to start consume it on a daily basis. fortunately, some countries take this issue seriously and advertising alcohol, cigarettes and materials with adult content is banned on those countries.
Outcome.Outcome2: Advertising alcohol, cigarettes and adult content is harmful to society and children in particular because it can influence their attitudes, behaviors and health. exposure to such ads can normalize and glamorize the use of addictive and risky substances, create false expectations and desires, and undermine the development of critical thinking and self-esteem. moreover, children are more vulnerable and impressionable than adults and may not have the ability to discern the persuasive intent and the negative consequences of such ads. therefore, it is important to protect children from the harmful effects of advertising alcohol, cigarettes and adult content by prohibiting it. first of all, i do support the idea that advertising alcohol, cigarettes, goods and services with adult content should be prohibited because these kind of ads will have negative effect to our children. youngsters might be tempted to buy cigarettes or alcohol and later to start consume it on a daily basis. fortunately, some countries take this issue seriously and advertising alcohol, cigarettes and materials with adult content is banned on those countries.
Outcome.Outcome3: Therefore, i believe that banning such harmful and inappropriate ads is a necessary measure to protect our children from the influence of these products and services. however, not everyone agrees with this view. some people argue that prohibiting these ads is a violation of freedom of expression and that consumers have the right to make their own choices. in the next paragraph, i will examine the main objections and weaknesses of this counterargument.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, some people may argue that banning ads for alcohol, cigarettes, and adult materials is a violation of free speech and consumer choice. they may claim that consumers have the right to access information and make their own decisions about what products and services they want to buy and use. they may also contend that advertisers have the freedom to express their opinions and persuade their target audience. however, this argument ignores the fact that these kind of ads can have harmful consequences for the society, especially for the children and adolescents who are more vulnerable and impressionable. studies have shown that exposure to ads for alcohol and tobacco can increase the likelihood of underage drinking and smoking, which can lead to addiction, health problems, and social issues. furthermore, ads for adult materials can promote unrealistic and unhealthy expectations of sexuality, violence, and gender roles, which can affect the self-esteem, relationships, and well-being of young people. therefore, banning these ads is not a restriction of free speech or consumer choice, but a protection of public health and safety.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, not all countries have the same regulations and policies regarding the advertising of these harmful and inappropriate products. in some places, the media is flooded with commercials and billboards that promote alcohol, cigarettes, goods and services with adult content, without any regard for the health and moral implications of their messages. this creates a situation where children and teenagers are exposed to these ads and may develop curiosity, interest or even addiction to these substances or behaviors. therefore, i believe that there should be a global effort to ban or restrict the advertising of alcohol, cigarettes, goods and services with adult content, in order to protect the well-being and development of our young generation.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, not all countries have the same regulations and restrictions on advertising harmful or inappropriate products. some advertisers use various techniques and strategies to appeal to consumers, especially young and impressionable ones, and persuade them to buy their products. they might use celebrities, humor, sex appeal, emotional appeals, or false or misleading claims to attract attention and create desire. these kind of ads can have harmful consequences for the physical, mental, and social health of the viewers, especially children, who might not have the critical thinking skills or the moral guidance to resist them.

Context.Left: Firstly, it is an undeniable fact that tourists from different cultures will probably cause changes to the cultural identity of the tourist destinations. Take Thailand for example, in the Vietnam War, many American soldiers came to Thailand for a break and involved in sexual and drug activities, these huge demands caused many local businesses opened and expanded, even illegally involved in under-age prostitutes to maximize their profits. This was due to the lack of adequate controls by authorities and lead to a bad image of Thailand tourism. Therefore this proves that international tourism can create negative impacts on the destination countries.
Context.Right: To conclude, I strongly believe that the tourism has created threatening pressure on both the sociocultural and natural environments. If authorities do not take steps to appropriately conserve these precious values, they will be destroyed in the near future.

Prompt.Prompt1: The topic is the negative effects of international tourism on the destination countries.
Prompt.Prompt2: After stating the fact that tourism can change the cultural identity of the tourist destinations, provide some examples of how this can harm the local traditions and values.
Prompt.Prompt3: Elaborate on the environmental impacts of tourism, such as pollution, waste, deforestation, and loss of biodiversity.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add a connecting paragraph that summarizes the main points of the essay and introduces the conclusion.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Another negative effect of international tourism on the destination countries is the environmental degradation caused by the massive influx of visitors and the lack of proper management. many natural attractions, such as coral reefs, rainforests, and wildlife habitats, are vulnerable to the pollution, overexploitation, and disturbance caused by tourists and their activities. for instance, in bali, indonesia, the rapid development of tourism infrastructure and facilities has led to the loss of agricultural land, water scarcity, and waste disposal problems. moreover, some tourists may not respect the local environmental norms and values, and engage in activities that harm the ecosystems and biodiversity. for example, some tourists may feed or touch the wildlife, litter or damage the natural sites, or consume endangered species. these behaviors not only harm the environment, but also the local communities that depend on it for their livelihoods and well-being. therefore, this shows that international tourism can create negative impacts on the destination countries.
Outcome.Outcome2: Not only can tourism change the cultural identity of the tourist destinations, but it can also harm the local traditions and values that are essential for the preservation of the sociocultural environment. for instance, in some places, tourists may disrespect the religious beliefs, customs, or dress codes of the host communities, causing offense and resentment. alternatively, tourists may influence the local people to adopt their lifestyles, values, or consumption patterns, leading to the loss of cultural diversity and authenticity. furthermore, tourism can also create conflicts and inequalities among the local people, as some may benefit more from the economic opportunities, while others may suffer from the environmental degradation, social displacement, or exploitation. thus, tourism can have detrimental effects on the cultural and social aspects of the destination countries.
Outcome.Outcome3: Not only does international tourism affect the cultural identity of the destination countries, but it also poses serious threats to their natural environments. tourism activities often generate large amounts of pollution, waste, and greenhouse gas emissions, which contribute to global warming and environmental degradation. moreover, tourism development may require the clearing of forests, wetlands, and other natural habitats, resulting in the loss of biodiversity and ecosystem services. for instance, in indonesia, tourism-related infrastructure and palm oil plantations have caused the deforestation of millions of hectares of rainforest, endangering the survival of many endemic species, such as orangutans, tigers, and elephants. therefore, this shows that international tourism can create negative impacts on the destination countries.
Outcome.Outcome4: As the essay has shown, international tourism can have serious consequences for the cultural identity and environmental sustainability of the host countries. tourism can introduce foreign influences that may erode the local traditions, values, and morals, as well as generate excessive waste, pollution, and resource consumption that may harm the natural habitats and biodiversity. these impacts can undermine the quality of life and well-being of the local communities, as well as the attractiveness and competitiveness of the tourism destinations. therefore, it is imperative that the authorities implement effective measures to regulate, monitor, and mitigate the negative effects of tourism. in the following paragraph, i will restate my opinion and provide some recommendations for improving the situation.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, the cultural identity of the tourist destinations is not the only thing that is affected by international tourism. another serious problem is the environmental degradation caused by the massive influx of visitors and the unsustainable practices of the tourism industry. for instance, many natural attractions such as coral reefs, rainforests, and wildlife habitats are damaged or destroyed by overexploitation, pollution, and climate change. moreover, the tourism sector often consumes large amounts of water, energy, and land resources, creating waste and greenhouse gas emissions that contribute to global warming. these environmental impacts not only threaten the biodiversity and ecological balance of the destination countries, but also reduce the quality and attractiveness of the tourism products and services.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, the cultural identity of the tourist destinations is not the only thing at risk from international tourism. another serious issue is the environmental degradation caused by the massive influx of visitors and the development of tourism infrastructure. for instance, the coral reefs in australia and the maldives are suffering from coral bleaching, pollution, overfishing, and physical damage from boats and divers. these ecosystems are vital for the biodiversity and the livelihoods of the local communities, but they are also very fragile and sensitive to changes in temperature, acidity, and salinity. moreover, the tourism industry often consumes a lot of water, energy, and land resources, which can lead to deforestation, soil erosion, greenhouse gas emissions, and waste disposal problems. these environmental problems not only affect the natural beauty and the quality of life of the host countries, but also threaten the sustainability and the competitiveness of the tourism sector itself.

Context.Left: Moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that it depends on the capability of one to decide whether he can succeed or not. At least, a successful person should be able to dismantle the hurdles prohibiting him to success. For instance, the sports stars do not have to take some drugs to win a game or show their extraordinary skills. The same reason why they succeed is that they all have the predominated abilities in sports realm. In contrast, those athletes try to have distinctive performance by taking risks of taking drugs are failed to succeed. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that it is not necessary for successful people to take risks.
Context.Right: Based on the reasons demonstrated above, I believe that doing what we already known can still leads us to succeed because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the opposite. In other words, reducing risks and enhancing individual's capability is the most important path to success. It is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. Still, I am firmly convinced that the reasons I have proposed in favor of my own sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.

Prompt.Prompt1: State your position on the topic of whether successful people need to take risks or not.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain why doing what we already know can lead to success, and give an example to support your point.
Prompt.Prompt3: Acknowledge the possible benefits of taking risks, but also show the drawbacks and limitations of this approach.
Prompt.Prompt4: Reinforce your position in the conclusion, and restate the main reasons why doing what we already know is more advantageous than taking risks.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: While some people may argue that taking risks is an essential part of achieving success, i disagree with this view. i think that successful people can also rely on their existing knowledge and skills, and avoid unnecessary or harmful risks that may jeopardize their chances of success. moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that it depends on the capability of one to decide whether he can succeed or not. at least, a successful person should be able to dismantle the hurdles prohibiting him to success. for instance, the sports stars do not have to take some drugs to win a game or show their extraordinary skills. the same reason why they succeed is that they all have the predominated abilities in sports realm. in contrast, those athletes try to have distinctive performance by taking risks of taking drugs are failed to succeed. hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that it is not necessary for successful people to take risks. based on the reasons demonstrated above, i believe that doing what we already known can still leads us to succeed because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the opposite. in other words, reducing risks and enhancing individual's capability is the most important path to success. it is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. still, i am firmly convinced that the reasons i have proposed in favor of my own sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
Outcome.Outcome2: Doing what we already know can lead to success because it allows us to apply our existing skills, knowledge, and experience to the tasks and challenges we face. by doing so, we can avoid unnecessary mistakes, save time and resources, and achieve our goals more efficiently and effectively. for example, a musician who has mastered a certain instrument and genre can produce high-quality compositions and performances by using his or her familiar techniques and styles, rather than experimenting with unfamiliar ones that may not suit his or her talents or preferences. therefore, doing what we already know can be a reliable and rewarding way of succeeding in our endeavors.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, some people might argue that taking risks is a necessary and inevitable part of achieving success. they might claim that by venturing into new and unfamiliar areas, one can discover new opportunities, challenge oneself, and overcome the fear of failure. they might also point out that many successful people in history, such as inventors, entrepreneurs, and explorers, have taken bold and daring risks that paid off in the end. while these benefits of taking risks cannot be denied, they also come with significant drawbacks and limitations. taking risks can also lead to costly mistakes, wasted resources, and irreversible damages. moreover, taking risks does not guarantee success, as it also depends on other factors, such as luck, timing, and competition. therefore, taking risks is not always the best or the only way to achieve success.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, i have argued that doing what we already know is a more effective and reliable way to achieve success than taking risks. i have supported this position by showing that it can help us avoid unnecessary failures, maintain our confidence and motivation, and develop our skills and expertise. moreover, i have also pointed out that success depends not only on external factors, but also on our own ability and determination to overcome the obstacles and challenges that we may face. therefore, i disagree with the claim that successful people have to take risks, and i think that the examples of sports stars and athletes illustrate this point well. doing what we already know does not mean that we are complacent or stagnant, but rather that we are prudent and diligent.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, taking risks is not a prerequisite for success, but rather a potential hindrance that may jeopardize one's achievements and reputation. moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that it depends on the capability of one to decide whether he can succeed or not. at least, a successful person should be able to dismantle the hurdles prohibiting him to success. for instance, the sports stars do not have to take some drugs to win a game or show their extraordinary skills. the same reason why they succeed is that they all have the predominated abilities in sports realm. in contrast, those athletes try to have distinctive performance by taking risks of taking drugs are failed to succeed. hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that it is not necessary for successful people to take risks. based on the reasons demonstrated above, i believe that doing what we already known can still leads us to succeed because the advantages of this are relatively greater than that of the opposite. in other words, reducing risks and enhancing individual's capability is the most important path to success. it is not to say, of course, that other points of view are completely without merit. still, i am firmly convinced that the reasons i have proposed in favor of my own sentiment are much more tenable and cogent.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, taking risks is not a prerequisite for success, nor is it a guarantee of achieving one's goals. rather, success depends on how well one can utilize and improve one's existing skills, knowledge, and talents, as well as how well one can overcome the challenges and obstacles that may arise in the pursuit of one's dreams. this leads me to conclude that doing what we already know can still lead us to success, as i will explain in the following paragraph.

Context.Right: First, critics of zoology argue that keeping animals in captivity is wrong because animals should be considered non-human persons and they should have the right of having freedom. This is so unfair for them to be taken out of their natural environment and to be kept in small enclosures. That is because, many zoos, especially the ones in developing countries, do not provide care and attention which their animals require. The animals are often undernourished and do not have sufficient quality and quantity of medical treatment. In addition, sometimes animals from hot countries have to survive in the cold winter of somewhere in Europe.

Prompt.Prompt1: Provide some background information on zoology and its benefits for animals and humans.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain how zoos can contribute to conservation, education and research on endangered species.
Prompt.Prompt3: Acknowledge the opposing view that zoos are unethical and harmful for animals.
Prompt.Prompt4: Refute the opposing view by giving evidence and examples of how zoos can improve animal welfare and rights.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Zoology is the scientific study of animals and their behavior, anatomy, physiology, ecology, evolution, and conservation. zoos are one of the places where zoologists can observe and research different species of animals, as well as educate the public about their diversity and importance. zoos can also play a role in protecting endangered animals from extinction, by breeding them in captivity and reintroducing them to the wild when possible. however, zoos also face many ethical and practical challenges, as some critics of zoology argue that keeping animals in captivity is wrong for various reasons.
Outcome.Outcome2: However, supporters of zoos claim that they have many benefits for both animals and humans. zoos can contribute to conservation, education and research on endangered species by providing safe habitats, breeding programs, public awareness and scientific knowledge. for example, zoos can help protect animals from poaching, habitat loss and climate change by creating suitable conditions and monitoring their health and behavior. zoos can also educate visitors about the threats and needs of different animals and inspire them to take action for conservation. furthermore, zoos can cooperate with other institutions and researchers to conduct studies and experiments on animal behavior, physiology, genetics and diseases, which can improve their welfare and survival. thus, zoos can play a vital role in preserving biodiversity and enhancing our understanding of the natural world.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, not everyone agrees with the view that zoos are unethical and harmful for animals. some supporters of zoology claim that zoos have many benefits for both animals and humans. they argue that zoos can help conserve endangered species, educate the public about wildlife, and conduct scientific research. they also contend that zoos can provide animals with a safe and comfortable environment, where they are protected from predators, poachers, and habitat loss. moreover, they assert that zoos can enrich the animals' lives by offering them stimulation, companionship, and veterinary care.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, this view ignores the fact that zoos can also play a positive role in enhancing animal welfare and rights. zoos can provide animals with spacious and naturalistic habitats that mimic their original environments and meet their physical and behavioral needs. zoos can also offer animals a varied and nutritious diet, as well as regular veterinary care and preventive health measures. moreover, zoos can contribute to the conservation and protection of endangered species by participating in breeding programs, reintroduction projects, and research and education initiatives. zoos can also raise public awareness and empathy for animals and their plight in the wild, and inspire people to take action for their conservation. therefore, zoos are not necessarily wrong or unfair for animals, but rather can be beneficial and respectful of their dignity and rights.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, supporters of zoology have different views on the role and benefits of zoos. they claim that zoos are important for conservation, education and research purposes. by keeping endangered species in captivity, zoos can protect them from poaching, habitat loss and climate change. they can also participate in breeding programs and reintroduction projects to increase the genetic diversity and population size of these animals. moreover, zoos can educate the public about the diversity and value of wildlife and inspire them to take action for conservation. zoos can also provide opportunities for scientific studies and collaborations that can enhance the understanding and welfare of animals.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, supporters of zoology have different views on the role and benefits of zoos. they claim that zoos are not only a source of entertainment and education for the public, but also a vital tool for conservation and research. by keeping animals in captivity, zoos can protect them from poaching, habitat loss, and climate change, which are some of the major threats to wildlife in the wild. moreover, zoos can contribute to the scientific knowledge and welfare of animals by conducting studies, breeding programs, and rescue operations. zoos can also raise awareness and inspire people to care for and respect animals and their natural habitats.

Prompt.Prompt4: Discuss some of the possible problems and solutions for working women, such as stress, time management, childcare, and discrimination.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Firstly, extra income that women earn will contribute to their family's expenses. by taking up a job, a wife can earn more money to support her family life. this is really necessary in cases of her husband's low salary and the difficulty of getting a good job at the present. so, it is a normal practice for women to be helpmates in earning money. secondly, working outside the home can benefit women in terms of personal development and empowerment. by engaging in different social and professional activities, women can gain more knowledge, skills, and confidence. they can also express their opinions, talents, and creativity in various fields. moreover, they can have more opportunities to network and cooperate with other people, which can enrich their lives and broaden their horizons. working women can also serve as role models for their children and other women, inspiring them to pursue their dreams and goals. last but not least, nowadays, there are many supporting conditions that help women balance housework and work. besides the government's policies on limited families and their husbands' sharing in the housework, many employers are willing to offer part-time jobs for women.
Outcome.Outcome2: Moreover, working outside the home can also bring benefits for women's personal development and social recognition. there are many examples of successful women who have both a career and a family, such as angela merkel, the chancellor of germany, oprah winfrey, the media mogul and philanthropist, and sheryl sandberg, the chief operating officer of facebook. these women have proven that they can excel in their fields of expertise, while also taking care of their families and their own well-being. they have inspired many other women to pursue their dreams and ambitions, without sacrificing their roles as mothers, wives, or daughters.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, working women may also face some challenges and difficulties in balancing their roles and responsibilities. for example, they may have to deal with the pressure of meeting deadlines, managing stress, and maintaining their professional skills. they may also have to cope with the guilt of leaving their children in the care of others, the expectations of their families and society, and the potential conflicts with their husbands over household chores and decision making. therefore, working women need to have a clear sense of their priorities, goals, and values, and seek support and cooperation from their partners, employers, and communities.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, working women may also face some challenges and difficulties that affect their personal and professional lives. for example, they may experience stress from juggling multiple roles and responsibilities, or have trouble managing their time efficiently. they may also need to find reliable and affordable childcare options for their children, or deal with discrimination and bias in the workplace. to overcome these problems, working women need to seek support and assistance from various sources, such as their families, friends, colleagues, employers, and social services. they can also use strategies such as setting priorities, delegating tasks, negotiating flexible schedules, and asserting their rights and interests. by doing so, working women can enjoy the benefits of their economic and social participation, and also fulfill their domestic and familial duties.
Outcome.Outcome5: Another reason why women should work is that it can enhance their personal development and social status. by working outside the home, women can gain more knowledge, skills, and confidence, which can benefit them in their career and life. moreover, working women can also have more opportunities to interact with different people and expand their social network, which can enrich their experience and perspective. working women can also have more influence and voice in the society, as they can participate in various social activities and movements. therefore, working can empower women and make them more independent and respected.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, working outside the home does not mean that women neglect their domestic responsibilities. women still have to take care of their children, their husbands, and their households. fortunately, working women can rely on various factors that help them balance housework and work. for example, the government's policies on limited families and their husbands' sharing in the housework can reduce the burden on women. moreover, many employers are willing to offer part-time jobs for women, which can give them more flexibility and control over their time and income.

Outcome.Outcome1: Co-operation and teamwork are important skills that can benefit people in various aspects of life. whether it is in education, work, sports, or social activities, working together with others can enhance learning, performance, creativity, and problem-solving. co-operation means sharing ideas, resources, and responsibilities with others, while teamwork means working towards a common goal with mutual respect and support. in this essay, i will discuss how co-operation is essential for teamwork, and how educational systems emphasize on encouraging co-operative approach in children. i will also give some examples of how co-operation and teamwork can lead to success in different situations.
Outcome.Outcome2: Co-operation is not only beneficial for animals, but also for humans. it is a skill that can be learned and practiced from an early age. that is why educational systems emphasize on encouraging co-operative approach in children. by working together with their peers and teachers, children can develop social, emotional and cognitive abilities that will help them in their future endeavors.
Outcome.Outcome3: One way that educational systems emphasize on encouraging co-operative approach in children is by designing activities and assignments that require collaboration and communication among students. for example, some schools use project-based learning, where students work in groups to solve real-world problems or create products that demonstrate their learning. this approach fosters skills such as critical thinking, creativity, and problem-solving, as well as social and emotional competencies such as empathy, respect, and responsibility. another example is peer tutoring, where students help each other with academic tasks, such as reading, writing, or math. this method not only boosts academic achievement, but also enhances self-esteem, motivation, and interpersonal relationships. by engaging in these kinds of co-operative activities, children learn to appreciate the benefits of teamwork and mutual help, as well as the challenges and opportunities that arise from working with others.
Outcome.Outcome4: Co-operation is essential for teamwork. educational systems emphasize on encouraging co-operative approach in children. we live in a social setup and mutual help and sharing only leads to success. a person can not learn or achieve everything by oneself. for instance, lions hunt in a team. it is only due to their teamwork that they are able to catch a prey and make task easy. in the same way, co-operative approach will save time, energy and will have a higher success rate. therefore, co-operation is not only a skill but also a value that should be cultivated from an early age. it enhances the quality of learning, working and living in a diverse and interdependent world. co-operation is the key to teamwork and teamwork is the key to success.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the skills that children need to develop for their future is co-operation, which is essential for teamwork. educational systems emphasize on encouraging co-operative approach in children, as it helps them to learn from each other, share ideas and resources, and solve problems together. co-operation is not only beneficial for academic achievement, but also for social and emotional development. by working co-operatively, children can build trust, respect, empathy, and communication skills. moreover, co-operation prepares them for the challenges and opportunities of living in a diverse and interdependent world. as the left text points out, we live in a social setup and mutual help and sharing only leads to success. the right text gives an example of how lions hunt in a team, showing how co-operation can make a task easier and more efficient. in the same way, co-operative approach will save time, energy and will have a higher success rate in various fields and situations. therefore, co-operation is a valuable and necessary skill for children to learn and practice.
Outcome.Outcome6: Co-operation is essential for teamwork, and this is a skill that can be developed from an early age. educational systems emphasize on encouraging co-operative approach in children, so that they can learn to work with others, respect different perspectives, and contribute to a common goal. by fostering a co-operative attitude, children can prepare themselves for the challenges and opportunities of living in a social setup, where mutual help and sharing only leads to success. whether in academic, professional, or personal spheres, a person can not learn or achieve everything by oneself. co-operation can offer many benefits, such as saving time, energy, and resources, enhancing creativity and innovation, and increasing the chances of achieving desired outcomes. for instance, lions hunt in a team. it is only due to their teamwork that they are able to catch a prey and make task easy. in the same way, co-operative approach will help children and adults to overcome difficulties and accomplish their goals.

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the main reasons why people follow fashion trends is that they can help them express their identities and personalities in different social contexts. for example, by wearing clothes that suit their age, profession, and culture, people can convey a sense of confidence, competence, and respect. likewise, by adopting styles that reflect their hobbies, interests, and values, people can communicate their individuality, creativity, and diversity. fashion trends, therefore, provide people with a variety of options and inspirations to showcase their personal traits and preferences, while also respecting the norms and expectations of their surroundings.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the main reasons why fashion trends have a more essential role to play in people's lives than personal dressing styles is that they can influence people's attitudes, moods, and confidence levels. for example, wearing fashionable clothes can make people feel more confident and attractive, which can boost their self-esteem and performance in various situations. moreover, following fashion trends can help people express their personalities and preferences, as well as communicate with others who share similar tastes and interests. fashion trends can also reflect the social and cultural changes of different times and places, which can enrich people's knowledge and awareness of the world. therefore, fashion trends can have a positive impact on people's psychological and emotional well-being.
Outcome.Outcome3: Following fashion trends, therefore, not only helps people express their individuality and social identity, but also enhances their confidence and self-esteem. however, some people may argue that dressing in a personal style is more authentic and creative than conforming to the mainstream fashion. they believe that personal dressing styles reflect one's personality, values, and preferences, and that they can avoid being influenced by the commercialization and homogenization of fashion. in the following paragraphs, i will examine the merits and drawbacks of personal dressing styles and explain why i still favor fashion trends.
Outcome.Outcome4: Admittedly, personal dressing styles have some advantages over following fashion trends. they can reflect one's uniqueness, creativity, and authenticity, and express one's personality and preferences. they can also help one stand out from the crowd and avoid being stereotyped or influenced by others. however, personal dressing styles also have limitations and challenges. they may not suit different occasions, seasons, or cultures, and may cause misunderstandings or conflicts with others. they may also require more time, money, and effort to maintain and update, and may not always be appreciated or accepted by the public. therefore, personal dressing styles are not necessarily superior or easier than following fashion trends.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the main reasons why fashion trends have a more essential role to play in people's lives than personal dressing styles is that they provide guidance and inspiration for those who are interested in fashion but lack the skills or confidence to create their own looks. by following fashion trends, such people can learn from the experts and celebrities who set the standards of beauty and taste in different cultures and contexts. they can also discover new combinations and possibilities that suit their preferences and personalities, as well as experiment with different styles and accessories.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the main reasons why fashion trends are more important than personal dressing styles is that they reflect the cultural and social values of different times and places. by following fashion trends, people can show their respect and appreciation for the diverse and dynamic expressions of human creativity and identity. fashion trends also help people to communicate with others who share similar tastes and interests, and to create a sense of belonging and community.

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the main challenges of learning a foreign language in our own country is the lack of exposure to the authentic culture and communication of the target language. however, technology has reduced this separation by providing learners with more opportunities to access and interact with native speakers and cultural products. for example, learners can watch movies, listen to music, read news, and follow social media in the foreign language, which can help them develop their listening, reading, and intercultural skills. moreover, learners can use online platforms to communicate with other learners or tutors from different countries, who can offer feedback, guidance, and support. by using technology, learners can enhance their speaking and writing skills, as well as their motivation and confidence in the foreign language. therefore, technology has made learning a foreign language in our own country more engaging, effective, and enjoyable.
Outcome.Outcome2: Third, technology has also played a great role in reducing the separation between learning a foreign language in our own country. a large number of foreign language courses are available online and there are various forums where people can discuss their problems on different foreign languages. these resources can provide learners with more flexibility, accessibility, and diversity in their learning process. however, technology also poses some challenges for foreign language learning, such as the lack of face-to-face interaction, the quality and reliability of the online materials, and the need for self-discipline and motivation. therefore, learners should be aware of the advantages and disadvantages of using technology and choose the most suitable and effective methods for their own goals and preferences.
Outcome.Outcome3: Technology not only facilitates the acquisition of foreign language skills, but also enables learners to explore the cultural aspects of the languages they are studying. by accessing authentic materials, such as films, podcasts, newspapers, and websites, learners can gain insights into the values, beliefs, and customs of the people who speak those languages. moreover, technology can help learners to communicate and interact with native speakers or other learners from different countries and backgrounds, thus exposing them to diverse perspectives and experiences.
Outcome.Outcome4: Third, technology has also played a great role in reducing the separation between learning a foreign language in our own country. a large number of foreign language courses are available online and there are various forums where people can discuss their problems on different foreign languages. however, learning a foreign language is not only about mastering the grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation, but also about understanding the culture and the context of the speakers. culture influences the way we learn and use foreign languages in many ways, such as the expressions, gestures, values, and norms that are embedded in the communication. therefore, it is important to expose ourselves to the authentic and diverse cultural aspects of the foreign language we are learning, and to be aware of the similarities and differences between our own culture and the target culture.
Outcome.Outcome5: In addition to the benefits of travel and cultural exchange, learning a foreign language can also be facilitated by the use of technology. nowadays, learners can access a wide range of online resources and platforms that can help them improve their skills and knowledge. for example, they can enroll in foreign language courses that are offered by reputable institutions or instructors, and follow their own pace and schedule. they can also interact with other learners or native speakers through various forums, chat rooms, or social media, and practice their speaking and listening abilities. technology has thus reduced the gap between learning a foreign language in our own country and in the target country, and has made it more convenient and affordable.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the benefits of learning a foreign language in our own country is that we can access a variety of sources and materials to enrich our knowledge and skills. however, learning a foreign language also involves interacting with native speakers and experiencing the culture and context of the target language. this is where technology can help us overcome the geographical and temporal barriers that may limit our exposure and practice.

Outcome.Outcome1: Being present at classes is beneficial for understanding new material not only because of the opportunity of communicating with other students, but also because of the guidance and feedback from the instructors. for example, by attending classes, students can ask questions, clarify doubts, and participate in discussions that can enhance their comprehension and retention of the concepts. moreover, they can receive immediate and constructive feedback from the instructors, who can correct their mistakes, provide additional explanations, and suggest useful resources. these advantages can help students to master the material more effectively and efficiently than studying at home without any support.
Outcome.Outcome2: Communicating with other students can also enhance the learning outcomes of attending classes, as it enables students to exchange ideas, clarify doubts, and reinforce concepts. by discussing the new material with their peers, students can deepen their understanding, identify gaps in their knowledge, and find different perspectives and approaches to solve problems. moreover, communication can foster a sense of collaboration and support among students, which can motivate them to persist in their studies and overcome challenges. therefore, by attending classes, students can benefit from the social and cognitive aspects of communication, which can improve their academic performance and skills.
Outcome.Outcome3: Another advantage of attending classes regularly is that it fosters a sense of responsibility and diligence in students. by appearing in class, students have to follow the rules and expectations of their instructors and peers, such as being punctual, respectful, attentive, and participatory. these habits can help them develop self-discipline and professionalism that are essential for their academic and career success. moreover, attending classes also requires students to complete their assignments on time and with quality, which can enhance their skills of time management, research, analysis, and problem-solving. in contrast, students who study at home may lack the motivation and guidance to adhere to the standards and deadlines of their courses, and may struggle to cope with the challenges and complexities of the subject matter. therefore, attending classes can help students become more conscientious and persistent in their learning process.
Outcome.Outcome4: Another aspect that differentiates the students who study at home and the ones who attend classes is their study discipline and time management. being present at classes requires students to follow a certain schedule and to submit their assignments on time. this helps them to develop a sense of responsibility and to organize their study materials effectively. on the contrary, the ones who study at home have more flexibility and freedom in choosing when and how to study. this may lead to procrastination, distraction, or lack of motivation. as a result, they may not cover the essential topics or meet the deadlines. therefore, attending classes can enhance students' academic performance and skills by imposing some structure and order on their learning process.
Outcome.Outcome5: Being present at classes not only enhances students' communication and collaboration skills, but also fosters their sense of responsibility and diligence. on the contrary, studying at home may deprive them of the benefits of peer learning and the structure of academic expectations. moreover, attending classes has another advantage that cannot be ignored: it exposes students to different perspectives and insights from their instructors and classmates. this can enrich their knowledge and stimulate their critical thinking, as well as prepare them for the challenges and opportunities in their future careers. however, if they do not attend classes, they may miss out on these valuable learning experiences and limit their own potential.
Outcome.Outcome6: Furthermore, attending classes can enhance students' academic performance by exposing them to the feedback and guidance of their instructors. by participating in class discussions, asking questions, and receiving clarifications, students can deepen their understanding of the course content and improve their skills. in contrast, those who study at home may lack the interaction and support that can facilitate their learning and help them overcome difficulties. they may also miss out on valuable information and resources that are provided in class.

Outcome.Outcome1: However, salary is not the only factor that influences the choice of a job or the happiness of a worker. job satisfaction, which refers to the degree of satisfaction and fulfillment that a person feels from their work, is also a crucial aspect that needs to be considered. job satisfaction can affect the quality of work, the motivation and commitment of the employees, and their physical and mental well-being. therefore, it is important to look at other factors that can contribute to job satisfaction, such as the nature of the work, the working environment, the relationships with colleagues and managers, and the opportunities for growth and development.
Outcome.Outcome2: However, salary and career advancement are not the only factors that affect job satisfaction. other aspects, such as work environment, personal interest, social impact, etc., also play a significant role in making a job fulfilling and rewarding. for instance, working in a friendly and supportive atmosphere, where employees can communicate, collaborate and learn from each other, can enhance their motivation and morale. moreover, having a job that matches one's passion, talent and values can increase their sense of purpose and enjoyment. furthermore, having a job that makes a positive difference in the society, such as teaching, nursing, or volunteering, can give a sense of contribution and fulfillment. therefore, these factors should not be overlooked when choosing a job.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the vital aspects that need to be considered in choosing a job is the potential for professional development and recognition. professional achievements, skills and position can increase job satisfaction and motivation by enhancing one's self-esteem, confidence and sense of purpose. according to a study by herzberg et al. (1959), these factors are among the intrinsic motivators that make people feel good about their work and themselves, while salary is an extrinsic factor that can only prevent dissatisfaction but not create satisfaction. moreover, professional achievements, skills and position can also open up more opportunities for career advancement, learning and networking, which can further enrich one's work experience and personal growth. for instance, a teacher who receives positive feedback from students and colleagues, develops new teaching methods and obtains a higher qualification may feel more fulfilled and motivated than a teacher who only receives a high salary but has no room for improvement or recognition.
Outcome.Outcome4: In many societies, choice of a job depends on the size of the salary offered. nevertheless, while i admit that the salary is a very pivotal factor, i claim that there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard. one of these aspects is the personal fulfillment and enjoyment that a job can provide. further and even more importantly, most of the satisfaction of a job comes to people from their professional achievements, skills and the position they reach. in other words, career promotion or getting some kind of credit from the administration of a company or organization are, likely, more enjoyable achievements than getting a high salary. for example, people, who work in monotonous jobs, where no achievements or a new positions can be reached feel themselves more dissatisfied, even though they have very good salaries. therefore, it is clear that job satisfaction depends on a variety of factors, not just the amount of money one earns. in the following paragraph, i will examine the drawbacks of choosing a job based solely on salary.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, besides the size of the salary, one should also take into account the nature and the prospects of the job. a job that offers opportunities for learning, growth and recognition can be more rewarding and fulfilling than a job that pays well but does not challenge or inspire the worker. moreover, such a job can also enhance the worker's self-esteem, confidence and sense of purpose, which are essential for personal and professional development.
Outcome.Outcome6: Right text: further and even more importantly, most of the satisfaction of a job comes to people from their professional achievements, skills and the position they reach. in other words, career promotion or getting some kind of credit from the administration of a company or organization are, likely, more enjoyable achievements than getting a high salary. for example, people, who work in monotonous jobs, where no achievements or a new positions can be reached feel themselves more dissatisfied, even though they have a very good salaries.

Context.Left: The co-workers should be cooperative with one another. If they do not cooperate, there will be lots of disputes. I once had a co-worker who was too family conscious. Therefore he always left office sharp on time without giving any consideration whether the work has been finished or not. Most of the time, I had to do his work in order to protect him from getting caught to the supervisor who was a very authoritative person. However, one day I wanted to be off early because I had to take my mother to the doctor. When I requested my co-worker to give a helping hand to finish my work early, he turned down my request giving a silly excuse. From that day onwards I did not offer him any support and finally he was transferred from our department to a distant location as a punishment for his irresponsibility. Therefore, I believe if the co-workers do not corporate with each other that would be devastating in a work environment.
Context.Right: Finally, the co-workers should believe in fellowship. This helps them to enjoy their work life while building up very strong personal relationships. After all, you spend most of your day at office. If you have a good company in office, it is certainly a blessing.

Outcome.Outcome1: Cooperation is not only a moral duty, but also a practical necessity for co-workers. when they cooperate, they can share their skills, knowledge, and ideas to complete their tasks more efficiently and effectively. they can also support each other in times of need, such as covering for each other's absences, helping with deadlines, or solving problems. cooperation also fosters a positive and respectful work culture, where co-workers appreciate each other's contributions and feedback. this enhances their motivation, morale, and loyalty, which in turn improves their performance and satisfaction. on the contrary, when co-workers do not cooperate, they create conflicts, misunderstandings, and resentment, which harm their productivity, quality, and reputation. they also miss out on the opportunities to learn from each other and to grow professionally and personally. therefore, cooperation is vital for co-workers to succeed and enjoy their work life.
Outcome.Outcome2: Cooperation among co-workers not only prevents conflicts and problems, but also enhances the quality and efficiency of the work. for instance, when i was working on a project with a tight deadline, i faced some technical difficulties that i could not resolve on my own. fortunately, one of my co-workers who had more experience in that area offered to help me out and shared his knowledge and skills with me. together, we managed to complete the project on time and received appreciation from the client and the manager. this experience boosted my confidence and improved my relationship with my co-worker. therefore, i think cooperation among co-workers is a key factor for success and satisfaction in a work environment.
Outcome.Outcome3: In contrast to the uncooperative co-worker who caused disputes and dissatisfaction in the first paragraph, a cooperative co-worker would have been more supportive and understanding of the needs and challenges of his or her colleagues. a cooperative co-worker would have been willing to share the workload, to accommodate reasonable requests, and to communicate effectively with the supervisor and the team. by doing so, a cooperative co-worker would have contributed to a positive and productive work environment, where the tasks are completed efficiently and the quality is maintained. moreover, a cooperative co-worker would have fostered a sense of fellowship among the co-workers, as the second paragraph suggests. this would have enhanced the work life of the co-workers, as they would have felt appreciated, respected, and valued. they would have also developed strong personal relationships that would have enriched their professional and personal growth. therefore, cooperation among co-workers is essential for a successful and satisfying work environment.
Outcome.Outcome4: Fellowship among co-workers can enhance their work life and personal relationships in many ways. for example, when co-workers share their joys and sorrows, they can support each other emotionally and mentally. they can also learn from each other's skills and experiences, and help each other to improve their performance and creativity. moreover, when co-workers have a friendly and respectful attitude towards each other, they can avoid conflicts and misunderstandings that can harm their work quality and morale. therefore, fellowship among co-workers can make them more cooperative, productive, and satisfied in their work environment.
Outcome.Outcome5: On the other hand, cooperation among co-workers is not only beneficial for completing the tasks efficiently, but also for creating a positive and friendly atmosphere in the workplace. cooperation means respecting each other's opinions, sharing the workload, and helping out when someone is in need. this way, co-workers can avoid conflicts, misunderstandings, and resentment that can harm their performance and morale. moreover, cooperation can foster a sense of fellowship among co-workers, which is essential for enjoying their work life and building strong personal relationships.
Outcome.Outcome6: Cooperation among co-workers is not only beneficial for the productivity and quality of work, but also for the morale and well-being of the employees. when co-workers cooperate, they can share their skills, knowledge, and resources, as well as support each other in times of need. moreover, cooperation fosters a sense of trust, respect, and appreciation among co-workers, which can enhance their satisfaction and motivation. on the other hand, when co-workers do not cooperate, they may face conflicts, misunderstandings, and resentment, which can harm their performance and reputation. for example, i had a bad experience with a co-worker who was selfish and unhelpful, and who eventually faced the consequences of his actions. therefore, i value cooperation as a key factor for a successful and harmonious work environment.

These wastes including household waste and industrial waste are so big that a "new" continent is now being formed in the sea from garbage. Furthermore, the industrial exhaust gases are adulterating the air, causing the insalubrious phenomenon such as acid rain, global warming or climate change.

Outcome.Outcome1: The main idea of the essay is to explore how human activities are damaging the natural environment and threatening the health and survival of living beings. the left text introduces the topic by stating that people are corrupting their ecosphere, or the sphere of life that surrounds them, with their excessive consumption and waste production. the right text provides some examples of the negative impacts of human waste and pollution on the sea, the air, and the climate. the essay will further examine the causes, consequences, and possible solutions of this environmental crisis.
Outcome.Outcome2: The ecosphere, the complex system of living and nonliving components that sustains life on earth, is facing a serious threat from human activities. people are corrupting their ecosphere by producing and discarding enormous amounts of waste, and by emitting harmful gases that pollute the air and alter the climate. this essay will examine the causes and consequences of these environmental problems, and propose some possible solutions to protect the ecosphere from further damage.
Outcome.Outcome3: The problem of waste accumulation is not only a threat to the marine life and the natural balance of the oceans, but also a source of air pollution. many of the wastes discarded by human contain toxic or non-biodegradable materials, such as plastics, metals, chemicals, and batteries, that can release harmful substances into the atmosphere when they are burned, decomposed, or exposed to sunlight. moreover, some of the wastes, such as organic matter, can produce methane, a potent greenhouse gas that contributes to global warming. therefore, the disposal of wastes in the sea or on land has serious implications for the quality and health of the air we breathe.
Outcome.Outcome4: People are corrupting their ecosphere. in recent decades, concurrently with the increase of human consume, the waste discarded by human also multiplies. these wastes including household waste and industrial waste are so big that a "new" continent is now being formed in the sea from garbage. another serious consequence of human activity is the deterioration of the atmospheric quality. the industrial exhaust gases are adulterating the air, causing the insalubrious phenomenon such as acid rain, global warming or climate change. acid rain damages the soil, the vegetation and the aquatic life, as well as eroding the buildings and monuments. global warming alters the natural balance of the earth, leading to melting ice caps, rising sea levels, extreme weather events and loss of biodiversity. climate change poses a threat to the survival of many species, including humans, who depend on the stability and predictability of the ecosphere.
Outcome.Outcome5: The left text and the right text both illustrate the negative impacts of human activities on the environment. people are corrupting their ecosphere by consuming more resources and producing more waste than the natural systems can handle. the right text provides some examples of how the waste discarded by human, such as household waste and industrial waste, are polluting the sea and the air. the sea is becoming a dumping ground for garbage, creating a "new" continent that threatens marine life and ecosystems. the air is becoming contaminated by industrial exhaust gases, causing health problems and environmental issues such as acid rain, global warming or climate change. these phenomena have serious consequences for the biodiversity, the weather patterns, and the quality of life of all living beings.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the most alarming consequences of the human-induced ecosphere corruption is the threat to the biodiversity of the planet. the accumulation of garbage in the sea not only pollutes the water, but also endangers the marine life that ingests or gets entangled in the plastic and other debris. similarly, the emission of greenhouse gases and other pollutants into the atmosphere not only affects the human health, but also disrupts the natural balance of the ecosystems, leading to the loss of habitats, species extinction, and the spread of invasive and infectious organisms. therefore, the human impact on the environment is not only a moral issue, but also a survival issue, as the degradation of the ecosphere jeopardizes the resources and services that sustain the human civilization.

Outcome.Outcome1: Learning a foreign language is a valuable skill that can open many doors for personal and professional development. however, not everyone has the same opportunity or ease to acquire a new language, especially as they grow older. in this essay, i will argue that childhood is the best time to learn a foreign language for several reasons. first, the ability of learning in the childhood period is more powerful than other periods of life. thereby students in the beginning of their education can learn faster and easier in compare to a young one to understand a foreign language. they can easily understand the language structure and memorize the vocabularies. it is out of of the questioned that the persistence of learning a knowledge in the childhood is more than other period of lives. by considering this and being aware of that students have not any responsibility and other difficulty in comparison with a young man, we can infer that why this time is the best time to learn any language.
Outcome.Outcome2: Learning in the childhood period is more powerful than other periods of life for several reasons. first, the brain of a child is more flexible and adaptable than that of an adult, which enables them to acquire new linguistic skills more easily. second, children are exposed to various sources of input and feedback, such as parents, teachers, peers, and media, which enhance their language development. third, children have more motivation and curiosity to learn a foreign language, as they are interested in exploring different cultures and perspectives. furthermore, learning a foreign language in the childhood period can have long-term benefits, such as improving cognitive abilities, academic performance, and career opportunities. therefore, it is not surprising that many researchers and educators recommend introducing a foreign language to students in the beginning of their education.
Outcome.Outcome3: Learning a foreign language in childhood can have many advantages for the students in their academic, personal, and professional development. by acquiring a foreign language at an early age, students can enhance their cognitive skills, such as memory, creativity, and problem-solving, which can help them in their future studies and careers. moreover, students can develop their intercultural competence, which can enable them to communicate effectively and respectfully with people from different backgrounds and cultures, and to appreciate the diversity and richness of the world. furthermore, students can expand their opportunities and choices in life, as they can access more information, resources, and networks in a globalized society, and pursue their interests and passions in different fields and domains. therefore, learning a foreign language in childhood can be a valuable and rewarding experience for the students, as it can enrich their knowledge, skills, and personality.
Outcome.Outcome4: The lack of exposure and practice opportunities. children may not have enough contact with native speakers, authentic materials, or real-life situations where they can use the language they are learning. this may limit their input, output, and feedback, and affect their confidence and fluency. to overcome this challenge, teachers and parents can provide more exposure and practice opportunities for children, such as through online platforms, language clubs, exchange programs, or bilingual education.
Outcome.Outcome5: Learning a foreign language is a valuable skill that can enhance one's communication, cultural awareness, and career prospects. however, not everyone has the same opportunity or ease to acquire a new language. some factors that can affect one's language learning ability are the age, motivation, and environment of the learner. in this essay, i will argue that the best time to learn a foreign language is in the childhood period, based on the following reasons. first, the ability of learning in the childhood period is more powerful than other periods of life. thereby students in the beginning of their education can learn faster and easier in compare to a young one to understand a foreign language. they can easily understand the language structure and memorize the vocabularies. it is out of of the questioned that the persistence of learning a knowledge in the childhood is more than other period of lives. by considering this and being aware of that students have not any responsibility and other difficulty in comparison with a young man, we can infer that why this time is the best time to learn any language. second, learning a foreign language in the childhood period can also have positive effects on the cognitive, social, and emotional development of the learner.
Outcome.Outcome6: Second, learning a foreign language in the childhood period can bring many benefits for the students' future academic and professional development. as the world is becoming more globalized and interconnected, the demand for bilingual or multilingual speakers is increasing in various fields and sectors. students who learn a foreign language from an early age can have more opportunities to access different sources of information, communicate with diverse people and cultures, and enhance their cognitive and creative skills. moreover, they can have an advantage over their peers who start learning a foreign language later in life, as they can achieve higher levels of proficiency and fluency. therefore, learning a foreign language in the childhood period can prepare the students for the challenges and opportunities of the 21st century.

Context.Right: One of the major concerns against freeing artists' creation derives from the fear of social misleading which would destabilize the society; however, I believe the audiences have their own judgement and are not likely to be misled or influenced by some art work. It is needless to say that art inevitably involves imagination, exaggeration and sometimes is purely fabricated; regardless of whether the work of art is based on truth or not, it is the public's authority to determine how to interpret its meaning. If the art displays unreality, the public audiences certainly have the acumen to recognise its untruthfulness and only appreciate its art value; if the art reflects the reality, then what would be the intention to ban it if it was not for covering the dirty truth? Would it be autocratic if the government clamp down the artists who are telling the truth? In a word, the notion of being afraid of social misleading is unjustified.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of censorship and artistic freedom in the first sentence.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some background information on why censorship is imposed on some art works and what are the arguments for and against it.
Prompt.Prompt3: Start the second paragraph with a topic sentence that introduces the first point of your argument, which is the public's ability to judge art works critically.
Prompt.Prompt4: Use examples, evidence and analysis to support your point and explain how it relates to your thesis statement.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Censorship and artistic freedom are often in conflict, as some authorities may try to restrict or suppress the expression of artists who challenge the status quo, expose the flaws of the society, or explore controversial issues. one of the major concerns against freeing artists' creation derives from the fear of social misleading which would destabilize the society; however, i believe the audiences have their own judgement and are not likely to be misled or influenced by some art work. it is needless to say that art inevitably involves imagination, exaggeration and sometimes is purely fabricated; regardless of whether the work of art is based on truth or not, it is the public's authority to determine how to interpret its meaning. if the art displays unreality, the public audiences certainly have the acumen to recognise its untruthfulness and only appreciate its art value; if the art reflects the reality, then what would be the intention to ban it if it was not for covering the dirty truth? would it be autocratic if the government clamp down the artists who are telling the truth? in a word, the notion of being afraid of social misleading is unjustified.
Outcome.Outcome2: Censorship is the practice of suppressing or restricting the expression of certain ideas, images, or messages that are deemed offensive, harmful, or undesirable by some authority. some art works, especially those that deal with controversial topics such as politics, religion, sexuality, or violence, may face censorship from governments, religious institutions, or other groups that seek to control the public discourse and maintain social order. however, censorship also raises ethical and aesthetic issues, as it may violate the freedom of speech and creativity of the artists, and deprive the audiences of the opportunity to access diverse and challenging forms of art. therefore, there is a heated debate on whether censorship is justified or necessary, and what are the criteria and limits for regulating artistic expression.
Outcome.Outcome3: The public's ability to judge art works critically is one of the main reasons why artists should be free to create without censorship or interference. art works are not merely passive representations of reality, but also expressions of the artists' perspectives, emotions and creativity. the audiences who encounter these works are not naive or gullible, but have their own experiences, knowledge and opinions that enable them to analyse, evaluate and appreciate the art works in their own ways. they can distinguish between fact and fiction, between propaganda and critique, between beauty and ugliness. they can also engage in dialogue and debate with other audiences, artists and critics, and form their own views on the social, cultural and political issues that the art works raise. therefore, the fear of social misleading is unfounded, as the public is not a homogeneous mass that can be easily manipulated or deceived by art works, but a diverse and active community that can benefit from the artistic freedom and diversity.
Outcome.Outcome4: Therefore, artists should be free to create whatever they want, as long as they do not violate the basic rights and dignity of others. by restricting their freedom of expression, the government would not only infringe on their artistic autonomy, but also deprive the public of the opportunity to access diverse and critical perspectives on various issues. for example, a film that depicts the corruption and injustice in a certain regime may be censored or banned by the authorities, but it may also inspire the viewers to question and challenge the status quo. similarly, a novel that explores the complex and controversial aspects of human nature may be deemed immoral or offensive by some groups, but it may also enrich the readers' understanding and empathy for different characters and situations. thus, art can be a powerful tool for social change and education, as well as a source of aesthetic pleasure and entertainment.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, artists should be free to create whatever they want without any censorship or restriction from the authorities. their creation is a form of expression and communication that can enrich the cultural diversity and stimulate the intellectual curiosity of the society. the audiences are not passive recipients of the artists' messages, but active participants who can critically evaluate and respond to them. the fear of social misleading is based on a false assumption that the public is easily manipulated or corrupted by the artistic representation of reality or unreality. on the contrary, the public can distinguish between fact and fiction, and appreciate the artistic value of the creation.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, i contend that artists should be free to create whatever they want without any censorship or restriction from the government or other authorities. art is a form of expression and communication that can enrich our culture, challenge our perspectives and inspire our emotions. by limiting or suppressing art, we are not only violating the artists' rights, but also depriving ourselves of the opportunity to learn, grow and appreciate the diversity of human creativity.

For instance, when Vietnam became the champion of SEAGAMES for the first time in 28, a festival atmosphere permeated into the streets.
