Outcome.Outcome1: Sporting events are not only a source of entertainment and competition, but also a powerful way of fostering national pride and unity among people. whether it is the olympics, the world cup, or regional tournaments, sport events can bring out the best in athletes and spectators, who share a common identity and a sense of belonging to their country. in this essay, i will discuss two main reasons why sporting events can enhance patriotic feelings and social cohesion. firstly, sporting events can create a sense of solidarity and mutual support among people from different backgrounds and regions. secondly, sporting events can play an essential role in raising patriotic emotions in both athletes and spectators. seeing national flags be honored may be the most emotional moments to each athlete. the athlete also seems to be more aware of his responsibilities and he wants to contribute more to his beloved country. when witnessing our national flags flying proudly among others, many of us can stop hiding our pride and happiness. for instance, when vietnam became the champion of seagames for the first time in 2008, a festival atmosphere permeated into the streets. people from all ages turned out to the streets with flags, banners and they sang aloud songs of ho chi minh president. the eager atmosphere lasted many next days. in fact, some hooligans were so excited that they took part in motor racing or using fireworks illegally. however, the hooligans only took a minority of people. therefore, it can be said that sport events help to wake up love and responsibilities strongly in each citizen.
Outcome.Outcome2: Besides strengthening the physical and mental health of individuals, sports also have positive impacts on the social and political aspects of a nation. by participating in or watching sports, people can develop a sense of national identity and solidarity, which can enhance their loyalty, cooperation and mutual respect. this can help to overcome the differences and conflicts that may arise from diverse backgrounds, cultures and interests. moreover, having a strong national identity and solidarity can also boost the confidence and reputation of a nation in the international arena, as well as foster the spirit of fair play and sportsmanship. therefore, sports can be seen as a powerful tool to promote national unity and harmony.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, using sports as a tool for patriotism also has some drawbacks or challenges that need to be addressed. first of all, excessive patriotism can lead to nationalism, which is a belief that one's own nation is superior or more deserving than others. this can foster negative stereotypes, prejudice, and hostility towards other countries or groups, especially in the context of international competitions or conflicts. for example, some fans may resort to violence, vandalism, or racism to express their support for their team or their hatred for the opponents. secondly, sports can also be exploited by political or ideological agendas that aim to manipulate public opinion or divert attention from social or economic problems. for example, some governments may use sports as a way to boost their legitimacy, popularity, or propaganda, while neglecting or suppressing the voices and needs of their citizens. moreover, some athletes may face pressure, discrimination, or corruption from the authorities or the media, depending on their performance, background, or views.
Outcome.Outcome4: In conclusion, sporting events have significant impacts on both individual and national development. they not only promote physical and mental health, but also foster social cohesion and patriotic feelings. by participating in or watching sports, people can enhance their skills, confidence, teamwork, and respect for others. moreover, they can express their pride and joy for their country and its achievements. therefore, it is undeniable that sport events are beneficial for everyone in many aspects.
Outcome.Outcome5: Besides enhancing our physical and mental health, sporting events also have positive impacts on our social and cultural aspects. by participating in or watching sports, we can learn more about other countries and cultures, as well as foster mutual respect and understanding. sports can also promote peace and cooperation among nations, especially when they are held in a fair and friendly manner. for example, the olympic games are often seen as a symbol of global solidarity and harmony, where athletes from different backgrounds and beliefs can compete with each other in a spirit of sportsmanship. moreover, sports can also create a sense of belonging and identity for people who share the same national or regional affiliation.
Outcome.Outcome6: Besides enhancing physical and mental health, sporting occasions have another significant benefit: they can foster a sense of national identity and pride. this is especially important in the context of globalization, when many countries face the challenge of preserving their cultural and historical heritage. sporting occasions can help to reinforce the bonds between people who share the same nationality and values.

Context.Left: Living with a roommate saves me a lot of money. If you have roommates, you can split the rent and utilities among them. This means you can get more for less. For example, last year, I shared a room off-campus with my friend, and we decided to split the rent and heating bills into half: I was able to save about fifty dollars for heating, and two hundred dollars for rent monthly. I was able to save a lot of money by sharing wasted heating and rooms with my friend and splitting the bills.
Context.Right: Finally, living with a roommate allows me to get help. It often is the case that your roommates have the skills or knowledge you need. When you run into a problem, you can ask your roommates if they can help. Some of them may have something to offer. To illustrate, when my computer mysteriously broke down, I dialed up the manufacturer and asked for help. They failed to give me any useful solutions. To my surprise, one of my roommates noticed my problems and offered to help. He was very good with computers, and he managed to fix the problem quickly.

Outcome.Outcome1: Another benefit of living with a roommate is that it can improve your social life. having roommates means you have more opportunities to interact with different people, make new friends, and learn from their experiences and perspectives. you can also enjoy some activities together, such as watching movies, playing games, or cooking meals. living with a roommate can also help you develop some important skills, such as communication, cooperation, and compromise. these skills can help you in your personal and professional relationships. therefore, living with a roommate can be a rewarding and enriching experience.
Outcome.Outcome2: Living with a roommate not only saves me a lot of money, but also enriches my social life. having a roommate means i always have someone to talk to, hang out with, and share interests with. for instance, last month, my roommate and i decided to go to a nearby park for a picnic. we packed some sandwiches, fruits, and drinks, and enjoyed the sunshine and fresh air. we also played some games, listened to music, and chatted about various topics. it was a fun and relaxing way to spend a saturday afternoon. i felt closer to my roommate and appreciated his company.
Outcome.Outcome3: Besides the social benefits of living with a roommate, there are also some practical benefits that make my life easier and more comfortable. living with a roommate not only helps me make friends and have fun, but also saves me money and gives me support. here are some examples of how living with a roommate can be advantageous in practical ways.
Outcome.Outcome4: Living with a roommate saves me a lot of money, and it also provides me with other benefits. by sharing a room and splitting the bills with my friend, i was able to save about $250 per month, which adds up to $3000 per year. that is a significant amount of money that i can use for other purposes, such as paying for tuition, books, or entertainment. moreover, living with a roommate allows me to get help when i need it.
Outcome.Outcome5: Living with a roommate saves me a lot of money, but that is not the only benefit. another advantage of having a roommate is that i can enjoy more social interaction and companionship. living alone can be lonely and boring, especially during the pandemic. however, when i have a roommate, i always have someone to talk to, share my feelings, and have fun with. we can watch movies, play games, cook together, or go out and explore the city. having a roommate also helps me to improve my communication and conflict resolution skills, as we have to respect each other's preferences, boundaries, and needs. living with a roommate makes my life more interesting and fulfilling.
Outcome.Outcome6: Living with a roommate saves me a lot of money, but that is not the only benefit of having a roommate. another advantage is that living with a roommate allows me to get help.

Outcome.Outcome1: Public investment is the use of public funds to provide or improve the infrastructure and services that are essential for the well-being and development of society. one of the most important areas of public investment is health and education, which directly affect the quality of life and the human capital of the population. in this essay, i will argue that investing in hospitals and schools is worth every penny, as it helps to enhance people's health and education, and to prevent the deterioration of our living standards. it is obvious axiomatic that indispensable public services like hospital and school worth every penny investing. investing in hospitals helps improve people's health, also, in schools assists with raising our children's education level. apparently if these facilities were not spent adequately, our standard of living would deteriorate.
Outcome.Outcome2: Public investment in indispensable services like hospital and school is not only a moral duty, but also a wise strategy for enhancing social welfare and economic development. by allocating sufficient funds to these sectors, the government can ensure that its citizens have access to quality health care and education, which are essential for their well-being, productivity, and human capital. moreover, public investment can stimulate economic activity, create jobs, and generate tax revenues, as well as reduce inequalities and social problems. therefore, it is obvious axiomatic that indispensable public services like hospital and school worth every penny investing. investing in hospitals helps improve people's health, also, in schools assists with raising our children's education level. apparently if these facilities were not spent adequately, our standard of living would deteriorate.
Outcome.Outcome3: It is obvious axiomatic that indispensable public services like hospital and school worth every penny investing. investing in hospitals helps improve people's health, also, in schools assists with raising our children's education level. for instance, public investment projects such as building new hospitals, upgrading medical equipment, training health workers, expanding vaccination programs, and promoting preventive care can reduce mortality, morbidity, and inequality in health outcomes. similarly, public investment projects such as constructing new schools, providing quality teachers, enhancing curriculum, increasing access to early childhood education, and supporting special needs students can improve learning outcomes, skills, and opportunities for the future generations. apparently if these facilities were not spent adequately, our standard of living would deteriorate.
Outcome.Outcome4: It is obvious axiomatic that indispensable public services like hospital and school worth every penny investing. however, not all governments or communities allocate sufficient resources to these vital sectors, which can have serious repercussions for the well-being of the population. underfunding public services can result in poor infrastructure, equipment, and staff, leading to lower quality and accessibility of health care and education. this can increase the risks of diseases, injuries, and mortality, as well as widen the gaps in skills, knowledge, and opportunities among different groups. moreover, underfunding public services can undermine the social cohesion, trust, and participation that are essential for a democratic and inclusive society. therefore, investing in hospitals and schools is not only a moral duty, but also a smart and strategic decision for the long-term development and prosperity of the nation. investing in hospitals helps improve people's health, also, in schools assists with raising our children's education level. apparently if these facilities were not spent adequately, our standard of living would deteriorate.
Outcome.Outcome5: It is obvious axiomatic that indispensable public services like hospital and school worth every penny investing. these sectors not only provide essential care and learning for the citizens, but also contribute to the social and economic development of the country. investing in hospitals helps improve people's health, also, in schools assists with raising our children's education level. hence, adequate funding and support for these facilities are crucial to maintain and enhance the quality and accessibility of these services. apparently if these facilities were not spent adequately, our standard of living would deteriorate. therefore, it is in the best interest of the government and the society to allocate sufficient resources and attention to these vital public services.
Outcome.Outcome6: It is obvious axiomatic that indispensable public services like hospital and school worth every penny investing. these services are essential for ensuring the well-being and development of the population, especially in times of crisis or emergency. investing in hospitals helps improve people's health, also, in schools assists with raising our children's education level. apparently if these facilities were not spent adequately, our standard of living would deteriorate.

Context.Left: It is felt by many that the usage of machines is harmful for health of humans since machines decrease the work done by people. For example, in many institutions staircases are replaced by lifts now a days. People opt for elevators instead of climbing one or two flight of stairs. It is confirmed in a number of researches that daily usage of elevators in workplaces promotes obesity. So this example clearly shows the linkage between using machines and adverse health effects.
Context.Right: After analyzing these two points of view, it is believed that using machines is advantageous as machines make work easy and smooth. The negative effects on health can be put on the back seat because there are many other ways to exercise and stay healthy. Therefore, it is hoped that in coming time people will enjoy using more and more machines and will choose alternative ways to stay disease free.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of machines and their impact on human health and productivity in the first sentence.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain the benefits of machines for various sectors and activities, such as agriculture, industry, transportation, communication, etc.
Prompt.Prompt3: Acknowledge the drawbacks of machines for human health, such as reducing physical activity, increasing stress, causing pollution, etc.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from the drawbacks to the advantages of machines smooth. You can use words like however, nevertheless, despite, etc.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Machines are ubiquitous in modern life and they have a significant impact on human health and productivity. some people argue that machines are harmful for health because they reduce the physical activity of humans and promote sedentary lifestyles. for instance, many people prefer to use elevators instead of stairs, which can lead to obesity and other health problems. however, others contend that machines are beneficial because they make work easy and smooth and save time and energy. they claim that the negative effects on health can be overcome by adopting other ways of exercising and staying healthy. in this essay, i will analyze these two perspectives and explain why i agree with the latter one.
Outcome.Outcome2: However, the proponents of machines argue that they have numerous benefits for various sectors and activities, such as agriculture, industry, transportation, communication, etc. machines can increase productivity, efficiency, quality, and innovation in these fields, and thus contribute to economic growth, social development, and environmental protection. for example, machines can help farmers to cultivate more land, harvest more crops, and reduce losses due to pests and diseases. machines can also help industries to produce more goods, reduce costs, and improve safety and standards. moreover, machines can facilitate transportation and communication, by enabling faster, cheaper, and easier movement of people, goods, and information. machines can also enhance education, entertainment, and health care, by providing access to more resources, opportunities, and services.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, the opponents of machines argue that they have detrimental effects on human health in various ways. they claim that machines reduce the physical activity of people, which is essential for maintaining a healthy weight, preventing chronic diseases, and enhancing mental well-being. they also point out that machines increase the stress levels of people, as they have to cope with the demands of fast-paced and competitive work environments, and the risks of malfunctions and accidents. moreover, they contend that machines cause environmental pollution, such as noise, air, and water contamination, which harm the health of both humans and other living beings. these arguments suggest that machines have a negative impact on the quality of life of people and the sustainability of the planet.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, not everyone agrees that machines are harmful for health of humans. some people argue that machines have many advantages that outweigh the drawbacks. they claim that machines enhance productivity, efficiency, and quality of work. they also point out that machines can perform tasks that are too dangerous, difficult, or tedious for humans. furthermore, they assert that machines do not necessarily prevent people from exercising and staying healthy, as they can choose other forms of physical activity and adopt a balanced diet.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, not everyone agrees that machines are harmful for health of humans. some people argue that machines are beneficial as they save time and energy, increase productivity and efficiency, and reduce human errors and risks. they claim that machines do not necessarily reduce the physical activity of people, but rather allow them to choose other forms of exercise and fitness. for instance, people who use elevators can still walk or cycle to work, join a gym or a sports club, or do yoga or meditation at home. these people believe that machines are not the cause of health problems, but rather the lifestyle choices and habits of people.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, not everyone agrees that machines are harmful for health of humans. some people argue that machines are beneficial for various reasons. they claim that machines increase efficiency, productivity, and quality of work. they also point out that machines can perform tasks that are too difficult, dangerous, or tedious for humans. for instance, machines can help in medical diagnosis, manufacturing, agriculture, and transportation. these people also suggest that using machines does not necessarily mean neglecting physical activity. they believe that people can balance their use of machines with regular exercise, healthy diet, and proper rest.

Since now buses are only a kind of public transportation in this community, It makes people in this area have no choice. They must take only a bus to go to another place. If a subway and a sky train are available here, it will be more convenience to them. For example, people can estimate time from taking a subway train due to the train schedule. On the contrary they cannot do so in case of a bus. Also, this improvement will decrease a bad traffic on the road indirectly.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain why buses are not enough to meet the needs of the people in this area and how they cause traffic problems.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some evidence or examples to support your argument that a subway train or a sky train would be more convenient and efficient for the people.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that summarizes your main points and links them to the benefits of public transportation for the environment and society.

Outcome.Outcome1: Buses alone are not enough to meet the needs of the people in this area because they are often overcrowded, unreliable, and slow. people have to wait a long time for a bus to arrive, or they may not find a seat on the bus, or they may get stuck in traffic jams along the way. these problems make it difficult for people to travel efficiently and comfortably, and they also contribute to more pollution and noise on the road. therefore, buses are only a kind of public transportation in this community, but not a satisfactory one.
Outcome.Outcome2: A subway train or a sky train would not only offer more options for public transportation, but also be more convenient and efficient for the people in this community. for instance, a subway train or a sky train could run faster and more frequently than a bus, avoiding the congestion and delays on the roads. moreover, a subway train or a sky train could cover a larger area and connect to more destinations, making it easier for people to travel for work, education, or leisure. furthermore, a subway train or a sky train could reduce the air pollution and noise caused by the buses, improving the quality of life and the environment for the residents. therefore, a subway train or a sky train could benefit the people in this community in many ways.
Outcome.Outcome3: In conclusion, public transportation in this community needs to be improved by providing more alternatives, such as a subway train or a sky train, that can offer more convenience, reliability, and efficiency to the residents. by doing so, not only will people have more options to travel, but also the traffic congestion and pollution on the roads will be reduced. this will have positive impacts on the environment and society, as it will save energy, lower emissions, and enhance the quality of life for the people in this area. therefore, investing in public transportation is a worthwhile and beneficial solution for this community.
Outcome.Outcome4: Therefore, having more alternatives to use public transportation, such as a subway train or a sky train, would benefit the people in this community greatly. it would not only offer them more convenience and flexibility, but also reduce the traffic congestion and pollution on the roads. to make this happen, the government and the local authorities should invest more in developing and expanding the public transportation network in this area. they should also encourage the residents to use public transportation more often by providing incentives, such as discounts, subsidies, or rewards. by doing so, they would improve the quality of life and the environment in this community.
Outcome.Outcome5: Another way to improve the quality of life in this community is to provide more green spaces and recreational facilities. green spaces can improve the air quality, reduce noise pollution, and offer a place for relaxation and exercise. recreational facilities can enhance the physical and mental health of the residents, as well as create opportunities for social interaction and community engagement. for instance, parks, playgrounds, sports centers, libraries, and museums can attract people of different ages and interests. therefore, having more green spaces and recreational facilities can make this community more livable and enjoyable.
Outcome.Outcome6: Another way to improve the quality of life in this community is to encourage people to use bicycles or walk more often. this will not only reduce the air pollution and noise caused by cars, but also promote the health and well-being of the residents. moreover, cycling and walking can help people to enjoy the natural scenery and the local culture of this community, which can enhance their sense of belonging and identity. for instance, people can visit the nearby park, museum, or market by bike or on foot, and interact with their neighbors and friends along the way.

I believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. I have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work.
Context.Right: Moreover, it is hard to get manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. MPhils and PhDs scholars are probably engage in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some statistics or evidence to support your claim that free education can increase the number of scholars and improve their quality of research.

Outcome.Outcome1: Free education is a desirable goal that can benefit many scholars who are eager to pursue higher studies and contribute to the advancement of knowledge. a famous proverb knowledge is power has demonstrated the value of education. i believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. i have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work. moreover, it is hard to manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. mphils and phds scholars are probably engaged in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. the idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.
Outcome.Outcome2: Free of cost education can not only make higher studies accessible to more interested scholars, but also improve the quality of their research. according to a study by unesco, countries that offer free or low-fee tertiary education have higher enrollment rates and higher research output than those that charge high fees. for example, norway, which provides free education to all students regardless of nationality, has an enrollment rate of 94% and ranks among the top 20 countries in terms of scientific publications per capita. on the other hand, the united states, which has one of the most expensive higher education systems in the world, has an enrollment rate of 69% and ranks 11th in terms of research output. free education can also reduce the financial burden and stress on scholars, allowing them to focus more on their academic goals and pursue innovative and impactful research.
Outcome.Outcome3: Free education can greatly benefit the scholars who are interested in pursuing higher studies and research. by providing free of cost education, universities can reduce the financial burden and stress of the scholars who otherwise have to worry about paying high fees or finding a job to support themselves. this can allow them to focus on their studies and research without any distraction or compromise. free education can also encourage more scholars to apply for good universities and enhance the quality and diversity of the academic community.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, some might argue that providing free education to the interested scholars would be unfair to those who have worked hard to pay their fees or to the universities that need to cover their operational costs and maintain their standards. they might also claim that free education would reduce the motivation and commitment of the scholars or lower the quality and competitiveness of the academic programs. these arguments, however, are not convincing enough to outweigh the benefits of free education. first of all, free education does not mean that the scholars would not have to meet any academic requirements or criteria to enroll or graduate from the universities. they would still have to demonstrate their merit, potential, and passion for their fields of study. secondly, free education does not imply that the universities would lose their funding or reputation. on the contrary, they could attract more talented and diverse scholars from different backgrounds and regions, who could contribute to the advancement of knowledge and innovation. they could also seek alternative sources of income, such as donations, grants, partnerships, or endowments, to support their missions and goals. thirdly, free education does not diminish the value or the challenge of the academic programs. rather, it enables the scholars to focus more on their learning and research, without worrying about the financial burden or the trade-off between work and study. it also fosters a culture of collaboration and solidarity among the scholars, who could share their resources, ideas, and experiences. therefore, free education is not only a right, but also a responsibility and an opportunity for the interested scholars and the universities.
Outcome.Outcome5: A famous proverb knowledge is power has demonstrated the value of education. i believe that universities should provide free of cost education to the interested scholars because now-a-days universities with good name charge high fees and this leads one to think about affordability. i have observed that many of the interested scholars failed to get the admission in good universities because they have to think about work along with the studies, and this left them with only one choice, which is work. therefore, free education would not only remove the financial barrier for the deserving students, but also enable them to focus on their academic goals and aspirations. moreover, it is hard to manage two things at a time for instance, working and studying is not an easy job for the scholars, they need to concentrate on their studies. mphils and phds scholars are probably engaged in the research work, which takes their full concentration and surveys. the idea of free of charge education inspires those scholars who really want to put their efforts and get a degree from best universities.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, the high cost of education is not the only obstacle that prevents many scholars from pursuing their academic goals. another challenge is the difficulty of balancing work and study, especially for those who are involved in advanced research.

Context.Left: Since the dawn of time, human has considered meat as a fundamental protein sources. Meat has served as the main dish in almost every family's meals all around the world. Recent years, however, has seen a rapid increase in the number of vegetarians. Some people claim that this is brought about by the care for animal rights issue, others think it is much beyond that. It is clear to me that people avoid eating meat mostly for the sake of their health and relegious aspect.
Context.Right: Secondy, relegious beliefs also contributes to a vegetarian diet. Some religion, such as Buddha, believes that animals were human being in their previous life, so eating their meat mean you eat the flesh of your parent sentient beings. It is often said that this view is rather unscientific. However, I am convinced that it is vital to follow one's own religious practices which can bring the enlightenment in mind.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the main topic of your essay and state your thesis statement in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Talk more about the care for animal rights issue and how it influences some people to adopt a vegetarian diet in the second paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt3: Elaborate on the health benefits of avoiding meat consumption and provide some evidence or examples to support your claim in the third paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from health to religion smooth. You can mention some common values or goals that both vegetarians and religious followers share.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the most controversial topics in modern society is whether or not to eat meat. since the dawn of time, human has considered meat as a fundamental protein source. meat has served as the main dish in almost every family's meals all around the world. recent years, however, have seen a rapid increase in the number of vegetarians. some people claim that this is brought about by the care for animal rights issue, others think it is much beyond that. it is clear to me that people avoid eating meat mostly for the sake of their health and religious aspect. in this essay, i will discuss how these two factors influence people's dietary choices and why they are more important than other arguments.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the most common reasons that some people choose to abstain from meat is the care for animal rights issue. they argue that animals are sentient beings that deserve respect and compassion, and that killing them for food is cruel and unethical. they also point out the environmental and social impacts of the meat industry, such as deforestation, pollution, greenhouse gas emissions, and animal suffering. by adopting a vegetarian diet, they hope to reduce their ecological footprint, promote a more humane and peaceful world, and express their moral values.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the most common reasons why people choose to abstain from meat is the health benefits that they can obtain from a vegetarian diet. numerous studies have shown that vegetarians have lower risks of developing chronic diseases such as heart disease, diabetes, obesity, and some types of cancer. for example, a meta-analysis of 86 studies found that vegetarians had a 25% lower mortality rate from ischemic heart disease than non-vegetarians. moreover, a vegetarian diet can provide adequate amounts of essential nutrients such as protein, iron, calcium, and vitamin b12, as long as it is well-planned and balanced. by avoiding meat, people can also reduce their exposure to harmful substances such as antibiotics, hormones, and pesticides that are often used in animal farming. therefore, a vegetarian diet can offer significant advantages for one's physical well-being and longevity.
Outcome.Outcome4: Apart from health concerns, another important factor that influences people's decision to avoid eating meat is their religious beliefs. many vegetarians and religious followers share a common value of compassion and respect for all living beings, regardless of their species or form. they also aspire to achieve a higher level of spiritual awareness and harmony, which they believe can be enhanced by a plant-based diet. therefore, for some people, being a vegetarian is not only a dietary choice, but also a way of expressing their faith and devotion.
Outcome.Outcome5: Apart from the health benefits, another reason why people choose to abstain from meat is their religious beliefs. different religions have different views on the ethical and spiritual implications of consuming animal products. for instance, some followers of buddhism believe that animals were human beings in their previous lives, and that eating their meat means violating the principle of non-violence and compassion. although this perspective may seem unscientific to some, i respect the right of people to follow their own religious practices, which can help them achieve inner peace and wisdom.
Outcome.Outcome6: Apart from the health benefits, another common reason that people choose to abstain from meat is their religious convictions. different faiths have different teachings and traditions regarding the consumption of animal products, and some followers adhere to them strictly. for example, one of the most widespread religions that promotes a vegetarian diet is buddhism.

Outcome.Outcome1: Learning by doing things is more exciting and effective than learning by reading or listening. this is the main idea of this essay, which will explore the reasons and examples of why this is true. learning by doing things allows people to experience the sensations, challenges, and rewards of the activities they want to learn, while reading or listening can only provide them with second-hand information and limited understanding. whether it is swimming, cooking, playing an instrument, or any other skill, learning by doing things can help people develop their confidence, creativity, and problem-solving abilities. in contrast, learning by reading or listening can be boring, passive, and superficial. the history of human civilization is full of examples of how learning by doing things has led to discoveries, inventions, and innovations that have changed the world. therefore, learning by doing things is the best way and the best method to learn things.
Outcome.Outcome2: Learning by doing things is not only more exciting, but also more effective and rewarding than learning by reading or listening. there are many fields and subjects that require practical experience and skills that cannot be acquired by mere theoretical knowledge. for example, learning a foreign language is much easier and faster when one interacts with native speakers and immerses oneself in the culture, rather than just studying grammar and vocabulary from books or tapes. learning a musical instrument or a sport also involves practicing and performing, not just memorizing notes or rules. learning a craft or a trade, such as carpentry or cooking, requires hands-on work and creativity, not just following instructions or recipes. learning by doing things enables one to discover one's own strengths and weaknesses, to solve problems and overcome challenges, and to enjoy the process and the outcome of learning.
Outcome.Outcome3: Learning by doing things is more effective and enjoyable than learning by reading or listening because it engages all the senses and the mind in the learning process. when people do things, they experience the reality of the situation, the challenges, the feedback, and the satisfaction of achieving their goals. they also develop skills, confidence, and creativity that can help them in other aspects of life. learning by doing things is more exciting than learning by reading or listening because it stimulates curiosity, interest, and motivation. people who do things are more likely to remember what they learned and apply it in different contexts. they also have more fun and enjoyment in learning, which can make them lifelong learners.
Outcome.Outcome4: Learning by doing things is not only more exciting than learning by reading or listening, but also more effective and productive. throughout history, many great achievements and inventions have been the result of experimenting, observing, and testing things in practice. for example, the wright brothers learned how to fly by building and flying their own gliders and planes, not by reading books or listening to lectures. similarly, thomas edison learned how to create the light bulb by trying thousands of different materials and methods, not by following existing theories or formulas. these examples show that learning by doing things can stimulate creativity, curiosity, and problem-solving skills, which are essential for learning and advancing in any field. therefore, people should not rely only on reading or listening to learn things, but also engage in active and hands-on learning.
Outcome.Outcome5: Learning by doing things is not only more exciting, but also more effective than learning by reading or listening. when people do things themselves, they can experience the challenges, the joys, and the outcomes of their actions. they can also develop their skills, their creativity, and their confidence. learning by reading or listening can provide some information and guidance, but it cannot replace the personal involvement and the feedback that doing things can offer. therefore, learning by doing things is the best way and the best method to learn things, as the history shows.
Outcome.Outcome6: Learning by doing things is not only more exciting, but also more effective than learning by reading or listening. by doing things, people can gain practical experience, develop skills, and discover their own abilities and interests. they can also learn from their mistakes and improve their performance. learning by doing things can also motivate people to pursue their goals and passions, and to seek new challenges and opportunities. therefore, learning by doing things is a valuable and rewarding way of acquiring knowledge and wisdom.

Context.Left: The career itself became the motto of living since the beginning of industrialization in the late 19th century. People usually tend to have a single career as a means of living. However, a modern trend reveals that new generations are more interested to perform several jobs and also would like to gain multiple higher educational certificates in order to earn more and to gain financial security.
Context.Right: Moreover, the arrival of technology has also been playing a major role promoting further unemployment. The official term of it is named "Technological Unemployment". North American economists have published reports after scrutinizing the recent American economic situation that, technology is eliminating more jobs than creating one. For example, robots, automation and softwares are taking over manual human workers professions such as clerks, interpreters, security services, retails and specially in manufacturing companies. Last but not least, corporational policy to to pay less to inferiors is another reason that drives labours to work on different sectors.

Outcome.Outcome1: In the modern world, pursuing multiple careers is becoming a common phenomenon among the new generations who seek to earn more and to gain financial security. this trend is influenced by several factors, such as the changing nature of work, the advancement of technology, and the unequal distribution of income. the career itself became the motto of living since the beginning of industrialization in the late 19th century. people usually tend to have a single career as a means of living. however, a modern trend reveals that new generations are more interested to perform several jobs and also would like to gain multiple higher educational certificates in order to earn more and to gain financial security. moreover, the arrival of technology has also been playing a major role promoting further unemployment. the official term of it is named "technological unemployment". north american economists have published reports after scrutinizing the recent american economic situation that, technology is eliminating more jobs than creating one. for example, robots, automation and softwares are taking over manual human workers professions such as clerks, interpreters, security services, retails and specially in manufacturing companies. thus many people's jobs are now at high stake. the best way to ensure a flexible earning is getting more jobs. last but not least, corporational policy to to pay less to inferiors is another reason that drives labours to work on different sectors.
Outcome.Outcome2: Having a career is often considered a vital part of one's identity and well-being, but in the contemporary world, many people are facing challenges and changes in their professional paths. the career itself became the motto of living since the beginning of industrialization in the late 19th century. people usually tend to have a single career as a means of living. however, a modern trend reveals that new generations are more interested to perform several jobs and also would like to gain multiple higher educational certificates in order to earn more and to gain financial security. what are the factors that influence this trend and how does it affect the economy and society? in this essay, we will examine some of the causes and consequences of having multiple careers in the 21st century, such as technological unemployment, low wages, and personal satisfaction.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the reasons why pursuing multiple careers has become a modern trend is that new generations are more interested to perform several jobs and gain multiple higher educational certificates. unlike their predecessors who often settled for a single career as a means of living, they seek to explore different fields, develop diverse skills, and enhance their qualifications. for instance, a person may work as a teacher, a freelance writer, and a graphic designer, while pursuing a master's degree in education or a certification in web development. this way, they can satisfy their curiosity, creativity, and passion for learning, as well as increase their income and employability. moreover, having multiple careers can also help them cope with the uncertainty and volatility of the labor market, as they can adapt to changing demands and opportunities.
Outcome.Outcome4: The career itself became the motto of living since the beginning of industrialization in the late 19th century. people usually tend to have a single career as a means of living. however, a modern trend reveals that new generations are more interested to perform several jobs and also would like to gain multiple higher educational certificates in order to earn more and to gain financial security. another factor that influences the trend of pursuing multiple careers is the impact of technology on the labor market. technology has been advancing rapidly and transforming various sectors of the economy, creating new opportunities but also displacing many workers from their traditional roles.
Outcome.Outcome5: While having a single career was once the norm for most workers, the changing economic and social conditions of the 21st century have challenged this traditional model. as the left text explains, new generations are more inclined to pursue multiple jobs and higher education credentials in order to increase their income and financial security. this is partly a response to the uncertainties and risks posed by the rapid development of technology, which has been displacing many human workers from their occupations. the right text illustrates how technological unemployment is a serious threat to many sectors, such as clerks, interpreters, security services, retails and manufacturing. therefore, having more skills and options can help workers adapt to the changing labour market and avoid becoming obsolete. another factor that motivates workers to seek more jobs is the unfair compensation system of many corporations, which pay low wages to their inferiors and widen the income gap. by working on different sectors, workers can diversify their sources of income and bargain for better pay.
Outcome.Outcome6: Although having a single career was once the norm, the changing economic and social conditions have prompted many people to pursue multiple jobs and educational opportunities. this is not only a matter of personal preference, but also a necessity for survival in a competitive and uncertain market. one of the main factors that contributes to this situation is the impact of technology on the labor force.

Outcome.Outcome1: Enforcing such restrain not only improved the quality of air and environment in public places, but also protected the health and rights of non-smokers who were exposed to secondhand smoke. non-smoking public no longer had to endure the unpleasant smell, irritation, and risk of respiratory diseases caused by tobacco smoke. they also enjoyed more peace and safety in public transportation and other venues, as potential conflicts and accidents due to smoking were reduced. therefore, non-smoking public was undoubtedly benefited by enforcing such restrain.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the main advantages of prohibiting smoking in public places is the improvement of public health and well-being. smoking not only harms the smokers themselves, but also exposes the non-smokers to secondhand smoke, which can cause various respiratory and cardiovascular diseases, cancer, and other health problems. according to the world health organization, secondhand smoke kills more than 600,000 people annually, and is responsible for about 28% of the deaths from lung cancer among non-smokers. by enforcing such a restrain, the government can protect the public from the harmful effects of tobacco smoke, and reduce the burden of health care costs and premature deaths. additionally, banning smoking in public places can also enhance the quality of the environment, by reducing air pollution, littering, and fire hazards.
Outcome.Outcome3: Therefore, the ban on smoking in public places has been a successful measure to protect the health and well-being of the non-smoking public in sri lanka. it has also reduced the risk of conflicts and disturbances caused by smokers who disregarded the rights and preferences of others. the second paragraph will further explore the benefits of this policy and suggest that it could be a model for other countries to adopt.
Outcome.Outcome4: To start, non-smoking public would be undoubtedly benefited by enforcing such restrain. prior to 1980's public places in sri lanka, illustrates unpleasant situation where people smoked freely. even in public transportation they engaged in this intolerant bad habit, some instances that lead to belligerent incidents. after enforcing restrictions the situation came to control and this act as benefit rendered to the public. moreover, smoke illegalization in public places in sri lanka has also contributed to the improvement of health, environment, and social aspects of the population. according to a study by the world health organization, the prevalence of tobacco use among adults in sri lanka decreased from 29.4% in 2006 to 18.8% in 2015, which reduced the risk of exposure to secondhand smoke and its associated diseases. additionally, the smoke-free policy has helped to preserve the natural beauty and cleanliness of the country's scenic spots, cultural heritage, and religious sites, as well as to reduce the fire hazards and littering caused by cigarette butts. furthermore, the smoke-free policy has fostered a more respectful and harmonious atmosphere in public places, where people can enjoy their rights and freedoms without infringing on others' well-being and comfort. after analyzing smoke illegalization in public places in sri lanka, it has been proven benefits people enjoy this arrangement. it is thus hoped governments would consider smoke banning in public places following footsteps of sri lanka as well as many other countries.
Outcome.Outcome5: Enforcing such restrain not only benefits the non-smoking public, but also the smokers themselves. according to the world health organization, smoking is the leading cause of preventable death and disease worldwide, and secondhand smoke exposure increases the risk of lung cancer, heart disease, and respiratory infections. by banning smoking in public places, sri lanka has reduced the exposure of its population to these harmful effects and encouraged smokers to quit or reduce their consumption. moreover, smoke-free environments also improve the quality of life, air quality, and cleanliness of public spaces, creating a more pleasant and healthy atmosphere for everyone.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, restricting smoking in public places can be seen as a measure that protects the health and well-being of the non-smoking public, as well as promotes a more harmonious and respectful social environment. by reducing the exposure to secondhand smoke, the risks of developing respiratory diseases, cardiovascular problems, and cancer are also lowered. moreover, by discouraging the habit of smoking, the demand for tobacco products and the associated environmental and economic costs are also reduced.

Prompt.Prompt1: State your main argument or thesis statement about the benefits of learning in a classroom versus online.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some evidence or examples to support your argument, such as statistics, studies, or personal experiences.

Outcome.Outcome1: Learning in a classroom has many advantages over online learning, especially for students who want to improve their academic performance, social skills, and physical health. in this essay, i will discuss three benefits of classroom learning that online learning cannot offer: better feedback, more interaction, and healthier life. (main argument or thesis statement) firstly, learning in a classroom allows students to receive more feedback from their teachers and peers, which can help them improve their understanding and skills. (left text) secondly, learning in a classroom enables students to interact more with other students, which can enhance their communication and collaboration abilities, as well as their emotional and mental well-being. (right text) thirdly, learning in a classroom can also promote students' physical health, as they can participate in exercise classes that teach them how to move their body correctly and safely. (new text) these are some of the reasons why i believe that classroom learning is more beneficial than online learning for students.
Outcome.Outcome2: Learning in a classroom can also benefit students' health in ways that online classes cannot. one of the advantages of attending school is that students can participate in physical education classes, which help them to exercise their bodies and improve their fitness. physical education classes are led by specialist trainers who can teach students the correct techniques and prevent injuries. for example, a study by the centers for disease control and prevention found that students who had daily physical education classes had lower rates of obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease than those who did not. on the other hand, students who learn online may not have access to such facilities or guidance, and may be more likely to sedentary lifestyles or improper exercises. therefore, learning in a classroom can promote students' health and well-being in a way that online classes cannot.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, some people might argue that learning in a classroom has some disadvantages compared to online class. for example, they might claim that classroom learning is more expensive, less flexible, and more prone to distractions or interruptions. they might also say that online class offers more options, resources, and opportunities for self-paced learning and individualized feedback. these are valid points, but they do not outweigh the benefits of classroom learning. classroom learning is more affordable in the long run, as it saves students from investing in costly devices, software, and internet access. it also gives students more structure, discipline, and motivation to complete their assignments and meet their deadlines. moreover, classroom learning fosters more social interaction, collaboration, and communication skills among students and teachers, which are essential for their personal and professional development. online class, on the other hand, can isolate students, reduce their engagement, and impair their emotional and mental well-being. therefore, classroom learning is still a better option for students who want to have a comprehensive, balanced, and healthy education.
Outcome.Outcome4: Learning in a classroom has many advantages over online classes, as it can enhance students' academic performance, social skills, and physical health. students who attend school can interact with their teachers and peers, get immediate feedback, and participate in various activities that stimulate their critical thinking and creativity. they can also benefit from the exercise classes that schools offer, which can help them stay fit and prevent injuries. online classes, on the other hand, may limit students' opportunities to communicate, collaborate, and exercise, and may expose them to distractions and technical issues. therefore, students should choose classroom learning whenever possible, as it can prepare them better for their future goals and challenges.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the benefits of learning in a classroom is that students can have a healthier life. in addition to acquiring knowledge and skills from their teachers and peers, students can also participate in physical education classes that train them to move their body. classroom learning offers the advantage of having a specialist trainer who can teach students how to exercise in the right way and avoid injuries. this can help students improve their fitness and well-being, which online learning cannot provide. therefore, learning in a classroom can be more beneficial for students' physical health than learning online.
Outcome.Outcome6: Learning in a classroom also has another advantage over online learning: it can promote physical well-being. while online classes may offer some flexibility and convenience, they may also limit the opportunities for students to engage in physical activity and exercise. this can have negative effects on their health, mood, and academic performance.

Context.Left: First of all, it is seen that following celebrities blindly affects the health of adolescents. Many young people indulge themselves in drugs and start smoking at an early age. For example, in a survey carried out in a university, it was asked to students that why did they start smoking, then around forty percent of individuals answered that they wanted to look like their favorite screen actor while smoking cigarettes. This example makes it clear that imitating celebrities has a negative influence on health of young individuals.
Context.Right: Thus to conclude, it can be said that when young people follow celebrities, it affects their health as well as behavior in a negative way. This has an overall effect on personality and future of an individual. Therefore it is recommended that young people should be educated not to follow these celebrities blindly, rather they should focus on their career so that they may hope for a bright future.

Outcome.Outcome1: Not only does following celebrities blindly affect the health of adolescents, but also their behavior. many young people try to imitate the lifestyle, fashion, and attitude of their favorite stars, without considering the consequences or the reality behind the glamorous image. for instance, some adolescents may adopt risky or violent behaviors, such as driving recklessly, getting into fights, or breaking the law, because they see their idols doing so in movies or on social media. some may also develop low self-esteem, depression, or anxiety, because they compare themselves unfavorably with the unrealistic standards of beauty and success that celebrities portray. these examples show that following celebrities blindly can have a detrimental impact on the mental and emotional well-being of young individuals.
Outcome.Outcome2: Not only do young people harm their health by copying the habits of celebrities, but they also adopt their negative attitudes and behaviors. for instance, some young people may imitate the violent or disrespectful actions of their idols, such as fighting, breaking the law, or cheating on their partners. similarly, some young people may follow the unrealistic or unhealthy standards of beauty or success that celebrities promote, such as undergoing cosmetic surgery, starving themselves, or using steroids. these examples show that following celebrities blindly can lead to low self-esteem, poor relationships, and ethical problems.
Outcome.Outcome3: The above discussion has shown how following celebrities blindly can have detrimental effects on the health and behavior of adolescents. they may adopt unhealthy habits, such as smoking and drug use, or imitate violent and aggressive actions, such as bullying and vandalism. these effects can impair their physical and mental well-being, as well as their academic and social performance. however, there are some possible solutions that can help young people to avoid these negative influences and to develop their own identity and goals. the following paragraph will suggest some of these solutions and explain how they can benefit the young generation.
Outcome.Outcome4: To prevent the negative consequences of following celebrities blindly, young people need to be educated not to fall prey to the unrealistic and harmful images and messages that are often portrayed by the media. media literacy is a skill that can help young people to critically analyze and evaluate the sources, purposes, and effects of media content, and to recognize the techniques and strategies that are used to manipulate and persuade audiences. parental guidance is also important, as parents can monitor and limit the exposure of their children to inappropriate and harmful media influences, and can also provide them with alternative and positive role models that can inspire and motivate them to pursue their own goals and interests. furthermore, young people can benefit from having mentors, teachers, or peers who can support and encourage them to develop their own identity, values, and talents, and to resist the pressure and temptation to imitate celebrities.
Outcome.Outcome5: Moreover, following celebrities blindly also affects the behavior of adolescents. many young people try to copy the style, attitude, and actions of their idols, without considering the consequences or the context. for example, some young people may engage in violence, vandalism, or sexual activities, because they see their favorite celebrities doing so in movies or songs. this example shows that imitating celebrities can lead to moral degradation and social problems for young individuals.
Outcome.Outcome6: Another aspect of following celebrities blindly is that it affects the behavior of adolescents. many young people try to imitate the lifestyle, attitude, and actions of their favorite stars without considering the consequences. for instance, some young people may get involved in violence, crime, or substance abuse because they see their idols doing the same. they may also lose their sense of identity, morality, and self-esteem by copying the external appearance and mannerisms of celebrities. these behaviors can have serious implications for their personal and social development.

Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, it is evident that the classmates play a vital role in enhancing the children's motivation and achievement at school. however, this is not the only benefit that they offer. apart from creating a competitive atmosphere, classmates also help the children broaden their horizons and perspectives by exposing them to diverse cultures, opinions, and experiences.

Outcome.Outcome3: However, these drawbacks of technology do not outweigh the benefits that it brings to different aspects of people's life. technology can enhance the efficiency, convenience, and quality of various tasks and activities that people engage in daily. for example, the cell phone can help people stay connected with their family, friends, and colleagues, as well as access information, entertainment, and services anytime and anywhere. technology can also facilitate learning, working, and creating, by providing tools and platforms that enable people to acquire new skills, collaborate with others, and express their ideas. furthermore, technology can improve the health, safety, and well-being of people, by offering solutions and innovations that can prevent, diagnose, and treat diseases, protect the environment, and support the needs of different groups and communities. therefore, technology can make people's life more simple and enjoyable, rather than more complicated and tired.
Outcome.Outcome4: Therefore, technology is a double-edged sword that can bring both benefits and drawbacks to people's life. on the one hand, technology can make people's life more convenient, efficient, and enjoyable by providing them with various tools and services. on the other hand, technology can also make people's life more complicated, stressful, and addictive by imposing them with excessive demands and distractions. hence, people need to balance their use of technology and be aware of its potential impacts on their well-being.

Outcome.Outcome6: However, technology also has many positive effects on people's life that cannot be ignored. technology enables people to access information, entertainment, education, and health care more easily and conveniently. for example, the cell phone, which is not only a communication device, but also a multifunctional gadget, can help people to learn new languages, watch movies, listen to music, and monitor their fitness. technology also facilitates people to work remotely, collaborate with others, and create innovative solutions. therefore, technology can enhance people's life quality and productivity, if used wisely and moderately.

Context.Left: Although there are some advantages to learning a foreign language in its original country, I firmly believe that people who learn a foreign language in the country in which it is spoken have a deeper understanding of different language skills than those who learn the same languages in their own countries.
Context.Right: On the other hand, when a new learner wants to learn a new language in the country in which it is spoken, he has the opportunity to communicate with natives. He may find native friends and may participate in groups where members are people from the foreign country. No doubt, it leads to better understanding of language essential skills. He also has access to the most up-to-date language. Thus he can learn most useful idioms, proverbs and so many other things which the former person, person 'A', does not have access to.

Prompt.Prompt1: Start the middle text with a topic sentence that introduces the advantages of learning a foreign language in one's own country.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples of how learning a foreign language in one's own country can be effective and enjoyable, such as using online platforms, media, books and courses.
Prompt.Prompt3: Acknowledge the possible limitations or challenges of learning a foreign language in one's own country, such as lack of exposure, motivation or feedback.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from the benefits of learning a foreign language in one's own country to the benefits of learning it in the country in which it is spoken. You can use contrastive words such as however, nevertheless or on the other hand.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
