Outcome.Outcome1: Vegetarian diet and religion are closely related for many people who choose to abstain from animal products for ethical or spiritual reasons. while some may argue that vegetarianism is a personal choice or a health benefit, others may base their decision on their faith and beliefs. for example, some religions, such as buddhism, teach that animals are reincarnated beings who deserve compassion and respect, and that eating their flesh is a form of violence and ignorance. in this essay, i will explore how religious beliefs influence vegetarian diet and how this can affect the individual and the society.
Outcome.Outcome2: Vegetarianism is not only a dietary choice, but also a way of expressing one's ethical and spiritual values. many religions around the world have advocated for abstaining from meat consumption, either partially or completely, as a means of showing compassion, nonviolence, and respect for all living beings. for instance, buddhism, which originated in india and spread to many asian countries, teaches that all sentient beings have the potential to attain nirvana, the state of liberation from suffering and ignorance. therefore, buddhists avoid killing or harming animals, and many of them follow a vegetarian diet. some religion, such as buddha, believes that animals were human beings in their previous life, so eating their meat means you eat the flesh of your parent sentient beings. it is often said that this view is rather unscientific. however, i am convinced that it is vital to follow one's own religious practices which can bring the enlightenment in mind. similarly, hinduism, the oldest and most diverse religion in india, also promotes vegetarianism as a way of honoring the principle of ahimsa, or non-injury, to all creatures. hindu scriptures classify foods into three categories: sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic, based on their effects on the body and mind. sattvic foods, such as fruits, vegetables, grains, and dairy products, are considered pure, wholesome, and conducive to mental clarity and peace. rajasic foods, such as spicy, sour, bitter, and salty foods, are stimulating, energizing, and passionate, but also cause agitation and restlessness. tamasic foods, such as meat, fish, eggs, garlic, onion, and alcohol, are dull, inert, and ignorant, and induce laziness, ignorance, and attachment. therefore, hindus who seek to cultivate sattvic qualities and attain spiritual realization prefer to eat vegetarian foods. jainism, another ancient religion that originated in india, is perhaps the most strict and rigorous in its adherence to vegetarianism. jains believe that every living being, from plants to animals to humans, has a soul that can be liberated from the cycle of birth and death. they practice an extreme form of nonviolence, called ahimsa, which forbids them from harming or killing any living being, even unintentionally. they also avoid eating root vegetables, such as potatoes, carrots, and onions, because they believe that uprooting them causes harm to many microorganisms that live in the soil. jains also observe fasting, charity, and meditation as part of their spiritual discipline.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, not everyone agrees that religious beliefs are a valid reason to adopt a vegetarian diet. some critics might argue that such beliefs are based on superstition or dogma, and that they ignore the nutritional and ecological benefits of eating meat. they might point out that humans are omnivorous by nature, and that meat provides essential protein, iron, and vitamin b12 that are hard to obtain from plant sources. they might also claim that vegetarianism can have negative impacts on the environment, such as increasing the demand for water, land, and fertilizers for crops, or reducing the biodiversity and ecosystem services of grazing animals.
Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, a vegetarian diet can be motivated by various factors, such as health benefits, environmental concerns, and religious beliefs. people who choose to abstain from animal products may have different reasons for doing so, but they all share a common goal of living a more compassionate and ethical lifestyle. i have argued that a vegetarian diet is not only beneficial for individuals, but also for the planet and the animals. therefore, i urge you to consider adopting a vegetarian diet, or at least reducing your meat consumption, as a way of improving your well-being and contributing to a more sustainable and humane world. alternatively, you can also explore more about the diverse perspectives and practices of vegetarians from different cultures and traditions, and learn from their wisdom and experience.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, ethical and religious reasons are two of the most common factors that motivate people to adopt a vegetarian diet. however, there are also other benefits that can be derived from avoiding animal products, such as health and environmental advantages. in the following paragraphs, i will discuss how a vegetarian diet can improve one's physical well-being and reduce the negative impact on the planet.
Outcome.Outcome6: In addition to the health and environmental benefits, another reason why some people choose a vegetarian diet is their religious beliefs. different faiths have different teachings and rules regarding the consumption of animal products, and some followers may adhere to them strictly or partially. for instance, one of the most common religions that promotes vegetarianism is buddhism, which has a specific view on the nature of animals and their relationship to humans.

Context.Left: Stress, our body's way of responding to any kind of demand, can be caused by both good and bad experiences. Stress may be a positive mobilization to drive for success. However, it is widely thought that we experience stress any time, which comes across unexpectedly that frustrates our goals. As a result, if we don't have a good stress management skill, it may lead to some critical problems.
Context.Right: Furthermore, stress takes a toll on our health. It is known that the modern life is frequently full of hassles, frustrations, and demands. This is one of the reasons why people were overwhelmed by constant stress. Thus, some people have physical problems, such as insomnia and headaches. Melancholia, the most fatal problem, even leads some people to commit suicide. Consequently, it is necessary that we should reduce and cope with our stress in the goal of balancing our mind and body. To avoid being a pessimist, we may try to conquer our distress by sharing our worry with friends or families, doing exercise regularly, and trying to see our troubles in a different way.

Prompt.Prompt1: Define stress and its types in more detail.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain how stress affects our physical and mental health with examples.
Prompt.Prompt3: Introduce some stress management skills and techniques that can help us cope with stress.
Prompt.Prompt4: Provide some benefits and challenges of applying stress management skills in our daily life.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Stress, our body's way of responding to any kind of demand, can be caused by both good and bad experiences. stress may be a positive mobilization to drive for success. however, it is widely thought that we experience stress any time, which comes across unexpectedly that frustrates our goals. as a result, if we don't have a good stress management skill, it may lead to some critical problems. there are different types of stress that affect us in different ways. acute stress is the most common and short-term form of stress that arises from sudden challenges or threats. it can cause anxiety, anger, or nervousness, but it can also be exciting and motivating. chronic stress is the long-term and persistent form of stress that results from ongoing situations or pressures that seem beyond our control. it can cause depression, fatigue, or illness, and it can also impair our immune system and mental health. both types of stress can have negative impacts on our well-being if they are not managed properly. therefore, it is important to recognize the signs and sources of stress and to find healthy and effective ways to cope with it.
Outcome.Outcome2: Stress, our body's way of responding to any kind of demand, can be caused by both good and bad experiences. stress may be a positive mobilization to drive for success. however, it is widely thought that we experience stress any time, which comes across unexpectedly that frustrates our goals. as a result, if we don't have a good stress management skill, it may lead to some critical problems. one of these problems is the impact of stress on our physical and mental health. when we are under chronic or excessive stress, our body releases hormones that affect our immune system, blood pressure, digestion, and mood. for example, stress can make us more prone to infections, heart diseases, ulcers, and diabetes. it can also interfere with our sleep quality, appetite, concentration, and memory. moreover, stress can trigger or worsen mental disorders, such as depression, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress disorder. these conditions can impair our self-esteem, motivation, and social relationships. they can also increase the risk of substance abuse, self-harm, and suicide. therefore, it is vital that we learn how to reduce and cope with our stress in the goal of balancing our mind and body.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, stress is not always inevitable or harmful. in fact, there are some stress management skills and techniques that can help us cope with stress and turn it into a positive force. for example, we can learn to identify and challenge our negative thoughts, practice relaxation methods such as deep breathing and meditation, set realistic and achievable goals, and prioritize our tasks. we can also seek social support from our friends, family, or professionals, and express our feelings and needs assertively. moreover, we can enhance our physical and mental well-being by eating a balanced diet, getting enough sleep, exercising regularly, and engaging in hobbies and activities that we enjoy. by applying these strategies, we can reduce and cope with our stress in the goal of balancing our mind and body.
Outcome.Outcome4: As we have seen, stress is a natural and inevitable part of life, but it can also have serious negative effects on our well-being if we do not manage it properly. therefore, it is important to develop and practice stress management skills that can help us cope with the challenges and demands we face. some of the benefits of applying stress management skills in our daily life are that they can improve our mood, enhance our performance, strengthen our relationships, and prevent or reduce stress-related illnesses. however, there are also some challenges that we may encounter when trying to apply stress management skills, such as finding time, motivation, and resources to do so, dealing with unrealistic expectations or pressures, and overcoming habits or beliefs that may interfere with our coping strategies. thus, we need to be aware of our own stress levels, sources, and signs, and seek help or support when needed. by doing so, we can achieve a better balance between our mind and body, and enjoy a more satisfying and healthy life.
Outcome.Outcome5: Stress, our body's way of responding to any kind of demand, can be caused by both good and bad experiences. stress may be a positive mobilization to drive for success. however, it is widely thought that we experience stress any time, which comes across unexpectedly that frustrates our goals. as a result, if we don't have a good stress management skill, it may lead to some critical problems. therefore, it is important to understand the effects of stress on our health and well-being and to find effective ways to cope with it. furthermore, stress takes a toll on our health. it is known that the modern life is frequently full of hassles, frustrations, and demands. this is one of the reasons why people were overwhelmed by constant stress. thus, some people have physical problems, such as insomnia and headaches. melancholia, the most fatal problem, even leads some people to commit suicide. consequently, it is necessary that we should reduce and cope with our stress in the goal of balancing our mind and body. to avoid being a pessimist, we may try to conquer our distress by sharing our worry with friends or families, doing exercise regularly, and trying to see our troubles in a different way.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the critical problems that stress may cause is its negative impact on our mental health. when we are under too much stress, we may feel anxious, depressed, or angry. these emotions can interfere with our ability to think clearly, make decisions, and cope with challenges. they can also affect our relationships, self-esteem, and happiness. therefore, it is important to recognize the signs of stress and seek help if needed.

Comment.Comment5: Contains info from the left and right

Context.Right: The first reason why the father's role should be equal to the mother's role is the nature of parantage. In my view, the role models within a family play a significant role in the development of the child's characteristics. For example, in a traditional Turkish family, while a mother has a sincere and thoughtful approach to the child, a father role must be present as authoritarian and conversative to raise a well-behaved child.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of the essay and state your thesis statement in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain what you mean by the nature of parantage and how it relates to your thesis statement in the second paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a counterargument paragraph that acknowledges the possible challenges or limitations of having an equal father's role in the fourth paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize your main points and restate your thesis statement in a different way in the conclusion paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: The role of parents in shaping their children's personality and values is a controversial topic that has been debated for a long time. some people believe that the mother's role is more important and influential than the father's role, while others argue that both parents should have equal responsibilities and rights in raising their children. in this essay, i will support the latter view and explain why the father's role should be equal to the mother's role in the family. the first reason why the father's role should be equal to the mother's role is the nature of parantage. in my view, the role models within a family play a significant role in the development of the child's characteristics. for example, in a traditional turkish family, while a mother has a sincere and thoughtful approach to the child, a father role must be present as authoritarian and conversative to raise a well-behaved child.
Outcome.Outcome2: The nature of parantage refers to the way that parents interact with their children and influence their personality, values, and behavior. by having an equal role in the family, both the mother and the father can provide different but complementary aspects of parantage that benefit the child's growth and well-being. this supports my thesis statement that the father's role should be equal to the mother's role because it shows that both parents have something valuable to offer to their children and that they can balance each other's strengths and weaknesses.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, some might argue that having an equal father's role is not feasible or desirable for every family, depending on their cultural, social, or personal circumstances. for instance, some fathers may face difficulties in balancing their work and family responsibilities, especially in contexts where they are expected to be the primary breadwinners or providers. some mothers may prefer to have more autonomy or authority in making decisions for the child's welfare or education, especially if they have more expertise or experience in these areas. some children may also have different preferences or needs for the type and amount of involvement from their fathers, depending on their age, gender, or personality. therefore, it is important to consider the diversity and complexity of family situations and dynamics when advocating for an equal father's role.
Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, i have argued that the father's role should be equal to the mother's role in the family, based on the nature of parantage, the benefits of shared responsibilities, and the diversity of perspectives. i believe that both parents have valuable contributions to make to the child's upbringing, and that they can complement each other's strengths and weaknesses. by adopting a more balanced and flexible approach to parenting, families can foster a healthier and happier environment for their children. therefore, the father's role should not be underestimated or marginalized, but rather recognized and respected as an essential part of the family.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, the nature of parantage does not always translate into equal roles for the father and the mother in the family. the right text illustrates how a traditional turkish family assigns different roles to the parents, based on their gender and cultural norms. in this case, the father's role is more authoritarian and conversative, while the mother's role is more sincere and thoughtful. this contrast may create a gap between the child's expectations and experiences of the father's role, as well as limit the father's involvement and influence in the child's development.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, this stereotypical division of parental roles may not reflect the reality of modern families or the needs of the child. the father's role should be equal to the mother's role because of the nature of parantage.

Context.Left: Secondly, people can know more about the planet earth itself. By observing planet earth from outer space, people can find out ample things for example about the atmosphere of the planet earth. With this knowledge, people can work on something to prevent earth hazards such as global warming.
Context.Right: As a conclusion, I personally think that human beings should travel to outer space. In spite of costing a fortune, space exploration has given aforementioned benefits.

Prompt.Prompt1: Provide some examples of how space exploration has advanced technology, medicine, or other fields.
Prompt.Prompt2: Add a connecting sentence that summarizes the main idea of the paragraph and links it to the next one.
Prompt.Prompt3: Discuss how space exploration can inspire people to pursue their dreams and passions.
Prompt.Prompt4: End the paragraph with a strong statement that reiterates your opinion on why human beings should travel to outer space.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the most significant benefits of space exploration is the advancement of technology, medicine, or other fields that can improve the quality of life on earth. for instance, space exploration has contributed to the development of satellite communication, navigation, and remote sensing systems that are widely used for various purposes such as broadcasting, education, disaster management, and environmental monitoring. moreover, space exploration has stimulated scientific research and innovation in areas such as robotics, materials, engineering, and biotechnology that can enhance the performance and safety of spacecraft as well as terrestrial applications. furthermore, space exploration has inspired medical breakthroughs and discoveries that can help prevent or treat diseases and injuries that affect astronauts and earthlings alike. some examples are artificial limbs, laser surgery, bone density scanners, and telemedicine.
Outcome.Outcome2: Therefore, space exploration is not only a way to satisfy human curiosity, but also a means to enhance scientific knowledge and protect the planet earth.
Outcome.Outcome3: Another reason why human beings should travel to outer space is that it can inspire people to pursue their dreams and passions. space exploration is a challenging and rewarding endeavor that requires creativity, curiosity, and courage. by witnessing the beauty and wonder of the cosmos, people can develop a sense of awe and appreciation for the universe and their place in it. moreover, by learning from the achievements and failures of the astronauts and scientists who have ventured into space, people can gain valuable lessons and skills that can help them in their own pursuits. whether it is science, technology, engineering, art, or education, space exploration can spark people's imagination and motivation to explore their own potential and contribute to the society.
Outcome.Outcome4: Secondly, people can know more about the planet earth itself. by observing planet earth from outer space, people can find out ample things for example about the atmosphere of the planet earth. with this knowledge, people can work on something to prevent earth hazards such as global warming. moreover, space exploration can also inspire curiosity, creativity, and innovation among human beings, as they discover new phenomena and challenges in the vast universe. space exploration can also foster international cooperation and peace, as countries share their resources and expertise for a common goal. as a conclusion, i personally think that human beings should travel to outer space. in spite of costing a fortune, space exploration has given aforementioned benefits that outweigh the risks and expenses, and that can enhance the quality of life and the future of humanity.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, space exploration is not only a way to satisfy human curiosity, but also a means to enhance human knowledge and well-being. by travelling to outer space, people can discover new phenomena, learn more about the earth, and potentially find solutions to some of the pressing problems facing humanity. these benefits outweigh the costs and risks involved in space exploration. as a conclusion, i personally think that human beings should travel to outer space. in spite of costing a fortune, space exploration has given aforementioned benefits.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, space exploration is not only a scientific endeavor, but also a source of inspiration, education, and environmental awareness. by traveling to outer space, human beings can expand their horizons, learn more about the universe and themselves, and find ways to protect their home planet.

Context.Left: Admittedly, reducing the proportion of violent content in TV shows could, to some degree, decrease the overall crime rate. However, in order to tackle this problem more effectively, governments must first prohibit any types of violent content in all childrens television programs. As a result of mental immaturity, most youngsters are incapable of distinguishing right from wrong. Little wonder, then, that by watching these violent TV programs and videos, juveniles will become very aggressive and offensive and have a great tendency to commit crimes. Therefore, it would be rather necessary for governments to establish an intensive law that prevents teenagers from watching these violent and brutal TV Shows and movies.
Context.Right: In conclusion, it is my belief that violent contents must be excluded from all kidvids in order to reduce the proportion of juvenile delinquency; however, the adults should not be the victim of this policy.

Prompt.Prompt1: Restate the main argument of the essay in the first sentence of the middle paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some statistics or evidence to support the claim that violent TV shows have a negative impact on children's behavior and psychology.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain how banning violent content in children's programs can help prevent juvenile delinquency and promote social harmony.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize the main points of the middle paragraph and link them to the conclusion paragraph with a transitional word or phrase.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: The main argument of this essay is that the exposure of children and teenagers to violent content in tv shows and movies has a negative impact on their behavior and morality, and that governments should take measures to prevent this. to support this claim, the essay has discussed the effects of violent media on the psychological development of young people, the correlation between violent tv and crime rates, and the need for a legal framework to regulate the content of children's television programs. in the following paragraph, the essay will summarize its position and provide some recommendations for the future.
Outcome.Outcome2: There is ample evidence to suggest that violent tv shows have a detrimental effect on children's behavior and psychology. according to a meta-analysis of 217 studies, exposure to media violence increases the likelihood of aggressive and antisocial behavior, desensitization to violence, and fear of being victimized (anderson et al., 2003). moreover, a longitudinal study of 329 children found that watching violent tv shows at age 8 predicted criminal behavior and antisocial personality disorder at age 30 (johnson et al., 2002). these findings indicate that violent tv shows can impair children's moral development and social adjustment, and increase their risk of becoming offenders or victims of crime.
Outcome.Outcome3: Banning violent content in children's programs can help prevent juvenile delinquency and promote social harmony in several ways. first, it can protect the young viewers from being exposed to harmful images and messages that may influence their attitudes, behaviors, and values. second, it can foster a positive and peaceful culture among the children, who can learn to respect others, resolve conflicts peacefully, and cooperate with their peers. third, it can reduce the risk of developing psychological problems, such as aggression, anxiety, or depression, that may result from witnessing or experiencing violence. by eliminating the negative impact of violent content on children's development, governments can create a safer and more harmonious society for the future generations.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, the middle paragraph argues that banning violent content from children's television programs is a necessary and effective measure to lower the crime rate, as young viewers are more likely to be influenced by such content and develop aggressive and criminal behaviors. therefore, the author believes that governments should enact a strict law to protect juveniles from harmful media exposure. in conclusion, the author reiterates his or her opinion and adds a contrasting point.
Outcome.Outcome5: This policy of banning violent content from children's television programs would not only benefit the young viewers, but also the society as a whole. by limiting the exposure of minors to harmful and disturbing images, governments can foster a more peaceful and harmonious environment for everyone. moreover, by respecting the rights and preferences of adults, governments can avoid infringing on their freedom of expression and choice. adults, in turn, can exercise their responsibility and discretion when watching tv shows and movies that contain violent scenes. they can also educate and guide their children to develop critical thinking and moral values. in conclusion, it is my belief that violent contents must be excluded from all kidvids in order to reduce the proportion of juvenile delinquency; however, the adults should not be the victim of this policy.
Outcome.Outcome6: This policy of banning violent content from children's television programs would not only protect the young viewers from harmful influences, but also respect the rights and preferences of adult audiences. unlike children, most adults are able to discern between reality and fiction, and to enjoy violent tv shows and movies as a form of entertainment, without being influenced by their negative messages. moreover, adults have the freedom and responsibility to choose what they want to watch, and to exercise their critical thinking and moral judgment. therefore, while restricting the exposure of violent content to children is a reasonable and effective measure to prevent crime, imposing the same restriction on adults would be unjustified and unnecessary.

Context.Left: However, despite the fact that advertisements can be falseful and exaggerated, it is also true that it plays and important role economically. They introduce new products, and provide various choices, not to mention they are often visually enjoyable, since they aim to grab your attention. Advertising also helps to keep prices at reasonable levels, creates a fair environment for commercial competition. Otherwise the market may be monopolistic, and the price as well as the choice will not be so selective.

Prompt.Prompt1: State the main argument of your essay and how you will support it in the introduction paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain how advertising plays an important role economically in the first body paragraph, using examples and evidence.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a transition sentence at the end of the first body paragraph that acknowledges the possible drawbacks of advertising and introduces the counterargument.
Prompt.Prompt4: Discuss the negative effects of advertising on consumers and society in the second body paragraph, using examples and evidence.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Advertising is a ubiquitous and influential phenomenon in modern society, but it also raises many ethical and social issues. some people argue that advertising is deceptive, manipulative, and harmful to consumers and society, while others defend its positive effects on the economy and culture. in this essay, i will examine both sides of this debate and argue that advertising has both advantages and disadvantages, depending on how it is used and regulated. i will first discuss some of the negative aspects of advertising, such as its potential to mislead, exploit, and harm consumers. then, i will acknowledge some of the positive aspects of advertising, such as its role in introducing new products, providing choices, and enhancing competition. finally, i will suggest some ways to improve the quality and ethics of advertising and protect the rights and interests of consumers.
Outcome.Outcome2: Advertising plays an important role economically by stimulating the demand and supply of goods and services in the market. by informing consumers about the features, benefits, and prices of different products, advertisements encourage them to make purchases that suit their needs and preferences. this in turn increases the sales and profits of the producers, who can invest more in innovation, quality, and efficiency. for example, a study by the advertising association in the uk found that every pound spent on advertising generates six pounds of economic output and supports 550,000 jobs. moreover, advertising also fosters competition among businesses, who have to differentiate themselves from their rivals and offer better value to customers. this can lead to lower prices, higher quality, and more variety for consumers. for instance, a report by the federal trade commission in the us showed that advertising reduces the average price of prescription drugs by 4.6% and increases the number of new drugs entering the market by 12%.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, despite the fact that advertisements can be falseful and exaggerated, it is also true that it plays and important role economically. they introduce new products, and provide various choices, not to mention they are often visually enjoyable, since they aim to grab your attention. advertising also helps to keep prices at reasonable levels, creates a fair environment for commercial competition. otherwise the market may be monopolistic, and the price as well as the choice will not be so selective. nevertheless, some people may argue that advertising has more negative than positive effects on society, such as promoting consumerism, manipulating emotions, and invading privacy. in the following paragraph, we will examine these claims and show why they are not convincing.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, despite the fact that advertisements can be beneficial for the economy, they also have negative effects on consumers and society. advertising can influence people's preferences, values, and lifestyles, sometimes in harmful ways. for example, advertising can create unrealistic expectations and dissatisfaction with one's own appearance, leading to low self-esteem and eating disorders. advertising can also promote consumerism and materialism, encouraging people to buy things they do not need or cannot afford, and creating waste and debt. furthermore, advertising can manipulate people's emotions and opinions, using techniques such as fear, guilt, or patriotism, to persuade them to support certain causes or products. these effects can undermine people's autonomy, critical thinking, and social responsibility.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, while it is necessary to be aware of the potential drawbacks of advertising, such as misleading or exaggerated claims, one should not overlook its positive effects on the economy and society. advertising can be a source of information, entertainment, and diversity for consumers, as well as a means of promoting fair and efficient markets for producers. by informing and attracting customers, advertising can stimulate demand, innovation, and competition, which can benefit both the sellers and the buyers of goods and services.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, advertising can be seen as a double-edged sword, with both positive and negative impacts on consumers and society. on one hand, it can mislead, manipulate, and exploit people's emotions and needs, creating unrealistic expectations and dissatisfaction. on the other hand, it can also inform, educate, and entertain people, offering them variety and value in the market.

Context.Left: It is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. These days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. They can develop their careers, broad their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. Moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries.
Context.Right: In conclusion, I would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. However, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. Instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.

Prompt.Prompt1: State the main argument of the essay and introduce the topic of cheap air fares.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain the negative impacts of cheap air fares on the environment, such as greenhouse gas emissions and climate change.
Prompt.Prompt3: Discuss the social and cultural consequences of cheap air fares, such as the loss of local identity, the exploitation of natural resources, and the spread of diseases.
Prompt.Prompt4: Acknowledge the counterarguments that cheap air fares have some positive effects, such as increasing mobility, diversity, and tourism.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: The impact of cheap air fares on the environment and society has been a controversial topic in recent years. some people believe that low-cost flights have many advantages for individuals and countries, while others argue that they have serious negative consequences. it is undeniable that cheap air fares have broadened travel possibilities for many people, particularly for the lower income group. these days, millions of people can travel around the world for work or pleasure. they can develop their careers, broaden their knowledge, and interact with many other people from varied cultural backgrounds. moreover, travels also help to promote the tourist industry development, boost the economy and job markets of many countries. however, in this essay, i will examine the drawbacks of cheap air fares and explain why they are more significant than the benefits. in conclusion, i would argue that the drawbacks of cheap air fares outweigh the benefits. however, it does not mean that air travel should be more expensive. instead, people should be aware of their responsibility to reduce the emissions caused by their lifestyle choices.
Outcome.Outcome2: However, cheap air fares also have negative impacts on the environment, which cannot be ignored. air travel is one of the major sources of greenhouse gas emissions, which contribute to global warming and climate change. according to the international civil aviation organization, the global aviation sector accounted for 2.4% of the total co2 emissions in 2018, and this figure is projected to increase in the future. climate change poses serious threats to the natural ecosystems, biodiversity, human health, and food security of many regions. therefore, the environmental costs of cheap air fares may outweigh the social and economic benefits in the long term.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, cheap air fares also have some negative social and cultural consequences that should not be ignored. first of all, the mass tourism enabled by low-cost flights may lead to the loss of local identity and diversity, as many destinations become homogenized and commodified to cater to the tourists' demands. secondly, the increased pressure on the natural resources and environment caused by the influx of visitors may result in degradation, pollution, and depletion of the ecosystems and wildlife that sustain the local communities. thirdly, the frequent and rapid movement of people across borders may facilitate the spread of diseases and pathogens, posing a threat to the public health and safety of both the travelers and the host populations. therefore, cheap air fares are not only a matter of convenience and affordability, but also a matter of ethical and environmental concern.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, not everyone agrees that cheap air fares are harmful to the environment and society. some people might argue that cheap air fares have some positive effects, such as increasing mobility, diversity, and tourism. they might claim that by making air travel more accessible and affordable, people can enjoy more opportunities to visit different places, learn from other cultures, and contribute to the development of the destinations they visit. they might also point out that tourism is a vital source of income and employment for many countries, especially those in the developing world, and that cheap air fares can help them attract more visitors and stimulate their economic growth.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, cheap air fares also have some negative impacts on the environment and society. the increasing demand for air travel contributes to the greenhouse gas emissions and global warming, which threaten the biodiversity and natural resources of many destinations. furthermore, cheap air fares may encourage mass tourism and overconsumption, which can damage the local culture, heritage, and environment. some tourists may also behave irresponsibly or disrespectfully towards the host communities, causing social conflicts and resentment. therefore, cheap air fares are not a sustainable solution for the long-term development of the travel industry and the world.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, despite the positive impacts of cheap air fares, there are also significant negative consequences that cannot be ignored. one of the most serious problems is the environmental damage caused by the increasing amount of carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gases emitted by airplanes. according to some estimates, air travel accounts for about 5% of global warming, and this figure is expected to rise as the demand for flights grows. furthermore, cheap air fares also contribute to the loss of cultural diversity and authenticity, as many destinations become overcrowded, commercialized, and homogenized by mass tourism. therefore, cheap air fares may not be as beneficial as they seem at first glance.

Context.Right: For the above reasons, I agree that distance education can't replace traditional school.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain what distance education is and how it works in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples of the benefits of distance education in the second paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt3: Discuss some of the challenges and drawbacks of distance education in the third paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt4: State your opinion clearly and support it with reasons and evidence in the last paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Distance education is a form of learning that uses technology to deliver instruction and communication between teachers and students who are not physically present in the same location. distance education can take various forms, such as online courses, video conferencing, correspondence, or blended learning. distance education can offer flexibility, convenience, and accessibility to learners who may face barriers to attending traditional school, such as geographical distance, personal commitments, or health issues. however, distance education also has some drawbacks and challenges that may affect its effectiveness and quality.
Outcome.Outcome2: However, distance education also has some advantages that traditional school cannot offer. for example, distance education can provide more flexibility and convenience for students who have busy schedules, family responsibilities, or health issues. distance education can also offer more access and diversity for students who live in remote areas, have limited resources, or want to learn from different cultures and perspectives. distance education can also foster more self-motivation and independence for students who are willing to take charge of their own learning.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, distance education also has some challenges and drawbacks that may make it less suitable for some students. one of the main difficulties is the lack of face-to-face interaction and socialization with teachers and peers. distance learners may feel isolated, lonely, or bored, and may miss the opportunities to exchange ideas, get feedback, or participate in group activities. another challenge is the need for self-discipline and motivation. distance learners have to manage their own time, set their own goals, and overcome any technical or personal problems that may arise. they also have to adapt to different modes of communication, such as online forums, video conferencing, or email. these skills may not be easy to acquire or maintain, especially for students who are used to the structure and guidance of a traditional classroom.
Outcome.Outcome4: Therefore, distance education has both advantages and disadvantages for students. while it offers flexibility, convenience, and accessibility, it also requires self-discipline, motivation, and interaction skills. distance education can be a good option for some students who have specific needs or preferences, but it can't replace traditional school for everyone. traditional school provides a structured environment, social interaction, and direct feedback that are essential for effective learning.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, distance education has its own advantages and disadvantages, and it is not suitable for everyone. some students may benefit from the flexibility, convenience, and cost-effectiveness of online courses, while others may struggle with the lack of interaction, feedback, and motivation. distance education can be a useful alternative or supplement to traditional school, but it cannot replace it entirely.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, distance education also has some drawbacks that may make it less suitable for some students. while it offers flexibility and convenience, it also requires a lot of self-discipline and motivation. (insert a passage connecting the two passages)

Internet and computer also offer a more comprehensive access to knowledge, ranging from visual to aural stimuli, which make learning an ever enjoyable experience, especially for children.

Outcome.Outcome1: The role of technology in education has been a subject of much debate in recent years, as some people claim that it can replace the traditional teacher-student interaction and enhance the quality of learning. central to the supporting arguments of this issue is the idea that the global online network is the inexhaustible source of information, which definitely exceeds the fund of knowledge that any veteran teacher can accumulate. internet and computer also offer a more comprehensive access to knowledge, ranging from visual to aural stimuli, which make learning an ever enjoyable experience, especially for children. however, this view overlooks the essential functions and benefits of human teachers, who can not only impart knowledge, but also foster critical thinking, creativity, and social skills among learners. in this essay, i will examine the advantages and disadvantages of technology-based education and argue that it should be used as a supplement, not a substitute, for the teacher's guidance and feedback.
Outcome.Outcome2: The global online network, or the internet, has revolutionized the field of education in the past few decades, as it enables learners to access a vast amount of information and resources from different domains and disciplines. whether they are looking for facts, opinions, data, images, videos, or interactive tools, the internet can provide them with multiple sources and perspectives that can enrich their learning process. the internet also allows learners to communicate and collaborate with peers, experts, and instructors from different locations and cultures, creating opportunities for cross-cultural understanding and exchange. moreover, the internet can be integrated with computer technologies, such as software, hardware, and digital devices, that can enhance the delivery and presentation of educational content, as well as the assessment and feedback of learning outcomes. internet and computer technologies can also cater to the diverse needs and preferences of learners, by offering various modes and formats of learning, such as online courses, games, simulations, podcasts, blogs, and e-books. these technologies can also stimulate the learners' motivation, engagement, and creativity, by making learning more interactive, personalized, and fun.
Outcome.Outcome3: The role of teachers in the modern education system has been challenged by some who claim that the internet and computer can provide a better and more efficient way of learning than human instructors. they argue that the online network offers a vast and diverse reservoir of information that surpasses the expertise of any teacher, and that the digital media can stimulate and engage learners with various modes of presentation. central to the supporting arguments of this issue is the idea that the global online network is the inexhaustible source of information, which definitely exceeds the fund of knowledge that any veteran teacher can accumulate. internet and computer also offer a more comprehensive access to knowledge, ranging from visual to aural stimuli, which make learning an ever enjoyable experience, especially for children. however, this position overlooks the essential role of teachers in facilitating, guiding, and evaluating the learning process, as well as the limitations and risks of relying solely on the online network. in this essay, i will refute the claim that the internet and computer can replace teachers, and demonstrate why teachers are still indispensable in the education system.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, not everyone agrees that the global online network is a superior way of learning, and some counterarguments challenge this idea from different perspectives. for instance, some critics point out that the quality and reliability of the information available online vary greatly, and that students need guidance and evaluation from teachers to develop critical thinking and research skills. others argue that the global online network can also distract and isolate students, and that they need social interaction and feedback from peers and teachers to foster communication and collaboration skills. moreover, some educators contend that the global online network cannot replace the role of teachers as mentors, facilitators, and motivators, and that they need to adapt and integrate technology into their pedagogy and curriculum to enhance, not replace, their teaching.
Outcome.Outcome5: Some people might argue that the traditional role of teachers in education is becoming obsolete in the face of the rapid development of technology. central to the supporting arguments of this issue is the idea that the global online network is the inexhaustible source of information, which definitely exceeds the fund of knowledge that any veteran teacher can accumulate. internet and computer also offer a more comprehensive access to knowledge, ranging from visual to aural stimuli, which make learning an ever enjoyable experience, especially for children. however, this view overlooks the essential functions that teachers perform in facilitating, guiding, and motivating students to achieve their learning goals. teachers are not merely dispensers of information, but also mentors, role models, and collaborators who can foster critical thinking, creativity, and social skills among their learners. moreover, teachers can adapt their instruction to the diverse needs, interests, and backgrounds of their students, while online resources might not always be reliable, relevant, or appropriate. therefore, teachers still play a vital role in education, and technology should be seen as a tool to enhance, not replace, their work.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, relying solely on the internet and computer for education may have some drawbacks that need to be considered. for one thing, not all information on the web is accurate, reliable, or appropriate for learners of different ages and levels. without the guidance and feedback of a qualified teacher, students may encounter misinformation, bias, or inappropriate content that could harm their learning outcomes or critical thinking skills. for another thing, the internet and computer cannot replace the human interaction and socialization that are essential for developing communication, collaboration, and emotional skills. learning from a teacher also fosters respect, trust, and rapport between students and educators, which can motivate and inspire them to achieve their goals.

For example, they can get poor eyesight in early ages of childhood, and also develop back pain. Sometimes, students watch restrictive programs not allowed for their ages and this can have major psychological consequences. Many times, students get addictive to their favorite programs like Cartoon channels, or baseball and easily get distracted from study during exam period and this can seriously impact their grades.

Outcome.Outcome1: Tv is an immense source of information and pupils can learn and develop various skills by watching it. for instance, they can broaden their knowledge of different cultures, languages, and current affairs by watching documentaries, news, and educational programs. they can also improve their creativity, imagination, and critical thinking by watching movies, dramas, and cartoons that challenge their minds and inspire them to explore new ideas. tv can also be a source of entertainment and relaxation for pupils who need a break from their academic pressure and stress. however, watching tv for a continuously long hours can adversely impact children health. for example, they can get poor eyesight in early ages of childhood, and also develop back pain. sometimes, students watch restrictive programs not allowed for their ages and this can have major psychological consequences. many times, students get addictive to their favorite programs like cartoon channels, or baseball and easily get distracted from study during exam period and this can seriously impact their grades.
Outcome.Outcome2: However, watching tv is not always harmful for students, as there are many educational programs that can enrich their knowledge and skills. for instance, students can watch documentaries about different cultures, animals, or historical events, and learn more about the world and its diversity. they can also watch quiz shows, science programs, or biographies, and improve their critical thinking, curiosity, and creativity. these programs can be used as supplementary materials for their school curriculum or as a source of inspiration and motivation for their own projects and interests. but on the other hand, watching tv for a continuously long hours can adversely impact children health. for example, they can get poor eyesight in early ages of childhood, and also develop back pain. sometimes, students watch restrictive programs not allowed for their ages and this can have major psychological consequences. many times, students get addictive to their favorite programs like cartoon channels, or baseball and easily get distracted from study during exam period and this can seriously impact their grades.
Outcome.Outcome3: Right text: but on other hand, watching tv for a continuously long hours can adversely impact children health. for example, they can get poor eyesight in early ages of childhood, and also develop back pain. sometimes, students watch restrictive programs not allowed for their ages and this can have major psychological consequences. many times, students get addictive to their favorite programs like cartoon channels, or baseball and easily get distracted from study during exam period and this can seriously impact their grades.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, watching tv is not always beneficial for pupils. in fact, it can also have some serious drawbacks that outweigh the advantages. these disadvantages can affect both their physical and mental well-being, as well as their academic performance. let us look at some of the negative effects of watching tv for students.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, it is important to regulate and monitor the tv viewing habits of students, both at school and at home. teachers and parents should encourage children to watch educational and informative programs that can enhance their knowledge and creativity, and limit their exposure to violent, inappropriate, or trivial content. they should also balance the tv time with other activities, such as reading, playing, or doing homework, and ensure that children have enough physical exercise and rest. by doing so, they can help children to enjoy the benefits of tv without compromising their health and study.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, i think that watching tv should be limited and supervised both at school and at home. students should be encouraged to balance their tv time with other activities that can enhance their learning and well-being, such as reading, playing, exercising, and socializing. teachers and parents should also guide students to choose appropriate and educational programs that can enrich their knowledge and awareness of the world. by doing so, students can enjoy the benefits of tv without compromising their health and study.

Context.Right: Firstly, health improvement is the main reason for vegetarian diet to become so popular. Many researchers have convinced that many kinds of vegetable contain antioxydant which can prevent cancer. This fortifies the fact that a vegetable diet can do good for our health. Although some argue that a meal without meat can lead to a lack of protein intake, it is proved that many kinds of bean such as soy bean or pea are also comparable protein sources.

Prompt.Prompt1: Determine the topic based on the left and right text.
Prompt.Prompt2: The topic is the benefits and drawbacks of vegetarian diet.
Prompt.Prompt3: Elaborate on the evidence and sources that support the claim that many kinds of vegetable contain antioxidant.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add a connecting paragraph that acknowledges the counterargument that a meal without meat can lead to a lack of protein intake and introduces the alternative protein sources from beans.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the most appealing benefits of a vegetarian diet is its potential to improve health and prevent diseases. firstly, health improvement is the main reason for vegetarian diet to become so popular. many researchers have convinced that many kinds of vegetable contain antioxidant which can prevent cancer. this fortifies the fact that a vegetable diet can do good for our health. moreover, a vegetarian diet can also help reduce the risk of other chronic conditions, such as diabetes, heart disease, and obesity. although some argue that a meal without meat can lead to a lack of protein intake, it is proved that many kinds of bean such as soy bean or pea are also comparable protein sources. therefore, a vegetarian diet can provide adequate nutrition and promote wellness for people who choose it.
Outcome.Outcome2: However, health improvement is not the only factor to consider when choosing a vegetarian diet. some critics point out that there are also potential drawbacks and risks associated with avoiding animal products. for instance, vegetarians may face deficiencies in some essential nutrients such as iron, zinc, calcium, vitamin b12, and omega-3 fatty acids, which are mainly found in meat, fish, eggs, and dairy products. these nutrients are vital for the proper functioning of the immune system, the nervous system, the blood formation, the bone health, and the brain development. therefore, vegetarians need to supplement their diet with fortified foods or pills to avoid negative health consequences. moreover, some people may experience digestive problems, food allergies, or intolerances when consuming large amounts of plant-based foods, especially those that are high in fiber, lectins, or oxalates. these substances can interfere with the absorption of minerals, cause bloating, gas, or inflammation, and increase the risk of kidney stones or gout. thus, a vegetarian diet is not necessarily suitable for everyone and requires careful planning and monitoring.
Outcome.Outcome3: One way to elaborate on the evidence and sources that support the claim that many kinds of vegetable contain antioxidant is to cite some specific examples and studies that demonstrate their effects. for instance, according to the american institute for cancer research, cruciferous vegetables such as broccoli, cabbage, and kale have compounds that can modulate the activity of enzymes involved in detoxification and inflammation, which may reduce the risk of some cancers. similarly, a meta-analysis of 95 studies by imperial college london found that high intake of fruits and vegetables, especially those rich in vitamin c, carotenoids, and flavonoids, was associated with lower mortality and lower incidence of cardiovascular diseases and some cancers. these findings suggest that a vegetable diet can provide a variety of antioxidants that can protect the cells from oxidative stress and damage.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, not everyone is convinced that a vegetarian diet is beneficial for health. some critics claim that a meal without meat can lead to a lack of protein intake, which is essential for building and repairing muscles, bones, and tissues. they argue that animal products such as meat, eggs, and dairy are the best sources of complete protein, which contains all nine essential amino acids that the human body cannot produce on its own. without adequate protein intake, they warn, vegetarians may suffer from fatigue, weakness, and poor immunity.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the most common reasons why people choose to follow a vegetarian diet is the belief that it can improve their health. according to many studies, vegetables are rich in antioxidants that can protect the body from cancer and other diseases. therefore, many vegetarians claim that eating more plants and less animal products can benefit their well-being. however, some critics of vegetarianism argue that meat is essential for providing enough protein, which is vital for building and repairing tissues. they question whether vegetarians can get enough protein from plant sources, such as beans and peas, which are often considered as alternatives to meat.
Outcome.Outcome6: Besides the health benefits of a vegetarian diet, another reason for its popularity is the ethical and environmental concerns of many people. some vegetarians choose not to eat meat because they oppose the killing and suffering of animals for food. they also believe that a plant-based diet is more sustainable and eco-friendly than a meat-based one. by avoiding meat, they reduce their carbon footprint, water consumption, and land use. therefore, a vegetarian diet can be seen as a way of expressing one's values and compassion for other living beings.

Context.Left: Many governments believe that space exploration is an activity that wastes the budget, while the essential challenge of humanity in the future would be the discovery of a new place for the living. In 2th century, although human being succeeded to achieve out of space by means of new technologies such as rockets, but finding a new place for living in another planet is impossible until now. In during history, our planet is threatening by many of other planets or stars and it is an enormous danger for living of humanity. Therefore, it is very significant to find a new place for living in other planets.
Context.Right: In summary, spending budget for space exploring is not the waste budget, because it may helps to save civilization of humanity. Although exploring space used for discovery of other planets, nowadays most of governments have used many rockets for military purposes and therefore the purposes of exploring space has altered.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of space exploration and its benefits and drawbacks in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some evidence or examples to support your claim that finding a new place for living in another planet is very significant.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain the challenges or obstacles that prevent human beings from achieving this goal of space colonization.
Prompt.Prompt4: Restate your main argument and summarize the main points of your essay in the last paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Space exploration is the scientific and technological endeavor of exploring the outer space beyond the earth's atmosphere. it has been a source of fascination and curiosity for many people, as well as a means of advancing human knowledge and understanding of the universe. however, space exploration also has its challenges and controversies, such as the high cost, the environmental impact, the ethical issues, and the potential conflicts and risks involved. in this essay, i will discuss why some governments believe that space exploration is a waste of budget, and why i disagree with this view. i will also examine how the purposes of space exploration have changed over time, and what implications this has for the future of humanity.
Outcome.Outcome2: Finding a new place for living in another planet is very significant for the survival of humanity, especially in the face of the potential threats from outer space. for instance, some scientists warn that a large asteroid could collide with the earth and cause a global catastrophe, similar to the one that wiped out the dinosaurs millions of years ago. moreover, the earth's resources are finite and its environment is deteriorating due to overpopulation, pollution, and climate change. therefore, exploring space could offer new opportunities for scientific discovery, resource extraction, and colonization, which could benefit humanity in the long term.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, finding a new place for living in other planets is not an easy task, as it involves many challenges and obstacles that prevent human beings from achieving this goal of space colonization. some of these challenges are scientific, such as the distance, the environment, the resources, and the adaptation of life forms to different conditions. some of these challenges are ethical, such as the impact of human activities on the existing ecosystems, the rights and responsibilities of the colonizers, and the potential conflicts with other civilizations. some of these challenges are political, such as the regulation, the cooperation, the competition, and the security of the space activities. therefore, exploring space requires not only technological advancement, but also social, moral, and legal frameworks that can address these issues.
Outcome.Outcome4: Space exploration is an activity that can benefit humanity in the long term, as it can provide a potential solution for the problem of finding a new place to live in the face of planetary threats. however, this noble goal is often overshadowed by the misuse of space technology for military purposes, which can endanger the peace and security of the world. therefore, it is important to ensure that space exploration is conducted for scientific and humanitarian reasons, not for political and economic interests. in summary, spending budget for space exploring is not the waste budget, because it may help to save civilization of humanity. although exploring space used for discovery of other planets, nowadays most of governments have used many rockets for military purposes and therefore the purposes of exploring space has altered.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, some people argue that space exploration is not only about finding a new place for living, but also about advancing scientific knowledge, developing new technologies, and enhancing international cooperation. they claim that space exploration has brought many benefits to humanity, such as satellite communication, weather forecasting, navigation, and earth observation. they also point out that space exploration can inspire curiosity, creativity, and innovation among the younger generations, and foster a sense of wonder and awe about the universe. therefore, they support investing in space exploration as a way of enriching human culture and civilization.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, not all space exploration activities are motivated by the noble goal of finding a new home for humanity. in fact, some critics argue that space exploration has been hijacked by geopolitical and military interests, and that it serves to fuel the arms race and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. they point out that many rockets that are launched for scientific or commercial purposes can also be used to deliver nuclear warheads or spy satellites, and that some countries are developing anti-satellite weapons or space-based lasers that could disrupt or destroy the existing infrastructure and communication systems in orbit. therefore, they contend that the purposes of space exploration have altered, and that it poses more risks than benefits for the world.

Context.Left: There is a hotly debated issue over whether people have to live at a higher or lower pace, and this topic can also be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to be hurry to complete their tasks, while others seem to prefer the opposite position. After deeply pondering over this issue, I also develop my own perspective. I favor the former; that is, I prefer to live in a higher pace condition.
Context.Right: Apart from the one I have mentioned above, another equally important aspect is keeping in high pace condition can prevent me from getting lazy. If I can avoid being a sluggish person, I can have a higher probability of fulfilling my dream successfully. For instance, I had spent more time on practicing playing piano so that I won a piano competition, defeating those spending less time on practicing. Hence, from this case we are capable of stating that keeping our pace higher is important.

Prompt.Prompt1: Provide some evidence or examples to support your preference for living in a higher pace condition.
Prompt.Prompt2: Compare and contrast living in a higher pace condition with living in a lower pace condition and show why the former is more desirable for you.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from your preference to your second reason smooth and coherent.
Prompt.Prompt4: Discuss how living in a higher pace condition can prevent you from getting lazy and help you achieve your goals or dreams.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Living in a higher pace condition not only helps me achieve more in a limited time, but also brings me more satisfaction and happiness. i enjoy the challenge and excitement of setting and pursuing ambitious goals, and i feel proud of myself when i accomplish them. for example, when i was in college, i decided to major in both engineering and business, which required me to take more courses and projects than the average student. however, i did not regret my choice, because i learned a lot from both fields and gained valuable skills and knowledge. moreover, i was able to secure a prestigious internship and a scholarship, which boosted my confidence and motivation. therefore, living in a higher pace condition can enrich my life and make me more fulfilled.
Outcome.Outcome2: Living in a higher pace condition has many advantages over living in a lower pace condition, especially for me who has ambitious goals and aspirations. when i live in a higher pace condition, i can accomplish more tasks in a shorter time, challenge myself to improve my skills and abilities, and seize more opportunities that may arise in my field of interest. on the contrary, when i live in a lower pace condition, i may miss some deadlines, lose some motivation and enthusiasm, and settle for less than what i am capable of. therefore, living in a higher pace condition is more desirable for me, as it can help me achieve more satisfaction and fulfillment in my life. apart from the one i have mentioned above, another equally important aspect is...
Outcome.Outcome3: Living in a higher pace condition not only allows me to seize more opportunities, but also helps me to cultivate a positive and diligent attitude towards life. i believe that being proactive and hardworking is essential for achieving any goal, and that living in a lower pace condition might tempt me to procrastinate or lose motivation. therefore, another reason why i favor the former position is that keeping in high pace condition can prevent me from getting lazy.
Outcome.Outcome4: One of the main reasons why i prefer to live in a higher pace condition is that it can help me achieve my goals or dreams more effectively. living in a higher pace condition means that i have to set clear and challenging objectives for myself and work hard to accomplish them within a given time frame. this can motivate me to improve my skills, knowledge, and abilities in various fields and overcome any obstacles or difficulties that i may encounter. living in a higher pace condition can also prevent me from getting lazy, which is a detrimental habit that can hinder my progress and performance. by keeping myself busy and engaged in meaningful activities, i can avoid wasting time and energy on trivial or unproductive matters and focus on what really matters to me. for example, when i was preparing for a piano competition, i had to practice playing piano regularly and intensively, which not only enhanced my musical talent but also prevented me from getting distracted by other temptations or distractions. as a result, i was able to win the competition and fulfill my dream of becoming a pianist. therefore, living in a higher pace condition can be beneficial for my personal and professional development.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the main reasons why i prefer to live in a higher pace condition is that it can enhance my efficiency and productivity in various aspects of life. whether it is academic, professional, or personal, i believe that being able to accomplish more tasks in a shorter time can bring me more satisfaction and achievement. for example, when i have a tight deadline for a project, i can focus more on the essential parts and avoid unnecessary distractions, which can improve the quality of my work. moreover, living in a higher pace condition can also help me develop some valuable skills, such as time management, problem-solving, and multitasking, that can benefit me in the long run. therefore, i think that living in a higher pace condition can make me a more competent and confident person.
Outcome.Outcome6: The main reason why i favor living at a higher pace is that it can help me achieve more in life and make better use of my time. by setting clear goals and deadlines for myself, i can motivate myself to work hard and efficiently, without wasting time on trivial or irrelevant matters. this way, i can also improve my skills and knowledge, and gain more confidence and satisfaction from my accomplishments. living at a higher pace does not mean that i neglect my health or happiness, but rather that i balance them with my responsibilities and aspirations.

Context.Right: In terms of time and space, technology makes it more efficient and effective to promote the traditional skills and ways of life. In the past, only when people went to the local place could they experience the specific traditional lifestyles. This means individuals who were engaged in work and therefore could not spare time to travel or restricted by traffic conditions had to miss the chance to appreciate the traditional skills. However, with the access to the Internet, one of the greatest innovations in modern society, humankind can acquire the traditional techniques displayed online anytime, anywhere.

Prompt.Prompt1: Provide some examples of traditional skills and ways of life that can benefit from technology, such as crafts, music, cuisine, etc.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain how technology can enhance the quality and accessibility of learning and experiencing traditional skills and ways of life, such as through online courses, videos, podcasts, etc.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting sentence that summarizes the main point of the paragraph and links it to the next one, such as 'Therefore, technology can be a powerful tool to support and promote the cultural heritage of different regions and communities.'
