Outcome.Outcome1: Cheap flights have become more popular and accessible in recent years, offering many benefits and opportunities for travelers and businesses. however, they also have some serious drawbacks, especially for the environment. on the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airports that may increase the air pollution for people who live and work close to them. however, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. burning plane fuel can release carbon dioxide into the environment that causes the earth to heat up. in fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce co2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to rein in the airlines.
Outcome.Outcome2: Cheap flights not only make travelling more affordable and convenient for people, but also bring benefits to the tourism industry. for example, cheap flights can attract more visitors to different destinations, creating more jobs and income for local businesses and communities. cheap flights can also increase cultural exchange and diversity, as people can experience different customs, languages and cuisines. furthermore, cheap flights can enable people to visit their relatives and friends more often, strengthening their social ties and well-being.
Outcome.Outcome3: Growing of cheap flights has not only economic but also environmental consequences. on the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. one of the reasons is that more flights require more infrastructure and resources to accommodate the increasing demand for air travel. this leads to bigger and busier airports that may expand into natural habitats, consume more energy and water, and generate more noise and waste. moreover, bigger and busier airports also mean more air pollution for people who live and work close to them, as they are exposed to higher levels of harmful emissions from planes, vehicles, and machinery. however, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxide into environment that cause the earth to heat up. in fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce co2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines.
Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, cheap flights have both advantages and disadvantages for people and society. they can offer more opportunities for travel, education, and business, but they can also create more competition, inequality, and cultural erosion. on the other hand, cheap flights have a serious negative impact on the environment, as they contribute to air pollution and global warming. while other sectors are trying to reduce their carbon footprint, the aviation industry seems to be expanding without any regulation or accountability. therefore, i believe that cheap flights should be limited and taxed more to discourage excessive flying and to encourage more sustainable modes of transport.
Outcome.Outcome5: On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. however, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxide into environment that cause the earth to heat up. in fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce co2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. this is a serious problem, as aviation is one of the fastest growing sources of greenhouse gas emissions in the world. according to some estimates, flying accounts for more than 2% of global co2 emissions, and this figure could rise to 15% by 2050 if no action is taken. therefore, it is important to consider the environmental costs of cheap flights and find ways to reduce their impact.
Outcome.Outcome6: On the other hand, growing of cheap flights really have negative impact on environment. apparently, more flights could mean bigger and busier airport that may be grown the air pollution for people who live and work close to it. however, the biggest concern is the effect on global warming. burning plane fuel can releases carbon dioxide into environment that cause the earth to heat up. in fact, while many efforts are being made to reduce co2 emissions from cars and factories, nothing is being done to reins the airlines. this is a serious problem, as aviation is one of the fastest growing sources of greenhouse gas emissions in the world. according to some estimates, the aviation sector could account for up to 25% of the global carbon budget by 2050, unless urgent action is taken to curb its growth and improve its efficiency. therefore, it is important to consider the environmental costs and consequences of cheap flights, and to balance them with the social and economic benefits.

Context.Left: Last but not least, every communication needs fluency so people can understand each other exactly and remember it for a long time. Voice email or face-to-face conversations sometimes make reserve people feel not very confident. For example, when I face my parents, I can't speak out every idea and express consecutively. They may stop me, speak something against it and that makes me forget what I want to say. Anyone can meet this problem once in any conversation. E-mail helps me arrange my idea perfectly and make it persuasive.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of communication methods and their advantages and disadvantages.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples or evidence to support your preference for email communication.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that acknowledges the limitations of email communication and the possible situations where other methods might be more suitable.
Prompt.Prompt4: Conclude your writing by summarizing your main points and restating your thesis statement.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Communication is an essential skill in any situation, whether it is personal, professional, or academic. however, different communication methods have different advantages and disadvantages depending on the purpose, context, and audience of the message. some people may prefer voice email or face-to-face conversations for their immediacy, authenticity, and feedback, while others may favor written email for its convenience, clarity, and flexibility. in this essay, i will compare and contrast these two communication methods and explain how they affect my own experience as a student and a daughter.
Outcome.Outcome2: Email communication also allows me to provide some examples or evidence to support my points and opinions, which might not be possible or convenient in voice or face-to-face conversations. for instance, when i want to persuade my parents to let me study abroad, i can attach some documents or links that show the benefits and opportunities of the program, the requirements and costs, and the testimonials of other students who have done it. this way, i can show them that i have done my research and that i have a clear plan and goal. in contrast, if i try to explain these things verbally, they might interrupt me, question me, or dismiss me without giving me a chance to finish or prove my case. email communication gives me more space and time to present my arguments and evidence in a logical and coherent way.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, email communication is not without its drawbacks and challenges. sometimes, email messages can be misinterpreted, delayed, ignored, or lost in the inbox. email communication also lacks the immediacy, tone, and body language of face-to-face or voice conversations, which can affect the emotional and social aspects of communication. therefore, email communication may not be the best choice for urgent, sensitive, or complex issues that require immediate feedback, clarification, or negotiation. in such situations, other methods of communication, such as phone calls, video calls, or face-to-face meetings, might be more appropriate and effective.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, email is an effective and convenient way of communication that can overcome the barriers of time, distance, and emotions. it allows people to express themselves clearly, politely, and fluently, without the pressure and interruptions of voice or face-to-face conversations. therefore, i think email is better than other methods of communication for me and many others who share similar situations. email helps me communicate with my parents, friends, and teachers more confidently and successfully.
Outcome.Outcome5: To achieve fluency in communication, email also has some advantages over voice email or face-to-face conversations, especially for people who are shy or reserved. email allows them to organize their thoughts and arguments clearly and logically, without being interrupted or distracted by the reactions or opinions of the listeners. this can help them express themselves more confidently and persuasively, and avoid forgetting or omitting important points. for instance, when i have to talk to my parents about something that they might disagree with, i find it easier and more effective to write an email than to speak to them directly.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, e-mail is not only a convenient and fast way of communication, but also a tool to improve our writing skills and fluency. by writing e-mails, we can practice how to organize our thoughts, use appropriate vocabulary and grammar, and avoid misunderstandings. moreover, e-mail gives us more time and space to think and express ourselves clearly and confidently. this is especially helpful for those who are shy or nervous in oral communication. for instance, i find it easier to communicate with my parents through e-mail than face-to-face.

Context.Left: The housing shortage is drawing more and more attention nowadays. And the cost of accommodation keeps growing these years. The necessity of governmental financial aid is extremely important. What government should take into consideration at the first place should not be historic and traditional building preservation but new building construction.
Context.Right: Otherwise, another vital reason why new building construction deserves more governmental investment lies in the fact that it requires far more resource compare to old building preservation. Build a new building has following prerequisites, land that has been sold by the government via formal procedures, a reliable construction company and tremendous amount of labor. Except these, hundreds of problems would occur during the construction. Thus, only government can cope with it by utilizing its enormous resource like dollars and effectiveness.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of governmental financial aid for housing and state your position on whether new building construction or old building preservation should receive more funding.
Prompt.Prompt2: Acknowledge the possible counterarguments or objections to your position and explain why they are not convincing or sufficient.
Prompt.Prompt3: Elaborate on the economic and social benefits of new building construction, such as creating more jobs, increasing tax revenue, and improving living standards.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize your main points and restate your position on the issue of governmental financial aid for housing. End with a strong and memorable statement that leaves an impression on the reader.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the most pressing issues facing many urban areas today is the lack of affordable and adequate housing for the growing population. as the demand for accommodation exceeds the supply, the prices of rent and property soar, putting a heavy burden on low- and middle-income households. in this situation, the role of governmental financial aid is crucial to ensure that everyone has access to decent living conditions. however, there is a debate on how the government should allocate its funds for housing: should it prioritize new building construction or old building preservation? in this essay, i will argue that new building construction deserves more governmental investment than old building preservation, for two main reasons: it can create more housing units and jobs, and it needs more resources and management than old building preservation.
Outcome.Outcome2: Some might argue that preserving historic and traditional buildings is also a way of addressing the housing shortage, as they can be renovated and adapted for modern use. they might also claim that preserving old buildings is more environmentally friendly and culturally valuable than constructing new ones. however, these arguments are not convincing or sufficient for several reasons. first, renovating old buildings often entails high costs and technical challenges, especially if they are protected by heritage laws or have structural problems. second, preserving old buildings does not necessarily increase the supply of affordable and accessible housing, as they might be occupied by wealthy or privileged groups or used for commercial or tourist purposes. third, constructing new buildings does not mean ignoring or destroying the cultural and historical significance of old buildings, as they can be integrated or complemented by appropriate design and planning. therefore, new building construction deserves more governmental investment than old building preservation.
Outcome.Outcome3: New building construction not only alleviates the housing shortage, but also brings economic and social benefits to the society. by investing in new buildings, the government can create more jobs for the workers, engineers, architects, and suppliers involved in the construction industry. these jobs can boost the income and consumption of the people, and generate more tax revenue for the public services. moreover, new buildings can improve the living standards of the residents, by providing them with modern facilities, energy efficiency, and safety. new buildings can also enhance the urban landscape and the environmental quality, by replacing the old and dilapidated structures that may pose hazards or pollution. therefore, new building construction deserves more governmental investment than old building preservation.
Outcome.Outcome4: Therefore, i strongly believe that the government should prioritize new building construction over old building preservation when allocating financial aid for housing. the housing shortage is a pressing social issue that affects the well-being and dignity of millions of people, and the cost of accommodation is becoming increasingly unaffordable. new building construction can provide more and better housing options for the public, as well as stimulate the economy and create jobs. on the other hand, old building preservation is less urgent and less beneficial, and it often involves complex and expensive legal and technical challenges. the government has the responsibility and the capacity to address the housing crisis by investing more in new building construction, which is a wise and compassionate choice for the present and the future of the nation.
Outcome.Outcome5: To address the housing shortage and the rising cost of accommodation, the government should prioritize new building construction over old building preservation. new building construction can provide more affordable and modern housing options for the people, especially for the low-income and vulnerable groups. moreover, new building construction can also stimulate the economy and create more job opportunities for the workers.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, some may argue that preserving historic and traditional buildings is also a way of providing more accommodation, as well as maintaining cultural heritage and aesthetic value. they may point out that old buildings can be renovated, adapted, or converted for different purposes, such as residential, commercial, or educational. moreover, they may claim that old building preservation can create jobs, attract tourism, and enhance the identity and diversity of the city. while these arguments are not without merit, they overlook the limitations and challenges of old building preservation, especially when compared to new building construction.

Context.Left: There are many advantages of distance learning, but it should not replace classroom learning. Learning in classroom could provide more information to study. Besides, learning in classroom are not only learning academic skills but also learning social skills, and learning how to solve problem in real situation. Consequently, I completely disagree with this statement that we should replace normal course with online course. I will give reasons to support my opinion.
Context.Right: Secondly, online class could not provide knowledge about social skills. For instance, In a classroom, teacher could give assignment to student to work as a group. This could help students to learn how to deal with people, how to collaborate with people in their group. This important skill cannot be gotten in online classes.

Prompt.Prompt1: Firstly, explain why learning in a classroom could provide more information than online courses.
Prompt.Prompt2: Give some examples of the sources and methods of learning that are available in a classroom but not online.
Prompt.Prompt3: Use a topic sentence to introduce the main idea of the next paragraph, which is about social skills.
Prompt.Prompt4: Compare and contrast the opportunities and challenges of learning social skills in a classroom and online.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the main advantages of learning in a classroom is that it could provide more information than online courses. this is because in a classroom, students can interact with their teachers and peers, ask questions, clarify doubts, and receive feedback. they can also access various resources, such as textbooks, libraries, laboratories, and field trips, that may not be available or convenient in online settings. moreover, in a classroom, students can benefit from the diversity of perspectives, experiences, and cultures of their classmates, which can enrich their learning and broaden their horizons. therefore, learning in a classroom could enhance the depth and quality of students' knowledge.
Outcome.Outcome2: Another advantage of classroom learning is that it offers more diverse and interactive sources and methods of learning than online learning. for example, in a classroom, students can access various materials, such as books, journals, newspapers, and posters, that may not be easily available or accessible online. they can also participate in different activities, such as experiments, demonstrations, debates, and presentations, that can enhance their understanding and application of the concepts they learn. these sources and methods of learning can stimulate their curiosity, creativity, and critical thinking skills, which are essential for academic success and lifelong learning.
Outcome.Outcome3: Another disadvantage of distance learning is that it could not provide knowledge about social skills. social skills are essential for personal and professional development, as they enable people to communicate effectively, cooperate with others, and resolve conflicts. however, online classes limit the opportunities for students to interact with their peers and teachers, and to practice these skills in real situations. for instance, in a classroom, a teacher could give an assignment to students to work as a group. this could help students to learn how to deal with people, how to collaborate with people in their group, and how to handle different opinions and perspectives. this important skill cannot be obtained in online classes, where students may only communicate through chat or video calls, or work individually.
Outcome.Outcome4: One of the main benefits of distance learning is that it allows learners to access education from anywhere and at any time, regardless of their location, schedule, or personal circumstances. however, this flexibility also comes with some drawbacks, especially when it comes to developing social skills. in contrast to online learning, classroom learning offers more opportunities for learners to interact with their peers and teachers, to participate in group activities and discussions, and to receive immediate feedback and support. these interactions can foster social skills such as communication, cooperation, conflict resolution, and empathy, which are essential for personal and professional success. online learning, on the other hand, may limit the quality and quantity of social interactions, as learners may face technical issues, isolation, or lack of motivation. while some online courses may try to incorporate collaborative tools and platforms, such as chat rooms, forums, or video conferences, they may not be able to replicate the same level of engagement and intimacy as face-to-face interactions. therefore, online learning may not provide adequate knowledge and practice of social skills.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the main advantages of distance learning is that it offers flexibility and convenience for learners who have busy schedules or live far away from school. however, this does not mean that it can replace the rich and diverse experience of learning in a classroom. learning in a classroom could provide more information to study, as well as opportunities to develop other essential skills. in the following paragraphs, i will explain why online classes cannot replace classroom learning in terms of social skills and problem-solving abilities.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the reasons why i disagree with replacing classroom learning with distance learning is that classroom learning can provide more information to study. unlike online courses, which may have limited resources and interactions, classroom learning can expose students to a variety of materials, perspectives, and feedback from teachers and peers. moreover, classroom learning can also enhance students' critical thinking and analytical skills, as they can participate in discussions, debates, and presentations that challenge their assumptions and opinions. therefore, classroom learning can offer a richer and deeper learning experience than online courses.

Context.Left: Critics may argue that the Internet have several drawbacks which can affect the education system negatively, for instance internet abuse and black webs. However, we should bear in mind that these problems are mainly triggered by students' wrong approach towards the Internet not the Internet itself. Thus, what we are to do is a change in learners' attitude not an elimination of the Internet from academic study.

Prompt.Prompt1: Provide some examples of how the Internet can enhance learning outcomes and skills in the second paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Add a counterargument paragraph that acknowledges the potential drawbacks of the Internet for education, but refutes them with evidence and logic.
Prompt.Prompt3: Summarize the main points and restate the thesis in the last paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt4: Use appropriate transitions, citations, and tone throughout the essay.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: The internet, if used properly, can be a powerful tool for enhancing learning outcomes and skills in various fields of study. for example, the internet can provide access to a vast amount of information and resources that can supplement textbooks and lectures, such as online databases, journals, videos, podcasts, and interactive simulations. the internet can also facilitate communication and collaboration among students and teachers, such as through online forums, chats, blogs, and wikis, where they can exchange ideas, feedback, and perspectives. moreover, the internet can foster creativity and innovation, as students can use various online platforms and tools to create and share their own digital products, such as websites, podcasts, blogs, and multimedia presentations. by engaging with the internet in these ways, students can develop critical thinking, research, communication, and digital literacy skills that are essential for the 21st century.
Outcome.Outcome2: Nevertheless, some critics may argue that the internet has several drawbacks that can affect the education system negatively, for instance, internet abuse and black webs. they might claim that the internet exposes students to harmful or inappropriate content, distracts them from their academic tasks, or facilitates cheating and plagiarism. however, we should bear in mind that these problems are mainly triggered by students' wrong approach towards the internet, not the internet itself. thus, what we need to do is to change learners' attitude, not to eliminate the internet from academic study. moreover, there are ways to prevent or minimize these risks, such as using filters, parental controls, or academic integrity policies, as well as educating students about the ethical and responsible use of the internet. therefore, the benefits of the internet for education outweigh its potential drawbacks, as long as it is used wisely and appropriately.
Outcome.Outcome3: To conclude, the internet is a valuable tool for education that can provide a wealth of information, opportunities, and benefits for students and teachers. rather than blaming the internet for its potential drawbacks, such as internet abuse and black webs, we should focus on educating students on how to use it responsibly and ethically. the internet itself is not the problem, but the way some students misuse it. therefore, we need to foster a positive and constructive attitude towards the internet in academic study.
Outcome.Outcome4: Critics may argue that the internet have several drawbacks which can affect the education system negatively, for instance internet abuse and black webs. however, we should bear in mind that these problems are mainly triggered by students' wrong approach towards the internet not the internet itself. thus, what we are to do is a change in learners' attitude not an elimination of the internet from academic study. in fact, the internet can offer many benefits for students and teachers if used properly and responsibly. according to smith (2019), the internet can enhance students' motivation, engagement, collaboration, creativity, and critical thinking skills, as well as provide access to a wealth of information and resources. moreover, the internet can facilitate communication and feedback between students and teachers, as well as among peers, which can improve the quality of learning and teaching. therefore, instead of dismissing the internet as a harmful or distracting tool, we should embrace it as a powerful and versatile ally in education.
Outcome.Outcome5: Hence, the internet can be a powerful tool for enhancing students' learning outcomes and developing their skills, if used properly and responsibly. instead of banning or limiting the internet access for students, educators should guide them to use it wisely and ethically, and to avoid harmful or unreliable sources of information. moreover, students should be taught how to evaluate the credibility and relevance of the online materials they encounter, and how to cite them appropriately in their academic work. by doing so, students can benefit from the internet as a rich and diverse resource for learning, while avoiding its potential pitfalls.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, the internet is a powerful and beneficial tool for education, as long as it is used appropriately and responsibly. instead of blaming the internet for its potential drawbacks, educators and students should focus on how to harness its advantages and avoid its pitfalls. for example, they can develop digital literacy skills, such as evaluating online sources, avoiding plagiarism, and protecting personal information. they can also use the internet to access a wide range of learning resources, collaborate with peers and experts, and enhance their creativity and critical thinking. by doing so, they can make the most of the internet as a means of enriching their education and preparing themselves for the future.
