Prompt.Prompt3: To prepare for the right text, acknowledge the challenges or limitations of the green economy, such as the high costs, the lack of infrastructure or the uneven distribution of benefits.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add a connecting sentence that summarizes your main point and introduces the idea of international cooperation as a possible solution to the environmental problems in the underdeveloped areas.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Hence, it is evident that the booming economy and the preservation of the environment are not mutually exclusive, but rather complementary and beneficial for both businesses and consumers. by adopting green practices and innovations, companies can gain competitive advantages and satisfy the growing demand for eco-friendly products and services. for instance, electric bicycles powered by clean energy resources have been well received among people in recent years. however, this does not mean that the environmental challenges are solved or can be ignored. therefore, i would conclude that thriving economies and the preservation of ecosystems can be promoted simultaneously. on the other hand, i suppose the developed countries should support the underdeveloped areas by providing financial resources, technologies and experience so that the environmental problems can be effectively alleviated in these areas.
Outcome.Outcome2: This argument can be further supported by some evidence or examples that demonstrate the positive impact of the green economy on both the economic growth and the environmental protection. for instance, according to the world bank, the global market for low-carbon and environmental goods and services is projected to reach $2.2 trillion by 2020, creating millions of green jobs and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. moreover, some studies have shown that investing in renewable energy, energy efficiency, waste management and sustainable agriculture can generate higher returns and lower risks than conventional sectors. additionally, some cases of successful green businesses or policies, such as tesla, ikea and the european green deal, have illustrated how innovation, leadership and cooperation can foster a circular and inclusive economy that respects the natural resources and the social welfare.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, i believe the booming economy can be closely linked to the preservation of the environment. with people raising their awareness of the green economy, the products free of pollutants are increasingly prevalent among clients, which means eco-friendly businesses can make a favorable impression on customers today, triggering sales. for example, electronic bicycles powered by clean energy resources have been well received among people in recent years. nevertheless, achieving a green economy is not without challenges or limitations. the transition to low-carbon and renewable energy sources may entail high upfront costs, the need for upgrading infrastructure and the development of new skills and capacities. moreover, the benefits of the green economy may not be equally distributed among different regions, sectors and social groups, creating potential trade-offs and conflicts of interest. therefore, i would conclude that thriving economies and the preservation of ecosystems can be promoted simultaneously. on the other hand, i suppose the developed countries should support the underdeveloped areas by providing financial resources, technologies and experience so that the environmental problems can be effectively alleviated in these areas.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, i believe the booming economy can be closely linked to the preservation of the environment. with people raising their awareness of the green economy, the products free of pollutants are increasingly prevalent among clients, which means eco-friendly businesses can make a favorable impression on customers today, triggering sales. for example, electronic bicycles powered by clean energy resources have been well received among people in recent years. thus, i contend that economic development and environmental protection are not mutually exclusive, but rather complementary goals that can benefit both society and nature. however, this does not mean that the environmental challenges faced by the underdeveloped areas can be ignored or neglected. therefore, i would conclude that thriving economies and the preservation of ecosystems can be promoted simultaneously. on the other hand, i suppose the developed countries should support the underdeveloped areas by providing financial resources, technologies and experience so that the environmental problems can be effectively alleviated in these areas.
Outcome.Outcome5: This argument suggests that the green economy is not only beneficial for the environment, but also for the economic growth and development of the countries that adopt it. by producing and consuming goods and services that minimize environmental impacts and enhance natural resources, these countries can gain a competitive edge in the global market and improve their living standards. however, not all countries have the same capacity and opportunity to pursue this path, especially those that face poverty, inequality and instability.
Outcome.Outcome6: Hence, it is clear that the protection of the environment is not only a moral duty, but also a smart business strategy in the modern world. by investing in green technologies and practices, companies can gain competitive advantages and meet the increasing demands of environmentally conscious consumers. however, not all regions and countries have the same opportunities and capacities to pursue a green economy. some of them are still struggling with poverty, inequality and environmental degradation. this is where the role of the developed countries becomes crucial.

Comment.Comment1: Contains info from the left and right

Context.Right: Firstly, committing to our goal helps creating personal worth. For example, I realized the true potential of my body and mind as I decided to train myself hard. Even if I were not to win this medal, I acknowledged the great amount of my endeavor as I could keep my tired legs running.

Prompt.Prompt1: Define what personal worth means to you and why it is important.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain how training hard helped you realize the true potential of your body and mind.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that summarizes your main point and introduces the next topic of winning the medal.
Prompt.Prompt4: Discuss how winning the medal was a rewarding outcome of your commitment and effort.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Personal worth is the sense of value and respect that i have for myself, regardless of external factors or opinions. it is important because it boosts my confidence, motivation, and resilience in pursuing my goals and overcoming challenges. by committing to my goal of running a marathon, i developed personal worth in two ways. firstly, as the left text explains, i realized the true potential of my body and mind as i decided to train myself hard. even if i were not to win this medal, i acknowledged the great amount of my endeavor as i could keep my tired legs running. secondly, i also recognized the positive impact of my goal on other aspects of my life, such as my health, relationships, and career. running a marathon not only improved my physical fitness, but also taught me discipline, perseverance, and self-care. it also strengthened my bond with my family and friends who supported me along the way. it also enhanced my performance and satisfaction at work, as i learned to manage my time, energy, and stress better. therefore, committing to my goal helped creating personal worth that benefited me in multiple ways.
Outcome.Outcome2: Firstly, committing to our goal helps creating personal worth. for example, i realized the true potential of my body and mind as i decided to train myself hard. training hard challenged me to overcome physical and mental barriers, to push myself beyond my limits, and to discover new strengths and abilities. i learned to appreciate the value of discipline, perseverance, and resilience, and to respect my own efforts and achievements. even if i were not to win this medal, i acknowledged the great amount of my endeavor as i could keep my tired legs running.
Outcome.Outcome3: Therefore, setting a clear and challenging goal can boost our self-esteem and confidence by making us aware of our own capabilities and efforts. however, achieving our goal also brings us another benefit: recognition and appreciation from others. in the next paragraph, i will discuss how winning the medal enhanced my social value and motivated me to pursue further excellence.
Outcome.Outcome4: Firstly, committing to our goal helps creating personal worth. for example, i realized the true potential of my body and mind as i decided to train myself hard. even if i were not to win this medal, i acknowledged the great amount of my endeavor as i could keep my tired legs running. however, winning the medal was a rewarding outcome of my commitment and effort. it validated my perseverance and dedication, and gave me a sense of achievement and pride. it also motivated me to continue pursuing my passion and challenging myself to grow as an athlete.
Outcome.Outcome5: Firstly, committing to our goal helps creating personal worth. for example, i realized the true potential of my body and mind as i decided to train myself hard. even if i were not to win this medal, i acknowledged the great amount of my endeavor as i could keep my tired legs running. this sense of achievement and self-respect motivated me to pursue my passion and overcome any obstacles. secondly, committing to our goal also helps developing valuable skills and habits. as i followed a strict schedule and diet, i learned how to manage my time, energy, and resources effectively. i also became more disciplined, resilient, and focused. these skills and habits not only improved my performance, but also benefited other aspects of my life, such as my studies, relationships, and health.
Outcome.Outcome6: Committing to our goal not only helps creating personal worth, but also fosters resilience and perseverance. these qualities are essential for overcoming challenges and setbacks that we may encounter along the way. for example, when i faced a serious injury that threatened to end my running career, i did not give up on my dream of winning a medal. instead, i used my goal as a motivation to recover and train harder than ever.

Context.Right: Some people spot out that humanities benefit so much from zoos. First of all, zoos are fascinating places of entertainment. For this point, they all think that the very nature and wildness are all brought into zoos and spending time there help us to forget all stress as well as pressure. Another function that all zoos serve relates to education. Many students as well as people find zoos as good places for witnessing and researching the true animal world. Moreover, some zoos are also reservation sites of many animals that are about to become extinct.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of zoos and their advantages and disadvantages in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: State your thesis statement at the end of the first paragraph, indicating your position on whether zoos are beneficial or harmful for animals and humans.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from the introduction to the first body paragraph, where you will present the arguments in favor of zoos.
Prompt.Prompt4: End the first body paragraph with a topic sentence that summarizes your main idea and links it to the next paragraph, where you will present the arguments against zoos.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Zoos are places where humans can observe and interact with various kinds of animals, some of which are rare or endangered. however, zoos also raise ethical and environmental issues, such as the welfare of the captive animals, the impact of artificial habitats, and the conservation of biodiversity. in this essay, i will discuss some of the arguments for and against zoos, focusing on their roles as sources of entertainment, education, and preservation.
Outcome.Outcome2: Zoos are places where animals from different habitats and continents are kept in enclosures and displayed to the public. while some people argue that zoos have many advantages for both animals and humans, others contend that zoos are cruel and unethical institutions that violate the rights and welfare of the animals. in this essay, i will examine both sides of the debate and explain why i believe that zoos are more harmful than beneficial for animals and humans.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, not everyone agrees that zoos are beneficial for humans and animals alike. there are also many arguments against keeping animals in captivity, especially in conditions that do not meet their natural needs and behaviors. in this essay, i will examine both sides of the debate and evaluate the merits and drawbacks of zoos. i will begin by presenting the main reasons why some people support zoos and how they claim that zoos serve important purposes for humanity and wildlife conservation.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, not everyone agrees that zoos are beneficial for humans or animals. in fact, many critics argue that zoos are harmful, unethical, and unnecessary. in the following paragraph, i will examine some of the main reasons why zoos should be abolished or reformed.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, not everyone agrees that zoos are beneficial for humans and animals alike. some critics argue that zoos are unethical and harmful to the animals that are kept in captivity. they claim that zoos deprive animals of their natural habitats, behaviors, and social interactions, and expose them to stress, boredom, and disease. they also point out that zoos often fail to provide adequate care, space, and enrichment for the animals, and that many zoos are involved in breeding, trading, and exploiting animals for profit or entertainment. furthermore, they question the educational value of zoos, as they do not reflect the true diversity and complexity of the animal world, and may foster false or misleading impressions of animals and their conservation needs.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, not everyone agrees with the positive views of zoos. some critics argue that zoos are unethical and harmful to animals. they claim that zoos deprive animals of their natural habitats, behaviors, and social interactions. they also point out that zoos often expose animals to stress, disease, and abuse. furthermore, they doubt that zoos can effectively conserve endangered species, as many animals bred in captivity cannot survive in the wild or face habitat loss and poaching. therefore, they suggest that zoos should be replaced by more humane alternatives, such as wildlife sanctuaries, rehabilitation centers, or conservation projects.

Context.Left: It is a completely right and extremely wise policy to focus on health education and preventative measures rather than treatment. Once applied, it will bring many benefits to both citizens and governments.
Context.Right: Preventative measures will help improve general health state of all citizens. For example, vaccines will guarantee that pregnant women and their babies are protected from serious infectious diseases such as flu, smallpox, rubella so on. When huge injection campaigns are organized throughout our country, the community's health state will be improved remarkably. As human resources play a key role in the development of a country, investing money to enhance the general health state is a totally right decision. In addition, because the cost of treatment is often much higher than that of prevention, the government can save a lot of money for our country's health budget.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain why health education is an important part of the policy.
Prompt.Prompt2: Give some examples of health education programs or activities that can promote prevention.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that summarizes the benefits of health education and prevention and introduces the next point about treatment.
Prompt.Prompt4: Contrast the advantages of prevention with the disadvantages of treatment.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Health education is an important part of the policy because it can empower citizens to make informed choices about their own health and well-being. by providing accurate and accessible information about the causes, symptoms, and prevention of various diseases and health risks, health education can raise awareness and motivate people to adopt healthy behaviors and lifestyles. for instance, health education can encourage people to practice good hygiene, avoid tobacco and alcohol, exercise regularly, and eat a balanced diet. these habits can help prevent many chronic and non-communicable diseases such as diabetes, heart disease, cancer, and obesity, which are often costly and difficult to treat. health education can also help people to recognize the signs of illness and seek timely medical attention, as well as to comply with treatment and follow-up recommendations. therefore, health education can complement and reinforce the effectiveness of preventative measures such as vaccines and screenings, and contribute to the overall improvement of the community's health state.
Outcome.Outcome2: Health education is another important aspect of prevention that can help citizens make informed choices about their health and well-being. for instance, health education programs can teach people about the benefits of regular physical activity, balanced nutrition, stress management, and avoiding tobacco, alcohol, and drugs. these programs can also raise awareness about the signs and symptoms of common chronic diseases such as diabetes, hypertension, and cancer, and encourage people to seek early diagnosis and treatment. furthermore, health education activities can promote positive behaviors such as hand washing, safe sex, and immunization, and dispel myths and misconceptions about health issues. by providing accurate and accessible information and skills, health education can empower people to take charge of their own health and prevent potential complications.
Outcome.Outcome3: Health education and prevention are not only right and wise, but also beneficial for both individuals and society. by raising awareness and providing information on healthy lifestyles, risk factors, and preventive services, health education can empower people to make informed choices and avoid unnecessary illnesses and injuries. prevention can also reduce the burden of disease and disability on the health system, as well as the economic and social costs of treatment. however, prevention is not enough to ensure the health of all citizens. there are still some situations where treatment is necessary and unavoidable. in the following paragraph, we will discuss how treatment can be improved and made more accessible and affordable.
Outcome.Outcome4: Not only is prevention beneficial for individuals and communities, but it also has clear advantages over treatment in terms of cost-effectiveness and sustainability. treatment, on the other hand, often involves expensive and complex procedures, medications, and equipment, which may not be accessible or affordable for many people, especially in low-resource settings. moreover, treatment may not always be successful or sufficient to cure or manage chronic or emerging diseases, which may require long-term care and follow-up. therefore, treatment can impose a heavy burden on the health system and the economy, as well as on the patients and their families. by contrast, prevention can reduce the incidence and severity of diseases, and thus the need for treatment, by promoting healthy behaviors, providing immunization, screening, and counseling, and addressing the social and environmental determinants of health.
Outcome.Outcome5: To implement this wise policy of focusing on health education and preventative measures, the government and the citizens should cooperate and take action. the government should provide adequate funding, infrastructure, and personnel to support health education programs and vaccination campaigns. the citizens should participate actively in learning about the importance of prevention, the risks of infectious diseases, and the benefits of immunization. they should also follow the recommendations of health professionals and authorities on how to maintain a healthy lifestyle and avoid exposure to harmful factors. by doing so, they will contribute to the improvement of their own health and the public health of the country.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the main advantages of focusing on health education and preventative measures rather than treatment is that it can reduce the burden of disease and disability on individuals, families, and society. by providing people with accurate and accessible information about how to prevent and manage common health problems, such as diabetes, hypertension, obesity, and mental disorders, health education can empower them to make informed choices and adopt healthy behaviors. moreover, by implementing effective and affordable interventions, such as immunization, screening, counseling, and sanitation, preventative measures can protect people from the risk of contracting or transmitting infectious and chronic diseases, as well as detect and treat them early before they become more severe and costly.

Context.Right: First of all, as I mentioned above students should have a right to choose what they want to study. Not allowing students their desired subjects to be chosen is a restriction of human rights. As children of independent country we should know our rights and opportunities we have in order to achieve our goals and dreams.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of students' choice of subjects and why it is important for their future.
Prompt.Prompt2: Acknowledge the possible counterarguments that some subjects are more essential or practical than others and that students may not have enough knowledge or experience to make informed choices.
Prompt.Prompt3: Refute the counterarguments by explaining how students can balance their interests and requirements, how they can develop critical thinking and creativity by exploring different fields, and how they can seek guidance from teachers, parents, or counselors if needed.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize the main points and restate the thesis that students should have a right to choose what they want to study and that this is a way of respecting their human rights and supporting their personal development.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Choosing what subjects to study is a crucial decision for students, as it can affect their interests, skills, and career prospects. by exploring different fields of knowledge, students can discover their passions and talents, and develop their critical thinking and creativity. moreover, having a choice of subjects can motivate students to learn more effectively and enjoy their education. however, not all students have the same opportunities to choose what they want to study. some may face limitations or pressures from their parents, schools, or society, which can undermine their autonomy and potential. this is why students should have a right to choose what they want to study. not allowing students their desired subjects to be chosen is a restriction of human rights. as children of independent country we should know our rights and opportunities we have in order to achieve our goals and dreams.
Outcome.Outcome2: However, some people may argue that not all subjects are equally essential or practical for students' future careers or lives, and that allowing students to choose what they want to study may result in them neglecting core skills or knowledge. they may also claim that students may not have enough knowledge or experience to make informed choices about what subjects they are interested in or suited for, and that they may regret their decisions later or miss out on valuable opportunities.
Outcome.Outcome3: Some might argue that students should not have too much freedom in choosing their subjects, because they might neglect the essential skills and knowledge they need for their future careers and lives, or because they might lack the ability to make informed and responsible decisions. however, these counterarguments are not convincing, because students can balance their interests and requirements, develop critical thinking and creativity, and seek guidance if needed. for example, students can choose some elective subjects that match their passions and talents, while also fulfilling the core requirements of their curriculum and the standards of their desired colleges or universities. by doing so, they can enrich their learning experience, discover new perspectives, and enhance their motivation and engagement. moreover, students can develop critical thinking and creativity by exploring different fields and topics, which can help them to solve problems, communicate effectively, and adapt to changing situations. students can also seek guidance from teachers, parents, or counselors if they are unsure or confused about their choices, and receive feedback and support to make the best decisions for themselves. therefore, students should have a right to choose what they want to study, as it can benefit their personal and academic development.
Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, this essay has argued that students should have a right to choose what they want to study in school. this is not only a matter of respecting their human rights, but also of supporting their personal development and aspirations. by allowing students to pursue their interests and passions, they can develop their skills, talents and potential, and contribute to the society and the economy in a positive way. therefore, it is important that the education system does not impose limitations or restrictions on students' choices, but rather provides them with opportunities and guidance to explore and learn.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, students should not be forced to study subjects that they have no interest or aptitude in, as this would only demotivate them and waste their potential. instead, they should be encouraged to pursue their passions and talents, and be provided with a variety of options and resources to help them succeed in their chosen fields. by allowing students to have a say in their education, we can foster a culture of creativity, innovation, and diversity, and prepare them for the challenges and opportunities of the 21st century.
Outcome.Outcome6: This argument for students' freedom of choice is based on the premise that education is a fundamental human right, and that each individual has the potential and the aspiration to pursue their own interests and passions. however, not everyone agrees with this view, and some might argue that there are other factors that should influence the curriculum and the selection of subjects.

Context.Left: At work, you meet people with diverse backgrounds and you are required to maintain sound relationships with many of them in order to have a pleasant work environment. However, the relationship you need to maintain with your co-worker is the most important one since he or she is the person who works very closely with you, and in most instances you have to rely on him or her. Therefore in my view, a good co-worker needs to have three most important characteristics such as cooperation, trustworthiness, and fellowship.
Context.Right: The co-workers need to trust each other. They should not act on suspicion. This is a very important aspect in the work environment. I came across a situation once such that one of my subordinates used to suspect his co-worker for carrying tales to me. To a certain extent his suspicion was valid as his co-worker made several attempts to highlight the drawbacks of him. However I never encourage tale carriers as a principle and therefore his co-worker gave up talking ill against him with me. But this mistrust continued and created very unpleasant situations for everybody in my department.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain why cooperation is a key characteristic of a good co-worker and provide an example from your own experience.
Prompt.Prompt2: Elaborate on the benefits of cooperation in terms of productivity, quality, and morale.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from cooperation to trustworthiness smooth. You can use a contrastive or a causal connector to show the relationship between the two characteristics.
Prompt.Prompt4: Give a specific instance of how trustworthiness helped you or someone you know to achieve a work-related goal or overcome a challenge.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the most important characteristics of a good co-worker is cooperation. this means that he or she is willing to share ideas, resources, and responsibilities with others in order to achieve a common goal. a cooperative co-worker also respects the opinions and abilities of others and does not try to dominate or undermine them. cooperation is essential for creating a harmonious and productive work environment. for example, when i worked on a project with a team of four co-workers, we divided the tasks according to our strengths and interests, and we communicated regularly to update each other on our progress and challenges. we also helped each other whenever we faced difficulties or needed feedback. as a result, we completed the project on time and with high quality, and we received positive feedback from our supervisor and clients.
Outcome.Outcome2: Cooperation is one of the essential characteristics of a good co-worker, as it enables the team to work efficiently and effectively towards a common goal. when co-workers cooperate, they share their skills, knowledge, and resources, and they support each other in overcoming challenges and solving problems. cooperation also enhances the quality of the work, as co-workers can provide constructive feedback, improve their performance, and avoid errors and conflicts. moreover, cooperation boosts the morale of the co-workers, as they feel valued, respected, and appreciated by their peers, and they enjoy a positive and harmonious work atmosphere.
Outcome.Outcome3: Cooperation is essential for a good co-worker, but it is not enough. cooperation alone cannot ensure a harmonious and productive work relationship if there is no trust between co-workers. trust is another vital characteristic that a good co-worker needs to have, because it affects the communication, the morale, and the performance of the team. a co-worker who is trustworthy is honest, reliable, and respectful of others. he or she does not spread rumors, sabotage, or compete unfairly with his or her colleagues. a trustworthy co-worker also respects the privacy and the confidentiality of others, and does not misuse or abuse the information or the resources that are shared with him or her. trust builds confidence, loyalty, and mutual support among co-workers, and prevents conflicts and misunderstandings. a lack of trust, on the other hand, can lead to serious problems and damages in the work environment, as the following example illustrates.
Outcome.Outcome4: One of the most important characteristics of a good co-worker is trustworthiness, which means being honest, reliable, and loyal to the team and the organization. trustworthiness can help co-workers to collaborate effectively, avoid conflicts, and achieve their goals. for example, when i worked as a project manager for a software company, i had a co-worker who was very trustworthy. he always delivered his tasks on time, communicated clearly, and supported me whenever i needed his help. he never tried to undermine me or take credit for my work. because of his trustworthiness, i could rely on him and delegate some of the responsibilities to him. this enabled me to focus on the strategic aspects of the project and ensure its quality and success. he also earned the respect and appreciation of our clients and senior managers. his trustworthiness was a valuable asset for our project and our work environment.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the characteristics of a good co-worker that i mentioned is trustworthiness. this means that a good co-worker should be honest, reliable, and loyal to his or her team members. he or she should not spread false or malicious information, sabotage the work of others, or take credit for someone else's achievements. trustworthiness is essential for building a strong and productive team that can work together effectively and harmoniously. a lack of trustworthiness can cause conflicts, resentment, and mistrust among co-workers, which can damage the work environment and the quality of the work. i have witnessed how mistrust can create problems in my own department, as i will illustrate with an example.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the characteristics that i mentioned for a good co-worker is trustworthiness. this means that a good co-worker should be honest, reliable, and loyal to his or her colleagues and not try to undermine them or take credit for their work. trustworthiness is essential for building a strong and productive team that can achieve the goals of the organization. a lack of trust, on the other hand, can lead to conflict, resentment, and poor performance. i have witnessed how distrust can affect the work environment negatively in my own experience.

Context.Right: Firstly, an increase in the number of automobiles brings about environmental pollution. Since automobile exhaust and carbon dioxides emission have bad impacts on the air, the air gets to be polluted and it causes respiratory disease of the local inhabitants. Therefore, it is crucial to alter automobiles to the other means of transportation and to legislate to control automobiles.

Prompt.Prompt1: Determine the topic of the essay based on the left and right texts.
Prompt.Prompt2: Write an introductory paragraph that introduces the topic and states the main argument or thesis of the essay.
Prompt.Prompt3: Use a transition word or phrase to connect the introductory paragraph to the left text, which is the first body paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt4: In the left text, provide some evidence or examples to support the claim that automobiles cause environmental pollution and health problems.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: However, environmental pollution is not the only problem caused by automobiles. another serious issue is the traffic congestion that affects many urban areas around the world. traffic congestion not only wastes time and fuel, but also increases the stress and frustration of the drivers and passengers. moreover, traffic accidents are more likely to occur in crowded and chaotic roads, resulting in injuries and deaths. therefore, besides changing the vehicles, it is also important to improve the public transportation system and to encourage people to use it more often. additionally, some measures such as road pricing, carpooling, and bicycle lanes could also help to reduce the traffic volume and to promote a more sustainable and healthy lifestyle.
Outcome.Outcome2: The development of modern transportation has brought many benefits to people's lives, such as convenience, mobility, and accessibility. however, it also has some negative consequences, especially for the environment and human health. one of the most serious problems is the overuse and dependence on automobiles, which have various harmful effects on the natural and social systems. in this essay, i will argue that it is necessary to reduce the number of automobiles and promote alternative modes of transportation, as well as to enact laws and regulations to limit their environmental damage. firstly, an increase in the number of automobiles brings about environmental pollution. since automobile exhaust and carbon dioxide emissions have bad impacts on the air, the air gets to be polluted and it causes respiratory disease of the local inhabitants. therefore, it is crucial to alter automobiles to the other means of transportation and to legislate to control automobiles.
Outcome.Outcome3: As the world population grows and urbanization expands, more and more people rely on automobiles for their daily transportation. however, this trend has some serious drawbacks for the environment and human health. in this essay, i will discuss two major problems caused by the excessive use of automobiles and suggest some possible solutions. firstly, an increase in the number of automobiles brings about environmental pollution. since automobile exhaust and carbon dioxides emission have bad impacts on the air, the air gets to be polluted and it causes respiratory disease of the local inhabitants. therefore, it is crucial to alter automobiles to the other means of transportation and to legislate to control automobiles.
Outcome.Outcome4: One of the main drawbacks of the increasing number of automobiles is the environmental pollution they cause. automobiles emit harmful substances such as nitrogen oxides, particulate matter, and greenhouse gases, which contribute to smog, acid rain, and climate change. these pollutants not only degrade the natural environment, but also affect the health of the people who breathe them. studies have shown that exposure to high levels of air pollution from automobiles can increase the risk of lung cancer, asthma, heart disease, and premature death. therefore, it is crucial to alter automobiles to the other means of transportation and to legislate to control automobiles.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the negative effects of urbanization is the growth of traffic congestion and the use of private vehicles. firstly, an increase in the number of automobiles brings about environmental pollution. since automobile exhaust and carbon dioxides emission have bad impacts on the air, the air gets to be polluted and it causes respiratory disease of the local inhabitants. therefore, it is crucial to alter automobiles to the other means of transportation and to legislate to control automobiles. secondly, traffic congestion also wastes time and energy of the drivers and passengers, as well as increases the risk of accidents and road rage. moreover, traffic congestion affects the economic efficiency and productivity of the urban areas, as it delays the delivery of goods and services, and reduces the accessibility and mobility of the workers and consumers. hence, it is necessary to improve the public transportation system and to encourage the use of alternative modes of travel, such as walking, cycling, or carpooling.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the alternative means of transportation that can reduce the environmental pollution caused by automobiles is public transit. public transit, such as buses, trains, and subways, can carry more passengers with less fuel consumption and emission than individual cars. moreover, public transit can ease traffic congestion and save travel time and cost for commuters. hence, public transit is a more sustainable and efficient way of moving people around the city. however, to promote the use of public transit, it is necessary to provide adequate infrastructure, service, and incentives for the potential users.

Context.Left: The issue at hand is if the schools should require students to take regular standardized exams. This issue is important because nowadays many people cast doubt on it. However, I believe that standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.
Context.Right: Additionally, standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice. Since, some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard, so they will never try to solve problems on their own. However, standardized tests offer them such chance. Thus, it is clear that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain why many people cast doubt on standardized tests and how you disagree with them.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some evidence or examples of how standardized tests help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.
Prompt.Prompt3: Discuss some of the skills or abilities that standardized tests can measure and why they are important for students' future.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize your main points and restate your thesis in a different way.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Many people cast doubt on standardized tests because they think that they are unfair, stressful, and narrow the curriculum. they argue that standardized tests do not measure the true abilities and potential of students, but rather their ability to memorize facts and follow instructions. they also claim that standardized tests put too much pressure on students and teachers, who have to prepare for them and meet certain benchmarks. moreover, they worry that standardized tests force teachers to teach to the test, leaving out important topics and skills that are not covered by the exams. however, i disagree with these criticisms and i think that standardized tests have many benefits for the educational system. standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge.
Outcome.Outcome2: One way that standardized tests help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge is by providing them with reliable and comparable data on the students' performance. teachers can use the test results to identify the strengths and weaknesses of their students, as well as the areas that need more attention or improvement. for example, if a teacher notices that many students are struggling with a certain topic or skill, they can adjust their instruction or provide extra support accordingly. standardized tests can also help teachers to evaluate the effectiveness of their curriculum and teaching methods, and to align them with the state or national standards and expectations. by using standardized tests as a tool for feedback and improvement, teachers can enhance the quality of education and ensure that all students have equal opportunities to learn.
Outcome.Outcome3: Standardized tests are not only useful for assessing students' knowledge, but also for measuring some of the skills or abilities that are essential for their future. for example, standardized tests can evaluate students' critical thinking, problem-solving, reasoning, and communication skills, which are in high demand in the modern world. by taking standardized tests, students can demonstrate their ability to analyze, synthesize, apply, and communicate information in different contexts and formats. these skills can help students to cope with various challenges and opportunities in their academic, professional, and personal lives. therefore, standardized tests can be seen as a valuable tool for preparing students for the future.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, standardized tests are beneficial for the educational system and the students, as they provide a reliable way to measure learning outcomes and encourage critical thinking skills. by taking regular standardized exams, students can demonstrate their mastery of the curriculum and challenge themselves to solve problems independently. therefore, i strongly support the idea that schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as they are fair, valid, and aligned with the learning objectives.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the main reasons why i support standardized tests is that they can help teachers to assess the students' progress and identify their strengths and weaknesses. by using the results of these exams, teachers can adjust their teaching methods and provide feedback and support to the students who need it most. moreover, teachers can also use standardized tests to evaluate the effectiveness of their curriculum and instruction, and to compare the performance of their students with other schools or districts. therefore, standardized tests can be a useful tool for improving the quality of education and ensuring that all students have equal opportunities to learn.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the main benefits of standardized tests is that they can provide useful feedback for teachers and students. by analyzing the test results, teachers can identify the strengths and weaknesses of their students, as well as the effectiveness of their teaching methods. they can then adjust their instruction accordingly, or provide extra support or enrichment for students who need it. students, on the other hand, can also learn from their mistakes and improve their skills and knowledge. furthermore, standardized tests can motivate students to study harder and prepare well for the exams.

Context.Left: In fact, stringent gun control does not decrease violence and crime because most gun violence is committed with guns obtained illegally. People who are intent to commit crime and control cities through gang violence and other means will find a way to continue to use guns, regardless of gun control.
Context.Right: All in all, it is obvious that there is a poor relationship between polices carrying guns and an increasing violence rate. On the other hand, criminal mind seems to be more related to violence. Consequently, we should pay more attention to adjust people's behaviors in order to reduce crimes instead of gun control.

Prompt.Prompt1: Define what you mean by stringent gun control and why it is a controversial issue in some countries.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some evidence or examples of how most gun violence is committed with guns obtained illegally.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain how gun control might affect law-abiding citizens who use guns for self-defense or recreation.
Prompt.Prompt4: Compare and contrast the situations of police carrying guns in different countries and how it affects the violence rate.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the most debated issues in some countries is whether stringent gun control, which refers to strict laws and regulations that limit the access, ownership, and use of firearms, can effectively reduce violence and crime. some proponents of gun control argue that by restricting the availability of guns, especially for civilians, the risk of accidental shootings, suicides, homicides, and mass shootings would be lower. however, others contend that this approach is ineffective and infringes on the rights and freedoms of law-abiding citizens.
Outcome.Outcome2: One way to illustrate how most gun violence is committed with guns obtained illegally is to look at the statistics of gun trafficking and theft. according to the bureau of alcohol, tobacco, firearms and explosives (atf), in 2019, more than 23,000 firearms were reported lost or stolen from licensed dealers, while more than 420,000 firearms were reported lost or stolen from private owners. moreover, a study by the university of pittsburgh found that nearly 80% of guns used in crimes in pittsburgh in 2008 were not owned by the perpetrators, but were obtained through straw purchases, illegal transfers, or theft. these findings suggest that gun control laws that target legal gun owners and dealers are unlikely to prevent criminals from accessing firearms. all in all, it is obvious that there is a poor relationship between polices carrying guns and an increasing violence rate. on the other hand, criminal mind seems to be more related to violence. consequently, we should pay more attention to adjust people's behaviors in order to reduce crimes instead of gun control.
Outcome.Outcome3: In fact, stringent gun control does not decrease violence and crime because most gun violence is committed with guns obtained illegally. people who are intent to commit crime and control cities through gang violence and other means will find a way to continue to use guns, regardless of gun control. moreover, gun control might also have negative consequences for law-abiding citizens who use guns for self-defense or recreation. they might face difficulties in acquiring or keeping firearms that could protect them from potential threats or enhance their enjoyment of hunting or shooting sports. gun control might also infringe on their constitutional rights and liberties, as well as their sense of personal responsibility and empowerment. all in all, it is obvious that there is a poor relationship between polices carrying guns and an increasing violence rate. on the other hand, criminal mind seems to be more related to violence. consequently, we should pay more attention to adjust people's behaviors in order to reduce crimes instead of gun control.
Outcome.Outcome4: Both texts argue that gun control is not an effective way to reduce violence and crime, but they focus on different aspects of the issue. the left text claims that most gun violence is committed with guns obtained illegally, so stricter regulations would not deter criminals and gangs who can access the black market. the right text, however, examines the role of police carrying guns and how it influences the violence rate in different countries. it suggests that there is no clear correlation between the presence of armed police and the level of violence, and that other factors, such as the criminal mind, are more relevant. therefore, both texts propose that the solution to violence and crime lies in changing people's behaviors, rather than in restricting gun ownership.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, some might argue that gun control is not the only factor that influences violence and crime rates. they might point out that the presence or absence of armed police officers also affects the level of security and deterrence in a society. for example, some countries, such as the united kingdom, have largely unarmed police forces, yet they have lower homicide rates than the united states, which has a heavily armed police force. therefore, they might suggest that the main cause of violence and crime is not the availability of guns, but the criminal mindset of some individuals or groups.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, the argument that gun control can prevent violence and crime by restricting the access of law-abiding citizens to firearms is flawed and unsupported by evidence. rather than focusing on the tools of violence, policymakers and society should address the root causes of criminal behavior and the social and economic factors that fuel gang activity and illegal gun trafficking. the following passage will examine the case of some countries that have strict gun control laws but still suffer from high rates of violence.

Context.Right: Firstly, by paying taxes for public school, affluent people effectively contribute to narrowing down the gap between rich and poor. It is true that many poor families are not able to afford tuition fees for their kids to attend a course. With the the tax amount for which they pay, the rich may help a vast number of students from families with poverty background to continue their studies, and earn a better quality of life.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of why affluent people should pay taxes for public school in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some statistics or evidence to support the claim that paying taxes for public school helps to narrow down the gap between rich and poor.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that summarizes the benefits of paying taxes for public school and introduces the counterargument of why some affluent people may oppose it.
Prompt.Prompt4: Refute the counterargument by showing the flaws or limitations of their reasoning and restate the main thesis of the essay.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Many people argue that affluent people should pay taxes for public school, even if they do not send their own children to these institutions. they claim that this is not only a matter of social responsibility, but also a way of promoting social justice and economic development. in this essay, i will examine two main reasons why paying taxes for public school is beneficial for both the rich and the poor. firstly, by paying taxes for public school, affluent people effectively contribute to narrowing down the gap between rich and poor. it is true that many poor families are not able to afford tuition fees for their kids to attend a course. with the tax amount for which they pay, the rich may help a vast number of students from families with poverty background to continue their studies, and earn a better quality of life.
Outcome.Outcome2: This claim is not merely based on an idealistic assumption, but also supported by empirical data. according to a study by the national center for education statistics, public schools in the united states serve more than 50 million students, of whom about 20 million are from low-income families. these students benefit from free or reduced-price lunch programs, title i funding, and other federal and state grants that are partly funded by taxes. moreover, the study also found that public schools tend to have more diverse student bodies and offer more opportunities for academic and extracurricular enrichment than private schools. therefore, by paying taxes for public school, affluent people not only contribute to the public good, but also help to create a more equitable and inclusive society.
Outcome.Outcome3: Paying taxes for public school, therefore, can be seen as a way of promoting social justice and enhancing the human capital of the nation. by supporting the education of the less privileged, affluent people not only fulfill their civic duty, but also foster a more diverse and productive society. however, not all wealthy individuals agree with this view. some may argue that they have the right to choose how to spend their money and that they should not be forced to subsidize a system that does not benefit them or their children. they may also question the quality and efficiency of public education and prefer to opt for private or alternative options. in the following paragraphs, we will examine the validity and implications of these objections.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, this argument is flawed for several reasons. first, paying taxes for public school does not guarantee that the quality of education will be equally high for all students, regardless of their socio-economic status. in fact, many public schools are underfunded, overcrowded, and lack qualified teachers and resources, especially in low-income areas. therefore, the gap between rich and poor may widen rather than narrow, as the affluent can still choose to send their children to private schools or supplement their education with extra-curricular activities and tutoring. second, paying taxes for public school does not address the root causes of poverty, such as unemployment, discrimination, lack of access to health care, and social injustice. these factors affect not only the academic performance of students, but also their well-being, motivation, and opportunities for the future. therefore, paying taxes for public school is not enough to ensure that all children have a fair chance to succeed and improve their quality of life. third, paying taxes for public school may not reflect the preferences and values of the taxpayers themselves. some people may prefer to support other causes or organizations that align with their beliefs or interests, rather than being forced to fund a system that they do not agree with or benefit from. for example, some people may oppose the curriculum, the teaching methods, or the policies of public schools, and may want to have more control over their children's education. therefore, paying taxes for public school may infringe on the freedom and autonomy of the taxpayers. in conclusion, paying taxes for public school is not a sufficient or effective way to narrow down the gap between rich and poor. instead, the government should adopt more comprehensive and targeted measures to address the underlying issues of poverty and inequality, and to provide equal opportunities and quality education for all students. the main thesis of this essay is that affluent people should not be obliged to pay taxes for public school, as it is unfair, inefficient, and counterproductive.
Outcome.Outcome5: Public education is often seen as a way to promote social justice and equality of opportunity for all citizens. however, some people may argue that affluent people should not have to pay taxes for public schools that they do not use, and that they should have the freedom to choose private education for their children. in this essay, i will counter this argument by showing how paying taxes for public schools benefits both the rich and the poor in society. firstly, by paying taxes for public school, affluent people effectively contribute to narrowing down the gap between rich and poor. it is true that many poor families are not able to afford tuition fees for their kids to attend a course. with the the tax amount for which they pay, the rich may help a vast number of students from families with poverty background to continue their studies, and earn a better quality of life. secondly, by supporting public education, affluent people also benefit from a more educated and skilled workforce, which can enhance the productivity and competitiveness of the economy. a well-educated population can also foster innovation, creativity, and social cohesion, which are essential for a democratic and prosperous society. therefore, paying taxes for public schools is not only a moral obligation, but also a smart investment for the rich.
Outcome.Outcome6: For the affluent, paying taxes for public school can enhance their social responsibility and reputation, as well as reduce the potential risks of social unrest and crime caused by inequality and resentment. for the poor, receiving free or subsidized education can empower them to acquire knowledge and skills, improve their employability and income, and break the cycle of poverty and dependence.

Context.Left: In addition, sculptures and paintings in the museums and art galleries generally reflect the culture and civilization of every generation. Therefore, culture and history of a country can be reserved and assured by art. Young people are also able to get more knowledge about their country's history and culture by observing various work crafts.
Context.Right: To sum up, art is a very valuable object for every country and the talent in this area cannot be discovered everywhere, so I think governments should help and encourage artists to continue their work.

Prompt.Prompt1: Add a topic sentence that introduces the main idea of the paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples of how art reflects the culture and civilization of every generation.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain why preserving and learning about the history and culture of a country is important for young people.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize the main points of the paragraph and restate the topic sentence in a different way.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Art is not only a source of beauty and inspiration, but also a way of preserving and transmitting the cultural and historical heritage of a nation. in addition, sculptures and paintings in the museums and art galleries generally reflect the culture and civilization of every generation. therefore, culture and history of a country can be reserved and assured by art. young people are also able to get more knowledge about their country's history and culture by observing various work crafts. for these reasons, art deserves the support and recognition of governments, who should help and encourage artists to continue their work. to sum up, art is a very valuable object for every country and the talent in this area cannot be discovered everywhere, so i think governments should help and encourage artists to continue their work.
Outcome.Outcome2: Art reflects the culture and civilization of every generation in various ways. for example, the ancient egyptian pyramids and hieroglyphs show the religious beliefs and social organization of that civilization. the renaissance paintings and sculptures reveal the humanistic values and artistic innovations of that period. the modern and contemporary art movements express the diverse perspectives and challenges of the 20th and 21st centuries. by observing these different forms of art, young people can learn more about the historical and cultural contexts of their country and the world.
Outcome.Outcome3: Preserving and learning about the history and culture of a country is important for young people because it helps them to understand their identity, heritage, and values. by appreciating the artistic expressions of their ancestors and contemporaries, they can gain insight into the social, political, and spiritual aspects of their nation. they can also develop their own creativity, critical thinking, and aesthetic sense by engaging with different forms of art. moreover, they can foster a sense of respect and appreciation for the diversity and richness of other cultures and civilizations.
Outcome.Outcome4: As the paragraph has discussed, art plays a vital role in preserving and promoting the cultural and historical heritage of a nation. by creating and displaying various forms of art, artists can express their ideas, emotions, and values, as well as educate and inspire the younger generations. art also enriches the quality of life and enhances the diversity and creativity of society. therefore, the paragraph argues that governments should support and foster the development of art and artists.
Outcome.Outcome5: Art not only preserves and reflects the culture and history of a country, but also inspires and educates young people. by supporting and encouraging artists, governments can foster the development and appreciation of art among the current and future generations. artists can also contribute to the social and economic well-being of a country by creating works that attract tourists, boost the creative industries, and promote cultural diversity and dialogue. therefore, art is a worthwhile investment for any government that values its heritage and identity.
Outcome.Outcome6: Art not only preserves and reflects the past, but also inspires and enriches the present. by supporting and recognizing artists, governments can foster creativity, diversity, and innovation in their societies. artists can also contribute to the social and economic development of their countries by creating jobs, attracting tourists, and enhancing the quality of life.

Comment.Comment1: Contains info from the left and right

Context.Left: There are different reasons which persuade that people should not restore old buildings. As a result of the rapid urbanization process, in which rural people must go to urban centers to look for job opportunities, the question of the preservation of old buildings has become more pressing. Because of that need, governments can construct more accommodation instead of preserving old buildings. Besides that, the preservation is very expensive because all components of old buildings have historical values.
Context.Right: Overall, both of those view have strong arguments: the need for housing or the expense of restoration contrast with our desire to conserve culture and attract tourism. So I think we should restore those building because old buildings process the most outstanding feature of areas which contain them.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of whether old buildings should be restored or not in the first sentence.
Prompt.Prompt2: Acknowledge the opposing view that old buildings have historical and cultural values in the second sentence.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain why you disagree with this view and what are the drawbacks of restoring old buildings in the third and fourth sentences.
Prompt.Prompt4: Summarize your main argument and give a reason why it is more important than the opposing view in the last sentence.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the controversial issues in urban planning is whether old buildings should be restored or not. on the one hand, some people argue that old buildings are obstacles to the development and modernization of cities, and that they should be replaced by new and more efficient structures. on the other hand, some people claim that old buildings are valuable cultural and historical assets, and that they should be preserved and protected. the left text presents some of the reasons that support the former view, while the right text summarizes some of the arguments that favor the latter view.
Outcome.Outcome2: There are different reasons which persuade that people should not restore old buildings. as a result of the rapid urbanization process, in which rural people must go to urban centers to look for job opportunities, the question of the preservation of old buildings has become more pressing. however, some people may argue that old buildings have historical and cultural values that should not be lost or damaged. they may claim that old buildings reflect the identity and heritage of a place and that they can attract tourists and generate income. overall, both of those view have strong arguments: the need for housing or the expense of restoration contrast with our desire to conserve culture and attract tourism. so i think we should restore those building because old buildings process the most outstanding feature of areas which contain them.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, i disagree with this view that people should not restore old buildings. first of all, restoring old buildings does not necessarily mean sacrificing the development of new housing, as there are other ways to address the urbanization problem, such as improving public transportation, promoting rural development, and encouraging mixed-use development. second, restoring old buildings is not only a matter of cost, but also a matter of cultural heritage, environmental sustainability, and economic benefit. old buildings reflect the history, identity, and diversity of a place, and they can be reused for various purposes, such as museums, galleries, hotels, or offices. moreover, old buildings can reduce the environmental impact of construction, as they save energy and materials, and they can attract tourists and investors, who appreciate the unique and authentic character of a place.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, not everyone agrees that old buildings should be demolished or neglected. some people argue that old buildings have cultural, historical, and aesthetic significance that cannot be replaced by modern structures. they claim that old buildings reflect the identity, diversity, and heritage of a place and its people, and that they can also attract tourists and generate income. moreover, they contend that restoring old buildings can be a sustainable and creative way of using existing resources and enhancing the quality of life in urban areas.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, not everyone agrees that old buildings should be demolished or neglected to make room for new development. some people argue that old buildings have cultural and historical significance that cannot be replaced by modern structures. they also claim that old buildings can attract tourists and generate income for the local economy. moreover, they suggest that old buildings can be adapted or renovated to meet contemporary needs and standards, without losing their original charm and character.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, not everyone agrees with the idea of demolishing old buildings to make room for new ones. some people argue that old buildings are valuable cultural assets that reflect the history and identity of a place. they claim that old buildings can attract tourists, generate income, and enhance the quality of life for the residents. moreover, they suggest that old buildings can be adapted or renovated to meet modern standards and needs, without losing their original charm and character.

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the experiences that changed the way i think and improved my life was learning how to solve problems effectively. for example, when i faced a difficult assignment at school, i did not give up or panic. instead, i used some strategies that i learned from books and teachers, such as breaking down the task into smaller steps, asking for help when needed, and checking my work for errors. by doing this, i was able to complete the assignment successfully and get a good grade. this experience boosted my confidence and motivated me to keep learning and improving. solving problems also helped me to develop critical thinking and creativity skills, which are useful for many aspects of life.
Outcome.Outcome2: Another way that some experiences changed the way i think is by teaching me how to take care of myself. besides developing my problem-solving skills, i also learned the importance of maintaining a healthy lifestyle. i realized that my well-being depends not only on how i cope with challenges, but also on what i eat and how i exercise. therefore, i started to pay more attention to the information and advice that i encountered about choosing a good diet.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the experiences that changed the way i think is reading and listening to the news about choosing a good diet. i learned that eating nutritious and balanced food can prevent many diseases and improve my physical and mental well-being. according to the world health organization, a healthy diet can reduce the risk of obesity, diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, and some cancers. by being informed and educated about the benefits of different food groups and the harms of processed and junk food, i can make better choices when i shop and cook. reading and listening to the news also help me to stay updated on the latest research and recommendations on nutrition and health. therefore, this experience improved my life by enhancing my knowledge and awareness of my health.
Outcome.Outcome4: Many circumstances that i experienced change the way i think. there are many experiences that are improve my life in many ways. for example, i could improve the way that i solve problems, improve how i take care of my health, and improve to plan my life for future. i will give reasons to support my opinion. one of the experiences that changed my thinking was learning how to solve problems. for instance, when i faced a difficult challenge at school or work, i learned to analyze the situation, find the root cause, and come up with possible solutions. this helped me to overcome obstacles and achieve my goals. thus, i became more confident and creative in dealing with different situations. in addition, some experiences could teach me the way to take care of myself. for instance, reading and listening to the news about choosing a good diet are the way to keep myself more healthy. thus, i always buy quality food such as organic food. this food does not have chemicals. so that, i can have a good health. this experience taught me to be aware of my health.

Context.Right: The first reason why education and preventative measures should receive a greater budget is the potential improvements in health system. I believe that decreasing the number of patients in the health system can lead hospitals and healthcare centers to be managed effectively which will result in better treatments for current patients. Therefore, society should be educated and became aware of health issues so that the potential precautions on the way of illnesses can be taken instead of trying to provide treatment for the increasing number of patients.

Prompt.Prompt1: Define what education and preventative measures mean in the context of health system.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples of how education and preventative measures can decrease the number of patients in the health system.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain how better treatments for current patients can benefit the society as a whole.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add a connecting paragraph that summarizes the main argument and links it to the next paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Education and preventative measures are two important aspects of the health system that aim to reduce the risk of diseases and promote healthy behaviors among the population. education refers to the process of providing information, skills, and motivation to individuals and groups on how to prevent and manage health problems, such as chronic diseases, infectious diseases, mental health, and substance abuse. preventative measures refer to the actions and interventions that are implemented before the onset of a disease or injury, such as immunization, screening, counseling, and environmental protection. these measures can help to avoid or delay the need for treatment and reduce the burden on the health system. the first reason why education and preventative measures should receive a greater budget is the potential improvements in health system. i believe that decreasing the number of patients in the health system can lead hospitals and healthcare centers to be managed effectively which will result in better treatments for current patients. therefore, society should be educated and became aware of health issues so that the potential precautions on the way of illnesses can be taken instead of trying to provide treatment for the increasing number of patients.
Outcome.Outcome2: One way that education and preventative measures can decrease the number of patients in the health system is by promoting healthy lifestyles and behaviors that can prevent chronic diseases such as diabetes, heart disease, and cancer. for example, educating people about the benefits of regular physical activity, balanced nutrition, and avoiding tobacco and alcohol can help them reduce the risk of developing these conditions and the complications that may arise from them. another way is by increasing the awareness and access to preventive services such as screenings, vaccinations, and counseling that can detect and prevent potential health problems before they become serious or costly. for example, educating people about the importance of getting regular check-ups, mammograms, pap smears, and immunizations can help them prevent or treat infections, cancers, and other diseases that may require hospitalization or surgery. by educating and preventing health issues, the number of patients in the health system can be reduced, which can lead to better management and treatment for those who need it.
Outcome.Outcome3: By reducing the number of patients in the health system, hospitals and healthcare centers can offer better treatments for those who need them. this can benefit the society as a whole in several ways. for example, better treatments can reduce the mortality and morbidity rates of diseases, which can improve the quality of life and productivity of the population. moreover, better treatments can also lower the costs of healthcare, which can free up resources for other social and economic needs. furthermore, better treatments can enhance the trust and satisfaction of the public in the health system, which can foster a sense of social cohesion and responsibility. therefore, investing in education and preventative measures can have positive impacts on the health outcomes and well-being of the society.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, i have argued that education and preventative measures should receive a greater budget than treatment because they can improve the health system by reducing the number of patients. this can benefit both the current and the future patients by providing them with better and more efficient care. however, this is not the only advantage of investing more in education and prevention. in the next paragraph, i will discuss another reason why this approach can have positive impacts on society and the economy.
Outcome.Outcome5: Moreover, education and preventative measures can also have positive impacts on the economy and the environment. by reducing the burden of diseases and health costs, society can allocate more resources to other productive sectors and improve the living standards of the population. additionally, by promoting healthy lifestyles and behaviors, such as physical activity, nutrition, and hygiene, education and preventative measures can help prevent environmental degradation and pollution caused by excessive consumption and waste. thus, investing in education and preventative measures can benefit not only the health system, but also the overall well-being and sustainability of the society.
Outcome.Outcome6: To support this argument, i will present some evidence that shows how education and preventative measures can reduce the burden on the health system and improve the quality of care for patients. for example, according to the world health organization, chronic diseases such as diabetes, cardiovascular diseases, and cancer are responsible for 60% of all deaths worldwide and account for 80% of the health expenditure in low- and middle-income countries. however, many of these diseases can be prevented or delayed by adopting healthy behaviors such as avoiding tobacco, alcohol, and unhealthy diets, and engaging in physical activity. therefore, investing in health education and promotion programs can help people to adopt these behaviors and prevent or reduce the risk of developing chronic diseases, which in turn can save resources and improve outcomes for the health system.

Context.Left: Nowadays, the use of advertisement through different forms of media such as newspapers, radio and television has become very prevalent, so it is thought to be a necessary part of today's society. Many believe that advertising has brought great benefits to lives therefore it should be considered a positive activity while others have held a complete different idea about this. Both views will be critiqued before a reasonable conclusion is drawn.
