Outcome.Outcome1: By preventing diseases that are avoidable or manageable, people can not only save money on medical bills, but also improve their quality of life. for example, staying fit and active can reduce the risk of obesity, diabetes, heart disease and other chronic conditions that can impair physical and mental health. moreover, avoiding or treating myopia can prevent vision loss and enhance one's ability to work, study and enjoy life. therefore, preventing diseases can benefit both individuals and society, as they can increase productivity, happiness and well-being.
Outcome.Outcome2: In addition, it will be of economic benefit to pre-empt certain kinds of diseases. needless to say, such unpreventable illnesses as cancer or hiv will cost the victim a fortune, not to cure, but to lengthen his longevity for 1 or 2 more years. on the other hand, many common and chronic diseases can be avoided or reduced by adopting healthy lifestyles and habits. for instance, cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, hypertension, and stroke can be prevented by maintaining a balanced diet, exercising regularly, and avoiding smoking and excessive alcohol consumption. similarly, if humans tend to keep fit more regularly by participating in outdoor activities or using health-care product, obesity, myopia or other diseases that require expensive treatments will never stand a chance. therefore, investing in one's health and well-being can save a lot of money and suffering in the long run.
Outcome.Outcome3: The benefits of preventing diseases are not only personal, but also social and environmental. according to the world health organization, the global cost of chronic diseases, such as diabetes, cardiovascular diseases and cancer, is projected to reach $47 trillion by 2030, which is equivalent to 4% of the world's gross domestic product. these diseases also contribute to the depletion of natural resources, pollution and climate change, as they increase the demand for energy, water, food and medical waste. therefore, by adopting healthy lifestyles and habits, such as exercising, eating well, avoiding tobacco and alcohol, and using preventive health-care products, humans can not only reduce their risk of developing these costly and debilitating conditions, but also save money and resources for themselves and the society.
Outcome.Outcome4: One of the reasons why people should pay more attention to their health is that their behavior and decision making are influenced by various factors, such as social norms, personal beliefs, emotions, and cognitive biases. these factors can affect how people perceive and evaluate health risks, how they seek and process health information, how they cope with stress and uncertainty, and how they choose among different health options. for example, some people may underestimate the likelihood of getting sick or the severity of the consequences, while others may overestimate their ability to control or prevent diseases. some people may follow the health advice of their peers or celebrities, while others may distrust or ignore the scientific evidence. some people may be motivated by positive emotions, such as hope or satisfaction, while others may be driven by negative emotions, such as fear or guilt. some people may rely on intuitive judgments, such as heuristics or stereotypes, while others may use more rational and analytical reasoning. these factors can have both beneficial and harmful effects on people's health outcomes, depending on the context and the situation. in addition, it will be of economic benefit to pre-empt certain kinds of diseases. needless to say, such unpreventable illnesses as cancer or hiv will cost the victim a fortune, not to cure, but to lengthen his longevity for 1 or 2 more years. similarly, if humans tend to keep fit more regularly by participating in outdoor activities or using health-care product, obesity, myopia or other diseases that require expensive treatments will never stand a chance.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, preventing diseases is not only a moral duty for individuals, but also a wise choice for society. by avoiding the risk factors that cause many common and chronic illnesses, people can enjoy a higher quality of life and reduce the burden on the health-care system. in addition, it will be of economic benefit to pre-empt certain kinds of diseases. needless to say, such unpreventable illnesses as cancer or hiv will cost the victim a fortune, not to cure, but to lengthen his longevity for 1 or 2 more years. similarly, if humans tend to keep fit more regularly by participating in outdoor activities or using health-care product, obesity, myopia or other diseases that require expensive treatments will never stand a chance. thus, prevention is better than cure in both ethical and practical terms.
Outcome.Outcome6: In addition, it will be of economic benefit to pre-empt certain kinds of diseases. needless to say, such unpreventable illnesses as cancer or hiv will cost the victim a fortune, not to cure, but to lengthen his longevity for 1 or 2 more years. therefore, it is wise to invest in preventive measures that can reduce the risk of contracting these fatal conditions. for example, by avoiding smoking, excessive drinking, or exposure to harmful substances, one can lower the chances of developing cancer or hiv. similarly, if humans tend to keep fit more regularly by participating in outdoor activities or using health-care products, obesity, myopia or other diseases that require expensive treatments will never stand a chance. these habits can not only improve one's physical well-being, but also save a lot of money that would otherwise be spent on medical bills, surgeries, or drugs. thus, prevention is better than cure, both for one's health and wealth.

Outcome.Outcome1: However, the benefits of hiring young workers are not only for the company itself, but also for the society as a whole. in the current situation of global economic uncertainty and instability, many young people are facing difficulties in finding a decent and stable job. this not only affects their personal well-being and development, but also poses a serious challenge to the social cohesion and harmony. therefore, the businesses have a moral obligation and a strategic interest to provide more opportunities and support for the young generation.
Outcome.Outcome2: Hiring more workers, especially the young and creative ones, can help the businesses cope with the economic crisis and financial recession in several ways. first of all, by employing more people, the businesses can stimulate the demand and consumption in the market, which can boost the economic growth and recovery. secondly, by having a diverse and dynamic workforce, the businesses can enhance their competitiveness and innovation, which can help them adapt to the changing needs and challenges of the customers and the industry. thirdly, by providing more opportunities and training for the workers, the businesses can improve their productivity and quality, which can increase their profitability and reputation. therefore, hiring more workers is not only a social responsibility, but also a strategic decision for the businesses to survive and thrive in the difficult times.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, hiring more workers also entails some challenges or drawbacks that the businesses need to consider. for instance, they have to bear the increased costs of salaries, benefits, and equipment for the additional staff. they also have to invest in training and mentoring programs to ensure the quality and efficiency of the work. moreover, they have to manage the potential conflicts and misunderstandings that may arise from the diversity and communication among the workers with different backgrounds, perspectives, and expectations.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, i strongly believe that businesses should hire more workers for various reasons. by doing so, they can benefit from the diversity of ideas and creativity that different people can offer, as well as the combination of experience and innovation that senior and young employees can bring. moreover, they can keep up with the fast-changing demands of the modern world and make use of the activeness, inventiveness and enterprise of the youngsters. additionally, they can contribute to solving the social problem of unemployment and improve the living conditions of many people who are in need of work. therefore, i urge the businesses to recruit more workers and enhance their productivity and competitiveness.
Outcome.Outcome5: Besides the benefits of having a diverse workforce with different ideas and creativity, the businesses also have a social responsibility to contribute to the society and the economy. by recruiting more workers, especially the young and the unemployed, they can help to alleviate the problem of unemployment and poverty that many people are facing due to the economic crisis and financial recession. this way, they can not only provide a decent income and a better life for their employees, but also boost the consumer demand and the market potential for their products and services. therefore, hiring more workers is not only a wise strategy for the businesses, but also a moral duty for the society.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, hiring both experienced and young workers is not enough to guarantee the success of a company in the competitive market. there are also other benefits that the businesses can gain from expanding their workforce, especially in the context of the current economic situation.

Context.Left: On the other hand, media, such as TV or film, is considered as the correct information source regulated by the government. It should be reporting and reflecting true phenomenon in the society. Violence, as one of the facts in the real world, certainly has to be reported. However, excessive violence would offer misleading information to the public and exert detrimental influence to the society as well. It is recently reported in the news that a seventeen-year-old boy killed all his family members, one sister and two parents out of hatred and jealousy. In the real world, we are inclined to take extreme approach to tackle a small problem due to excessive violence exposure.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of violence in media and its effects on society in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide a thesis statement that summarizes your main argument or position on the topic at the end of the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt3: Support your thesis statement with relevant evidence and examples in the body paragraphs. You can use sources, such as news articles, studies, or personal experiences, to illustrate your points.
Prompt.Prompt4: Restate your thesis statement and summarize your main points in the conclusion paragraph. You can also provide a call to action, a recommendation, or a prediction for the future of the topic.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Violence is a pervasive and disturbing phenomenon in the contemporary world, and it often appears in various forms of media, such as tv, film, video games, and music. while some people argue that media violence is a harmless form of entertainment or a reflection of reality, others contend that it has negative and harmful effects on the society, especially on the young and impressionable audiences. media violence can influence people's attitudes, behaviors, emotions, and values, and it can also contribute to the desensitization, imitation, and legitimization of violence in the real world.
Outcome.Outcome2: Media violence is a controversial topic that has been debated for decades. some people argue that media violence is a form of artistic expression that reflects the reality of human nature and society. they claim that media violence can have positive effects, such as catharsis, education, or entertainment, for the audience. on the other hand, media, such as tv or film, is considered as the correct information source regulated by the government. it should be reporting and reflecting true phenomenon in the society. violence, as one of the facts in the real world, certainly has to be reported. however, excessive violence would offer misleading information to the public and exert detrimental influence to the society as well. in this essay, i will argue that media violence should be limited and regulated to prevent negative consequences for the individual and the society.
Outcome.Outcome3: Therefore, it is essential to regulate the amount and the quality of violence in media, especially in tv and film, to prevent the negative impacts on the public. media violence can not only desensitize people to real-life violence, but also encourage them to imitate violent behaviors or to adopt violent attitudes. according to a meta-analysis of 217 studies by anderson et al. (2010), exposure to media violence is associated with increased aggression, reduced empathy, and lower moral standards. moreover, media violence can also distort people's perception of reality and create unrealistic expectations or fears. for example, some people may think that violence is a normal or effective way to solve conflicts or to express emotions, or that they are constantly in danger of being attacked or harmed by others. these effects can have serious consequences for individuals and society, such as increased crime rates, mental health problems, or social unrest.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, violence in media has both positive and negative impacts on the society. on one hand, it can provide entertainment, catharsis, and education for the audience, as well as stimulate creativity and critical thinking. on the other hand, it can also cause desensitization, imitation, and aggression, as well as distort the reality and misinform the public. therefore, it is important to balance the amount and quality of violence in media, and to foster media literacy and ethical awareness among the consumers. media producers and regulators should also take responsibility for the social and psychological effects of their products, and avoid glorifying or trivializing violence. by doing so, we can enjoy the benefits of media without compromising our values and well-being.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, there is a need to balance the presentation of violence in media and video games, as both of them can have significant impacts on the audience's attitudes and behaviors. while video games can provide entertainment and stress relief, they can also desensitize players to the consequences of violence and increase their aggression and hostility. on the other hand, media can inform and educate the public about the reality of violence, but they can also exaggerate and sensationalize it, creating fear and confusion. both video games and media should be responsible and ethical in their depiction of violence, and avoid glorifying, trivializing, or distorting it. moreover, the audience should be critical and aware of the potential effects of violence exposure, and seek alternative sources of information and coping strategies.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, it is crucial to balance the representation of violence in media and its impact on the public. while media has the responsibility to inform the audience about the reality of violence, it also has the duty to avoid sensationalizing, glorifying, or normalizing it. excessive violence in media can desensitize the viewers, distort their perception of reality, and trigger aggressive or imitative behaviors. media should also provide context, analysis, and solutions for the causes and consequences of violence, and educate the audience about how to cope with it in a constructive and non-violent way.

Outcome.Outcome1: Besides entertainment, news media also helps people learn more about the world and different cultures. through news media, people can watch documentaries, travel shows, or foreign films that expose them to new perspectives and experiences. news media can also inspire people to pursue their interests or hobbies by showing them successful stories of artists, athletes, or innovators. news media, therefore, not only entertains people, but also enriches their minds and souls.
Outcome.Outcome2: News media not only offers easy access to entertainment, but also caters to the diverse preferences and tastes of people. whether they are interested in music, sports, culture, or comedy, they can find something that suits their mood and interest on the various channels and platforms of news media. for example, some people may enjoy listening to classical music on the radio, while others may prefer watching a thriller movie on netflix. news media also enables people to discover new forms of entertainment that they may not have encountered before, such as foreign films, podcasts, or online games. by providing a wide range of entertainment options, news media enhances the quality of people's leisure time and satisfies their curiosity and creativity.
Outcome.Outcome3: Entertainment news is one of the most appealing and diverse types of news that people can access through news media. whether they are interested in movies, celebrities, or sports, they can find a variety of programs, channels, and sources that cater to their preferences and tastes. for example, movie fans can watch trailers, reviews, interviews, or awards shows on news media. celebrity followers can keep up with the latest gossip, scandals, or lifestyles of their favorite stars. sports enthusiasts can enjoy live coverage, analysis, commentary, or highlights of various games and competitions. entertainment news not only entertains people, but also exposes them to different cultures, perspectives, and values.
Outcome.Outcome4: Entertainment news can also help people cope with various challenges in their daily lives. for example, when people feel stressed, bored, or lonely, they can find some relief and joy in watching their favorite celebrities, movies, or shows. they can also learn about different cultures, hobbies, or trends from entertainment news, which can stimulate their curiosity and creativity. moreover, entertainment news can foster social interactions and connections among people who share similar interests and opinions. by discussing and commenting on the latest news, people can express their feelings, exchange ideas, and build friendships. thus, entertainment news can enhance people's well-being and happiness in many ways.
Outcome.Outcome5: Besides providing people with various entertainment options, news media also plays an important role in informing and educating people about different aspects of the world. by accessing news media, people can learn about the latest events, trends, cultures, and issues that affect their lives and society. news media can also help people to develop critical thinking, awareness, and empathy for others. moreover, news media can influence people's opinions, behaviors, and choices in positive or negative ways, depending on how they use and evaluate the information they receive. therefore, news media is not only a source of entertainment, but also a powerful tool for communication and learning.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, entertainment news is not the only benefit that news media offers to people. news media also plays an important role in informing and educating people about various issues and events happening around the world. whether it is politics, economics, culture, or science, news media provides people with diverse and updated information that helps them to understand the world better and to make informed decisions. news media also influences the way people live in many other aspects, such as health, education, or environment. therefore, news media is not only a source of enjoyment, but also a source of knowledge and empowerment.

Context.Right: First and foremost, a large number of students are obsessed in on-line computer games and as a result their performance in school are declined. An investigation done by Beijing University shows that 8% of the students who failed in the final exam paid 2 hours or more on-online games every week, while 9% excellent students expressed that they did not touch computer games during the most of the days. Recent research by Scientist also reveals that the youngs are more likely to be attacted by and lose themselves in these computer games, because of their low control ability.

Prompt.Prompt1: Provide some background information on why online gaming is popular and addictive among students.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain how online gaming can interfere with students' study habits, concentration, and motivation.
Prompt.Prompt3: Use some statistics or examples to support your arguments and show the contrast between gamers and non-gamers.

Outcome.Outcome1: Online gaming is a popular form of entertainment and leisure for many students, especially during the pandemic when social activities are limited. however, online gaming can also be addictive, as it stimulates the reward system in the brain and creates a sense of achievement, challenge, and escape from reality. some students may spend excessive amounts of time and money on online games, neglecting their academic responsibilities and personal well-being. first and foremost, a large number of students are obsessed in on-line computer games and as a result their performance in school are declined. an investigation done by beijing university shows that 80% of the students who failed in the final exam paid 2 hours or more on-online games every week, while 90% excellent students expressed that they did not touch computer games during the most of the days. recent research by scientist also reveals that the youngs are more likely to be attacted by and lose themselves in these computer games, because of their low control ability.
Outcome.Outcome2: Online gaming can have detrimental effects on students' academic performance, as the left text illustrates. by spending excessive time on online games, students may neglect their homework, revision, and preparation for exams, which are essential for achieving good grades. furthermore, online gaming can impair students' concentration and motivation, as they may find it hard to focus on their lessons and assignments, or lose interest in their learning goals. online games can also create a sense of addiction and escapism, making students prefer the virtual world to the real one, and reducing their social and emotional skills. therefore, online gaming can pose serious challenges to students' educational outcomes and personal development, as the right text suggests.
Outcome.Outcome3: One of the negative effects of on-line computer games on students is that they distract them from their academic studies and lower their grades. first and foremost, a large number of students are obsessed in on-line computer games and as a result their performance in school are declined. an investigation done by beijing university shows that 80% of the students who failed in the final exam paid 2 hours or more on-online games every week, while 90% excellent students expressed that they did not touch computer games during the most of the days. recent research by scientist also reveals that the youngs are more likely to be attacted by and lose themselves in these computer games, because of their low control ability. in contrast, students who avoid or limit their exposure to on-line games tend to focus more on their homework, revision and extracurricular activities, which enhance their skills, knowledge and confidence. for example, a survey conducted by the education bureau of shanghai found that the top 10% of the students in the city spent less than an hour per week on on-line games, and more than 70% of them participated in at least one club or sport in school. therefore, it is clear that on-line games have a detrimental impact on students' academic performance and development.
Outcome.Outcome4: The paragraph above illustrates the negative impact of online gaming on students' academic performance, based on statistical and scientific evidence. it suggests that many students are addicted to these games and neglect their studies, while those who excel in school avoid them. however, this problem is not unsolvable and there are some measures that can be taken to help students balance their online and offline activities.
Outcome.Outcome5: The left text and the right text both illustrate the negative impact of online computer games on students' academic performance. they provide different types of evidence to support this claim, such as statistics from a university survey and findings from scientific research. the left text focuses on the correlation between online gaming and exam failure, while the right text explains the psychological mechanism behind the addiction and distraction of young gamers. by combining these two texts, the author can present a convincing argument that online computer games are harmful for students' education and should be limited or avoided.
Outcome.Outcome6: This phenomenon of online gaming addiction among students is not only detrimental to their academic achievement, but also to their physical and mental health. according to the world health organization, excessive gaming can lead to various problems such as sleep deprivation, eye strain, obesity, anxiety, depression, and social isolation. moreover, some violent and aggressive games may influence the moral values and behaviors of the young players, making them more prone to conflicts and crimes. therefore, it is urgent to raise the awareness of the potential risks of online gaming and to provide effective interventions and guidance for the students who are addicted to it.

Outcome.Outcome1: Hasty decisions are not advisable because they often lack careful consideration of the possible outcomes and alternatives. when a person acts impulsively, he may overlook important factors that could affect his future, such as his skills, goals, opportunities, and responsibilities. by quitting his job without a plan, he may not only lose his income, but also his reputation, network, and self-esteem. these can have negative consequences for his personal and professional life, as he may face financial difficulties, stress, isolation, and low confidence. not to mention, that hasty decisions, not only goes to waste, but also, could affect the entire life of the person. to put it differently, is that after this person has quit his job and became unemployed, he can no longer pay his bills nor buy what he needs for his everyday needs, thus, his life had taken a turn to the worst. therefore, it is advisable to think twice before making a major decision, and to seek advice, information, and support from others if needed.
Outcome.Outcome2: One way to avoid the negative consequences of hasty decisions is to have a clear and realistic plan for the future. planning can help a person to identify their goals, assess their options, and prepare for potential challenges. by planning ahead, a person can also evaluate the risks and benefits of any major change, such as quitting a job, and seek advice or support if needed. planning can also help a person to cope with uncertainty and adapt to changing circumstances. therefore, planning is an essential skill for achieving personal and professional success.
Outcome.Outcome3: Not to mention, that hasty decisions, not only goes to waste, but also, could affect the entire life of the person. to put it differently, is that after this person has quit his job and became unemployed, he can no longer pay his bills nor buy what he needs for his everyday needs, thus, his life had taken a turn to the worst. this unfortunate situation could have been avoided if the person had planned ahead and set realistic goals for himself. planning ahead helps one to evaluate the pros and cons of different options, anticipate potential obstacles and challenges, and prepare for contingencies and opportunities. setting realistic goals helps one to stay focused, motivated, and accountable, as well as to measure progress and achievements. by planning ahead and setting realistic goals, one can make informed and rational decisions that align with one's values, interests, and aspirations, and that can lead to positive outcomes and satisfaction in life.
Outcome.Outcome4: As we can see, hasty decisions can have serious and negative consequences for one's life and well-being. not only does quitting a job without a backup plan lead to financial difficulties and stress, but it also closes the door to future opportunities and career growth. therefore, it is advisable for the readers to avoid making such impulsive and irrational choices and instead, plan wisely and carefully for their goals and aspirations. by doing so, they can ensure that they have a stable and fulfilling life that meets their needs and expectations.
Outcome.Outcome5: Not to mention, that hasty decisions, not only goes to waste, but also, could affect the entire life of the person. to put it differently, is that after this person has quit his job and became unemployed, he can no longer pay his bills nor buy what he needs for his everyday needs, thus, his life had taken a turn to the worst. this is why it is important to think carefully before making any major changes in one's career or lifestyle, and to weigh the pros and cons of each option. otherwise, one might end up regretting the consequences of acting impulsively and losing the opportunities and benefits that they had before.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, quitting a job without having a clear plan or a backup option is a very risky and unwise move. it can have serious consequences for the person's financial stability, well-being, and future prospects. not to mention, that hasty decisions, not only goes to waste, but also, could affect the entire life of the person. to put it differently, is that after this person has quit his job and became unemployed, he can no longer pay his bills nor buy what he needs for his everyday needs, thus, his life had taken a turn to the worst. he might regret his impulsive choice and struggle to find another job in a competitive market, or he might face depression, anxiety, or other mental health issues due to the stress and uncertainty of his situation. either way, he would have been better off if he had thought things through and explored other alternatives before leaving his job.

Outcome.Outcome1: Many people admire famous people and think that they have achieved their success by being lucky. they may believe that famous people have some special talent or opportunity that others do not have, or that they are favored by fate or destiny. however, this is a misconception that ignores the hard work and dedication that famous people usually put into their careers. as the left text argues, famous people are usually diligent people not lucky people, and they have to work hard to become professional and powerful in their fields. the right text gives an example of how hard work reduces the role of chance in success, by comparing the penalty-kick skills of ronaldo and the writer. the writer acknowledges that ronaldo has a higher chance of scoring a goal from a penalty-kick than the writer, not because ronaldo is luckier, but because he has more practice and exercise than the writer. he spends a lot of time in the football field every day, honing his skills and improving his performance. therefore, it is not fair to attribute his success to luck, but to his effort and discipline.
Outcome.Outcome2: The left text argues that famous people are usually diligent people not lucky people, and that hard work makes one more professional and powerful in one's job. the right text illustrates this point with the example of ronaldo, who has more chances of scoring a penalty-kick than the author because of his constant practice and exercise. this example shows how hard work and practice can improve one's skills and performance in any field of work, not just in sports. for instance, a musician who practices regularly and learns from feedback will produce better music than one who relies on talent alone. a scientist who conducts rigorous experiments and updates his or her knowledge will make more discoveries than one who follows outdated theories. a teacher who prepares well and engages with students will have more impact than one who improvises and ignores their needs. therefore, we can see that hard work and practice are essential factors for achieving success and fame in any domain.

Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, being famous does not necessarily mean being lucky, but rather being hard-working and skilled. by dedicating time and effort to their profession, famous people reduce the role of chance in their success and become more competent and confident. for instance, ronaldo scores more penalty-kicks than me not because he is more fortunate, but because he has more practice and exercise. therefore, we should not attribute fame to luck, but to perseverance and talent. instead of envying or admiring famous people, we should learn from their example and pursue our own goals with passion and determination. what do you think are the qualities and challenges of being famous in today's world?
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, we can conclude that famous people are not merely lucky, but rather they have earned their fame and success through hard work and dedication. they have developed their skills and talents to a high level, and they have overcome many challenges and obstacles along the way. luck may play a role in some situations, but it is not the main factor that determines their achievements. rather, it is their effort and perseverance that make them stand out from the rest.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, we can see that famous people do not achieve their fame and success by mere luck, but by their dedication and effort. they constantly improve their skills and knowledge in their fields, and overcome the challenges and difficulties that they face. however, hard work alone is not enough to guarantee fame and success. there are other factors that also influence the outcome of their endeavors. the right text will discuss some of these factors in the following paragraph.

Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Online computer games are popular among many students, especially the young ones, who enjoy the thrill and challenge of virtual reality. however, these games also have negative effects on students' academic performance and well-being, as some studies and cases have shown. in this essay, we will examine how online computer games can lead to poor grades, low self-control, and health risks for students who are obsessed with them.
Outcome.Outcome2: The negative impact of online computer games on students' learning outcomes and health is not only reflected in their academic performance, but also in their physical and mental well-being. statistics and evidence from credible sources indicate that online computer games can cause various problems for students, such as addiction, sleep deprivation, obesity, aggression, depression, and even death. for example, according to a report by the world health organization, online gaming disorder is a serious mental health condition that affects millions of people worldwide, especially young people, and can lead to impaired functioning, social isolation, and reduced quality of life. moreover, a study by the american academy of pediatrics found that excessive screen time, including online gaming, can increase the risk of obesity, cardiovascular disease, and diabetes among children and adolescents. furthermore, a meta-analysis by the american psychological association revealed that violent online games can increase aggressive thoughts, feelings, and behaviors, and decrease empathy and prosocial behavior, among players. additionally, a survey by the china youth association for network development showed that online gaming addiction is one of the main causes of suicide among chinese youth, and that many of them suffer from depression, anxiety, and low self-esteem. therefore, online computer games pose a serious threat to students' learning outcomes and health, and should be regulated and limited.
Outcome.Outcome3: One may argue that online computer games are not entirely detrimental to students' academic performance and well-being, as some of them may benefit from playing these games as a way to pursue their career interests or develop their skills. for instance, some students may aspire to become game designers, programmers, or testers, and playing online games may help them gain insights into the industry and the market. some students may also enhance their cognitive abilities, such as problem-solving, creativity, and coordination, by playing online games that challenge them intellectually and physically.
Outcome.Outcome4: Some might argue that online computer games are not entirely detrimental for students, as they might inspire some of them to pursue careers related to computer technology or gaming industry. however, this is a very rare and uncertain outcome, and it does not justify the risk of wasting precious time and energy, jeopardizing academic performance, and endangering physical and mental health. the vast majority of students who indulge in online computer games are not aiming for such professional goals, but rather escaping from the reality and challenges of their studies and life. they are more likely to fall behind in their classes, develop unhealthy habits, and suffer from various negative consequences, such as sleep deprivation, addiction, isolation, aggression, and even death. therefore, the potential benefits of online computer games for a few students are far outweighed by the serious harms they cause for most students.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, it is clear that on-line computer games have a negative impact on the academic performance and health of most students. instead of developing useful skills and knowledge, they waste their precious time and energy on virtual entertainment that can be addictive and harmful. they neglect their studies, their sleep and their physical well-being, which can lead to serious consequences such as failing exams, dropping out of school or even dying from exhaustion.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, it is evident that on-line computer games have a negative impact on most students' academic performance and health. they not only distract them from their studies, but also deprive them of the necessary rest and physical activity. moreover, they expose them to the risk of addiction, violence, and even death. only a small proportion of students can benefit from their interest in computer games and pursue a related career, but they are the exception rather than the rule.

Outcome.Outcome1: Living and studying overseas is an irreplaceable experience for learning to stand on your own feet, as it challenges the individual to cope with various situations and problems that might arise in a different environment and culture. by living overseas, the individual has to adapt to a new lifestyle, language, and customs, as well as manage their finances, health, and academic responsibilities. by studying overseas, the individual has to deal with different academic standards, expectations, and methods, as well as interact with diverse classmates, professors, and peers. these experiences can help the individual develop their independence, confidence, and resilience, as well as their intercultural and interpersonal skills, which are essential for their personal and professional growth.
Outcome.Outcome2: Living and studying overseas is not only a challenge, but also an opportunity to gain valuable experiences that can enrich one's personal and professional development. for example, by living in a different culture, one can learn to appreciate diversity, respect different values and customs, and overcome cultural barriers. by developing language skills, one can communicate more effectively, access more information and resources, and enhance one's intercultural competence. by expanding one's network, one can make new friends, build relationships, and create opportunities for collaboration and exchange. these experiences can help one to grow as a person, to broaden one's horizons, and to prepare for a globalized world.

Context.Left: On one hand, it will be easier for people to assimilate into a new country, if they follow the new customs. When people migrate to a new country, they are likely to suffer the culture shock, because of the difference between two cultures. The custom is just a form of the culture and following the custom is a good way to know more about this culture. For example, if one wore in white and went to common Viharas to observe a rather longer-than-usual, full-length Buddhist sutra in Buddha's Birthday in India, he or she would learn something about Indian religion and culture. As a result, people understand the culture, and then they adapt to the new country.
Context.Right: All in all, the immigrants should follow the customs in the new country, which can help them survive from the culture shock sooner, and assimilate to a new culture.

Prompt.Prompt1: Introduce the topic of customs and culture in the first sentence of the middle text.
Prompt.Prompt2: Explain why following the customs of the new country can benefit the immigrants in terms of communication and integration.
Prompt.Prompt3: Provide some examples of customs that immigrants can follow in different countries, such as greeting, dressing, or celebrating.
Prompt.Prompt4: Acknowledge the possible challenges or drawbacks of following the customs of the new country, such as losing one's identity or facing discrimination.

Outcome.Outcome1: Customs and culture are important aspects of any society, and they reflect the values, beliefs, and traditions of its people. however, when immigrants move to a new country, they may face some challenges and conflicts with the local customs and culture, especially if they are very different from their own. therefore, it is beneficial for immigrants to follow the customs of the new country, as it can help them in several ways.
Outcome.Outcome2: Following the customs of the new country can also benefit the immigrants in terms of communication and integration. by respecting and practicing the local norms and values, the immigrants can show their appreciation and openness to the host society, and avoid offending or alienating the natives. this can facilitate their social interactions and relationships with the people around them, such as neighbors, colleagues, or friends. moreover, by participating in the cultural activities and events of the new country, the immigrants can enrich their knowledge and experience, and broaden their perspectives and horizons. this can help them overcome the barriers and prejudices that may exist between different groups, and foster a sense of belonging and identity in the new environment.
Outcome.Outcome3: Following the customs in the new country can also help the immigrants to communicate and interact with the local people more smoothly and respectfully. different countries have different ways of greeting, dressing, or celebrating, which reflect their values, beliefs, and traditions. for instance, in some asian countries, such as japan or china, bowing is a common way of showing respect and gratitude, while in some western countries, such as the united states or canada, shaking hands or hugging is more acceptable. similarly, in some muslim countries, such as saudi arabia or iran, women are expected to cover their hair and body with a veil or a cloak, while in some european countries, such as france or italy, women can wear more fashionable and revealing clothes. moreover, in some countries, such as india or mexico, there are many festivals and celebrations that are unique and colorful, such as diwali or day of the dead, while in some countries, such as australia or new zealand, there are fewer holidays and more casual activities, such as barbecue or surfing. by following these customs, the immigrants can show their respect and appreciation for the new culture, and also make friends and connections with the local people.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, following the customs of the new country may also pose some challenges or drawbacks for the immigrants. for instance, some immigrants may feel that they are losing their own identity or heritage, if they abandon their original customs and traditions. they may struggle to balance their loyalty to their roots and their integration to the new society. moreover, some immigrants may face discrimination or prejudice from the natives, who may view them as outsiders or threats, regardless of how well they conform to the local customs. therefore, the immigrants need to be aware of these potential risks and find ways to cope with them.
Outcome.Outcome5: Following the customs of a new country can also benefit the immigrants in other ways. for instance, it can help them communicate better with the local people, who may appreciate their respect and interest in their culture. it can also help them avoid some misunderstandings or conflicts that may arise from different cultural norms or expectations. moreover, it can enrich their own cultural identity and diversity, by exposing them to different perspectives and values. therefore, following the customs of a new country can be a positive and rewarding experience for the immigrants.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, following the new customs does not mean that the immigrants have to abandon their own cultural identities. on the contrary, they can also maintain and share their original customs with the local people, which can enrich the cultural diversity and mutual understanding in the new country. for instance, if one celebrated the lunar new year with traditional food and decorations in canada, he or she would not only preserve the heritage of their ancestors, but also introduce a different aspect of asian culture to the canadian society. therefore, the immigrants can balance the respect for the new customs and the preservation of their own customs.

Context.Left: Secondly, scientific research provide several authentic survey of the students' performance after break. During those vacations i used to analyze my performance in latest examination and used to go through those question or concept again to avoid making same mistakes. I also used to spend my time on developing some recreational activity or learning some sports or game. During my all vacations, I used to miss my school due to which I used to restart my session with great enthusiasm of learning and scoring good marks in new quarter.

Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some background information on why vacations are important for students' health and well-being.
Prompt.Prompt3: Use a topic sentence to introduce the main idea of the second paragraph, which is the scientific evidence for the positive effects of vacations on students' learning.
Prompt.Prompt4: Add some examples or statistics to support the claim that vacations improve students' performance and motivation.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Vacations are an important part of the academic calendar for students, as they offer many benefits for their learning and well-being. taking a break from the regular routine of classes, homework, and exams can help students to relax, recharge, and reflect on their progress and goals. moreover, vacations can also provide opportunities for students to explore new interests, hobbies, and skills, as well as to spend quality time with their family and friends. in this essay, i will discuss two main reasons why vacations are beneficial for students: firstly, they reduce stress and improve mental health; and secondly, they enhance learning and performance.
Outcome.Outcome2: Vacations are not only a time for relaxation and enjoyment, but also a crucial factor for students' health and well-being. according to many studies, taking regular breaks from academic pressure can reduce stress, improve mood, enhance creativity, and boost memory and concentration. vacations can also help students to develop their social and emotional skills, as they can interact with their family and friends, explore new places and cultures, and pursue their hobbies and interests. by having a balance between work and play, students can maintain their physical and mental health and prevent burnout and fatigue. therefore, vacations are an essential part of the educational process and should not be seen as a waste of time or a distraction from learning.
Outcome.Outcome3: Not only do vacations benefit students' mental and physical health, but they also enhance their academic performance. this is supported by scientific evidence that shows how breaks from school can improve students' learning outcomes.
Outcome.Outcome4: The benefits of vacations for students are not only based on personal experiences, but also on empirical evidence. several studies have shown that vacations can improve students' academic performance and motivation by reducing stress, enhancing memory, and stimulating creativity. for example, a 2012 study by the american psychological association found that students who took a week-long vacation during the school year had significantly higher grades and lower levels of anxiety than those who did not. similarly, a 2016 study by the university of helsinki found that students who had longer summer breaks performed better on cognitive tests and reported higher levels of interest and enjoyment in learning than those who had shorter breaks. these findings suggest that vacations can provide students with valuable opportunities to refresh their minds, consolidate their knowledge, and discover new interests.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, it is evident that vacations are essential for students to refresh their minds and bodies, as well as to improve their academic performance. by having breaks from the regular routine of studying, students can relax, enjoy, and explore their interests and hobbies. they can also review their progress and identify their strengths and weaknesses. this way, they can prepare themselves for the next session with more confidence and motivation. moreover, vacations can also help students to develop their social and emotional skills, as they can interact with their family and friends, and learn from different experiences and cultures.
Outcome.Outcome6: These benefits of vacations are not only anecdotal, but also backed by scientific evidence. several studies have shown that taking breaks from academic work can boost students' memory, creativity, motivation, and well-being. for example, a 2016 study by the american psychological association found that students who participated in a four-week summer program that involved outdoor activities, arts, and social interactions reported higher levels of happiness, self-esteem, and academic interest than those who stayed at home or attended traditional summer school. moreover, vacations can also help students avoid burnout, stress, and fatigue, which can impair their learning and performance.

Outcome.Outcome1: In the contemporary society, many people are facing various health issues that affect their well-being and quality of life. some of these problems are related to the lifestyle choices that people make, such as smoking, drinking, and lack of exercise. nevertheless, there are some other causes why people are experiencing serious medical problems. firstly, the environment of the modern world is polluted very significantly from greenhouse gas emissions and other gasses. many people, for example, are suffering from allergy because of these gasses. secondly, foods with a low quality such as fast foods, junk foods and any genetically modified ones are influencing our health very negatively. finally, life is becoming more stressful due to some recent problems such as traffic jam, traffic accidents and others. these are the main factors that contribute to the deterioration of human health in the modern world.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the main causes why people are experiencing serious medical problems in the modern world is environmental pollution. due to the rapid industrialization, urbanization and consumption of fossil fuels, the air, water and soil are contaminated with various harmful substances. these substances can cause respiratory diseases, skin problems, cancers and other chronic illnesses. for instance, many people are suffering from allergies because of the high levels of pollen, dust and smog in the air. moreover, environmental pollution can also affect the natural ecosystems and biodiversity, which are essential for human well-being.
Outcome.Outcome3: The effects of environmental pollution on human health are not only limited to allergies, but also to various chronic and acute diseases. for example, according to the world health organization, air pollution is responsible for an estimated 4.2 million premature deaths worldwide per year, mainly due to cardiovascular and respiratory diseases. moreover, exposure to hazardous chemicals and metals, such as mercury, lead, arsenic, and cadmium, can cause damage to the nervous, immune, and reproductive systems, as well as cancer and developmental disorders. therefore, it is clear that the environment of the modern world poses a serious threat to the well-being of people.
Outcome.Outcome4: Nevertheless, there are some other causes why people are experiencing serious medical problems. firstly, the environment of the modern world polluted very significantly from greenhouse gas emissions and other gasses. many people, for example, are suffering from allergy because of these gasses. another cause of health issues is the consumption of low-quality food, such as fast foods, junk foods and any genetically modified ones. these foods are influencing our health very negatively, as they can lead to obesity, diabetes, heart diseases and other chronic conditions. finally, life becoming more stressful due to some recent problems such as traffic gam, traffic accidents and others.
Outcome.Outcome5: These factors, along with the lack of physical activity, have contributed to the rise of obesity, diabetes, heart diseases and other chronic illnesses in many countries. according to the world health organization, more than 1.9 billion adults were overweight and 650 million were obese in 2016, and these numbers are expected to increase in the future. obesity and related conditions not only affect the quality of life and life expectancy of individuals, but also pose a huge burden on the health care systems and the economy. therefore, it is essential to promote healthy lifestyles and preventions measures to reduce the impact of these problems on the society.
Outcome.Outcome6: These factors, along with the lack of physical activity, are contributing to the rise of chronic diseases and health issues among people of all ages. however, these problems are not inevitable and can be prevented or reduced by adopting some healthy habits and lifestyles.

Outcome.Outcome1: The lack of health resources in poorer nations has a significant impact on the quality of life and well-being of the people who live there. without adequate access to medical professionals and facilities, many people suffer from preventable or treatable diseases and injuries, which can reduce their life expectancy and productivity. moreover, the lack of health care can also affect the mental and emotional health of the people, who may experience stress, anxiety, and depression due to their poor living conditions and lack of hope. therefore, it is crucial that richer nations help to improve the health situation in poorer nations by providing human and financial assistance.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the consequences of the health gap between poorer and richer nations is the high prevalence of infectious diseases and malnutrition in the former. these health problems are often related to poverty, as many people in poorer nations lack access to clean water, sanitation, adequate food, and preventive health care. for example, malaria, tuberculosis, hiv/aids, and diarrheal diseases are some of the leading causes of death and disability in low-income countries, and they can be prevented or treated with relatively low-cost interventions. however, without enough doctors, nurses, and hospitals, many people in poorer nations do not receive the necessary diagnosis, treatment, and follow-up care. firstly, in the area of health, poorer nations normally have less quantity of doctors and nurses compared to richer nations. high population in poorer countries due to lack of family planning caused the proportion of doctors unbalance to the quantity of resident. on top of that, poorer nations are lack of hospitals to fulfill the demand of the patients. to solve these issues, richer nations can contribute by delegating doctors and nurses to these power nations as well as donate money to build hospitals.
Outcome.Outcome3: Another area where richer nations can assist poorer nations is education. education is essential for the development of human capital, social welfare, and economic growth. however, many poorer nations face challenges such as low enrollment rates, high dropout rates, poor quality of instruction, and inadequate infrastructure and resources. these challenges limit the opportunities and potential of millions of children and youth in the world.
Outcome.Outcome4: Another area where richer nations can assist poorer nations is education. many poorer nations struggle to provide quality education for their children and youth, due to lack of resources, infrastructure, and qualified teachers. this can limit their opportunities for social and economic development and empowerment. richer nations can support or improve the education system in poorer nations by providing scholarships for students to pursue higher education in their own or foreign countries, by training teachers in pedagogy and curriculum development, or by donating books and equipment to enhance the learning environment. these actions can help poorer nations to achieve their educational goals and improve their human capital.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the most significant ways that richer nations can help poorer nations is by providing support in the field of health care. poorer nations normally have less quantity of doctors and nurses compared to richer nations, which affects their ability to cope with diseases and emergencies. moreover, the high population in poorer countries due to lack of family planning exacerbates the problem of insufficient health facilities and resources. to solve these issues, richer nations can contribute by delegating doctors and nurses to these poorer nations as well as donate money to build hospitals. this would not only improve the health outcomes of the people in need, but also foster goodwill and cooperation between the countries.
