Outcome.Outcome1: Media plays a vital role in informing the public about various issues and events that affect their lives. it can also influence their opinions, attitudes and behaviors. however, different types of media have different advantages and disadvantages in terms of speed, accuracy and accessibility. in this essay, i will compare and contrast digital media and print media, such as newspapers and magazines, and argue that digital media will dominate the future of information dissemination. one of the main reasons for this is that digital media can deliver news and updates about current affairs much faster than print media, especially in times of crisis. a very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis. this helps readers to get updated and act accordingly. for example, when the aircraft mh 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. the friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. in such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media. instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. this explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines.
Outcome.Outcome2: In times of crisis, people need to access accurate and timely information to cope with the situation and make informed decisions. however, paper media such as newspapers and magazines have limitations in delivering the latest news and updates to the readers. they depend on printing and distribution schedules, which can cause delays and outdated information. on the other hand, digital media such as websites, social media, and mobile apps can provide faster and more reliable information than paper media. they can use various sources and formats, such as text, images, videos, and audio, to report the current affairs as quickly as possible. they can also update and correct the information as new facts and evidence emerge. for example, when the aircraft mh 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. the friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. in such situations, newspapers and magazines could not respond as fast as digital media. instead of waiting for next publication, people could get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. this explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines.
Outcome.Outcome3: Digital media not only provides information faster than newspapers and magazines, but also has the potential to influence public opinion and decision making in different situations. for instance, digital media can create awareness and mobilize people for social causes, such as environmental protection, human rights, or democracy movements. digital media can also expose corruption, injustice, or misconduct by authorities or powerful groups, and demand accountability and transparency. furthermore, digital media can offer diverse perspectives and opinions on various issues, and enable dialogue and debate among citizens and stakeholders. these examples show how digital media can play a vital role in shaping the public sphere and fostering civic engagement.
Outcome.Outcome4: To conclude, media has a crucial role in informing the public about the latest developments in the world, especially during emergencies. paper and magazines cannot compete with digital media in terms of speed and accessibility. people prefer to access reliable and timely information online rather than wait for the next edition of print media. therefore, digital media will rule over paper and magazines in the future.
Outcome.Outcome5: One of the advantages of digital media over paper and magazines is its speed and timeliness in reporting the news. a very important responsibility of media is to publish information about the current affairs as quickly as possible specially when there is a crisis. this helps readers to get updated and act accordingly. for example, when the aircraft mh 370 went missing, everyone wanted to know the details about this tragic incident. the friends and families of passengers and crews were impatient to know the truth. in such situations, newspapers and magazines can not respond as fast as digital media. instead of waiting for next publication, people can get trustworthy information about the current incidents from internet within an hour or two. this explains why digital media will rule over paper and magazines. therefore, digital media has a competitive edge over traditional media in terms of delivering the latest and most relevant information to the audience.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, publishing information quickly is not the only factor that determines the popularity and credibility of media. another crucial aspect is how the media presents and analyzes the information in a balanced and objective way. paper and magazines have some advantages over digital media in this regard.

Context.Left: Computers have revolutionized our lifestyle during last century. However, some people especially young ones use computers extremely and this excessive usage lead to increase stress among them, but computers have brought many advantages to our lives. From my point of view, computers have an important and inevitable role in economic, business, and other part of societies. In addition, they make the way of living easier by doing our routine duties.
Context.Right: Computers have an important role in social and personal life. Computers have opened up a network connection among people. This technology makes easier for people to send and receive personal message. Teenagers and adolescents spend free time in front of computers. Moreover, People can use computers to extract their essential information easily. By contrast, excessive use of computers has brought many difficulties. The results show that teenagers who are addicted to computer games show more violent and stressful behaviors. People who have type by computers may suffer from such disease related to knees.

Prompt.Prompt1: Talk more about the advantages and disadvantages of computers in different aspects of life.
Prompt.Prompt2: Elaborate on the economic and business benefits of computers from the previous paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt3: Explain how computers have opened up a network connection among people and how this technology makes it easier for people to send and receive personal messages.
Prompt.Prompt4: Compare and contrast the positive and negative effects of computers on teenagers and adolescents, such as stress, violence, and health issues.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Computers have revolutionized our lifestyle during last century, but they also have some drawbacks that need to be considered. on one hand, computers have an important and inevitable role in economic, business, and other parts of societies. they make the way of living easier by doing our routine duties, such as calculating, storing, and processing data. they also have opened up a network connection among people, which enables them to communicate, share, and collaborate across distances and cultures. computers can also help people to access and use a vast amount of information for various purposes, such as education, entertainment, and research. on the other hand, some people, especially young ones, use computers excessively and this can lead to increased stress, health problems, and social isolation. for example, teenagers who are addicted to computer games may show more violent and stressful behaviors, as well as neglect their studies, hobbies, and relationships. people who type by computers for long hours may suffer from diseases related to their eyes, wrists, and necks. furthermore, computers can also pose some risks to the security, privacy, and ethics of the users, as they can be hacked, misused, or manipulated by malicious actors. therefore, it is important to use computers wisely and moderately, and to balance them with other aspects of life.
Outcome.Outcome2: Computers not only facilitate our lifestyle, but also enhance our economic and business opportunities. with computers, we can access global markets, communicate with customers and partners, and improve productivity and efficiency. computers also enable us to create and share innovative products and services, such as e-commerce, online education, and digital media. computers have transformed various sectors, such as agriculture, manufacturing, health care, and finance, by providing data analysis, automation, and optimization. therefore, computers have contributed to the economic growth and development of many countries and regions.
Outcome.Outcome3: Computers have not only revolutionized our lifestyle in various aspects, but also enabled us to communicate with each other more easily and effectively. computers have opened up a network connection among people, allowing them to share information, opinions, and emotions across distances and cultures. this technology makes it easier for people to send and receive personal messages, such as emails, chats, and social media posts, that can enhance their relationships and social support. furthermore, people can use computers to access a vast amount of information and resources that can help them with their education, work, and hobbies.
Outcome.Outcome4: Both left text and right text acknowledge the importance and benefits of computers in various aspects of life, such as economy, business, education, and communication. computers have revolutionized our lifestyle and enabled us to access vast amounts of information and connect with others across the globe. however, they also agree that excessive and inappropriate use of computers can have harmful consequences, especially for young ones. left text points out that spending too much time on computers can increase stress levels and affect mental health. right text adds that computer addiction can also lead to violent and aggressive behaviors, as well as physical problems such as knee pain. therefore, it is essential to balance the use of computers and avoid their negative impacts on teenagers and adolescents.
Outcome.Outcome5: The left text and the right text both discuss the impact of computers on our lifestyle, but they focus on different aspects. the left text emphasizes the positive effects of computers on various sectors of society, such as economy, business, and education, and how they simplify our daily tasks. the right text, on the other hand, explores the negative consequences of computers on social and personal life, such as addiction, violence, stress, and health problems. therefore, the two texts present a balanced view of the advantages and disadvantages of computers, and suggest that we need to use them wisely and moderately.
Outcome.Outcome6: One of the main benefits of computers is that they facilitate communication and information sharing across the globe. computers have opened up a network connection among people, allowing them to send and receive personal messages, access news and entertainment, and collaborate on projects and tasks. for many people, computers are essential tools for social and personal life, as they enable them to stay in touch with their friends and family, express their opinions and interests, and pursue their hobbies and passions. however, not everything about computers is positive, as there are also some drawbacks and risks associated with their excessive use.

Context.Left: First and foremost, if there is control over artists' ideas, they will definitely lose their sense of creativity in the long run. It is undeniable that when they are given the opportunity to express themselves, most artists will think out of the box and come up with spectacular Arts such as paintings or movies. For example, paintings by Da Vinci and Michallengo are admired even till now as they were not restricted during those times. In short, without any limitations, there will be more awe inspiring work from our artists.
Context.Right: Looking from another perspective, there are certain drawbacks if artists are not restricted. They might go deeper into certain aspects that can cause controversies in a country. To cite an example, Malaysia is a multiracial country whereby all the citizens live together in harmony and peace. In case there is anyone who brings up some sensitive issues in their films or books regarding any races, this might end up in some chaos among the society. Nonetheless, I believe that artists know their boundaries very well and would surely do not want their names tarnished just because of their unscrupulous acts.

Prompt.Prompt1: Determine the topic based on the left text and the right text.
Prompt.Prompt2: The topic could be the advantages and disadvantages of imposing control over artists' ideas.
Prompt.Prompt3: Talk more about the advantages of imposing control over artists' ideas in the middle text.
Prompt.Prompt4: Elaborate on how control can ensure that artists respect the cultural and social values of the society they live in.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: However, the issue of artistic freedom is not so simple and straightforward. there are also ethical and social implications that need to be considered when artists express their ideas. while some might argue that artists have the right to challenge norms and conventions, others might question the responsibility and accountability of artists towards their audiences and communities. how can we balance the need for creativity and innovation with the respect for diversity and harmony? how can we protect the artistic integrity and autonomy of artists without compromising the public interest and order? these are some of the questions that need to be addressed when dealing with the topic of control over artists' ideas.
Outcome.Outcome2: Hence, it is clear that imposing control over artists' ideas has both advantages and disadvantages. on one hand, it can hinder their creativity and innovation, which are essential for producing high-quality and original arts. on the other hand, it can prevent them from crossing the line and offending certain groups or values, which are important for maintaining social harmony and stability. therefore, it is crucial to strike a balance between artistic freedom and social responsibility, and to respect the diversity and sensitivity of different cultures and beliefs.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, imposing some control over artists' ideas is not necessarily a bad thing, as it can also have some advantages. for instance, by following certain guidelines or standards, artists can ensure that their work is suitable for a wider audience and does not offend or harm anyone. moreover, control can also stimulate artists to challenge themselves and find creative ways to convey their messages within the given constraints. additionally, control can also help to preserve and promote the cultural and moral values of a society, as well as to prevent the misuse or abuse of artistic freedom for personal or political gains. therefore, control can be seen as a form of balance and responsibility for artists.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, some might argue that control over artists' ideas is necessary to ensure that they respect the cultural and social values of the society they live in. they might claim that without any supervision or guidance, artists might offend or provoke certain groups or individuals with their works, especially in a diverse and pluralistic society. they might also point out that control can help to maintain the quality and standards of the arts, as well as to protect the public from harmful or inappropriate content. therefore, they might suggest that some form of regulation or censorship is needed to balance the freedom and responsibility of the artists.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, some people may argue that giving artists total freedom of expression is not always beneficial for the society. they may point out that there are certain ethical and moral issues that artists should consider before creating their works. they may also claim that some forms of art can offend or provoke certain groups or individuals, and thus cause social unrest or violence.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, while it is important to encourage artists' creativity and freedom of expression, it is also necessary to consider the potential impact of their work on the society and the culture they live in. not all forms of art are universally accepted or appreciated, and some might even offend or provoke certain groups or individuals. therefore, some degree of regulation or censorship might be needed to ensure that artists do not cross the line of decency, morality, or legality.

Context.Left: Some people believe that professional athletes and entertainers are paid reasonable salaries, which can be up to millions of dollars each year. However, that is not equal to their actual contributions to the society. I believe that their salary at a lower level would be more appropriate compared with other peoples in scientific or social, economic fields.
Context.Right: However, their talents should not be overrated. Other people say that singers and athletes, in fact, contribute insignificantly to the development of the society. It is assumed the amazing performances they give to the audiences are only valuable in aesthetic and entertaining terms. While scientists invent machines serving daily lives, doctors take care of patients and cure their diseases and policemen help to ensure the safety and stability of the nation, singers and athletes do not play a helpful part in improving the material life. They commit themselves to promoting relaxation and enjoyment for the audience. Indeed, their contribution is less important than those from doctors or scientists, albeit necessary. Hence, their privilege of salary seems groundless, while the main work forces receive modest salaries which only enable them to afford bare necessities.

Prompt.Prompt1: Explain why professional athletes and entertainers are paid high salaries.
Prompt.Prompt2: Provide some examples of the benefits and challenges of their careers.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting sentence that introduces the contrast between their contributions and those of other professionals.
Prompt.Prompt4: State your main argument that their salary level is not equal to their social impact.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the main arguments in favor of high salaries for professional athletes and entertainers is that they possess rare and exceptional talents that are in high demand and attract a large audience. they argue that their skills and abilities are the result of years of hard work, training, and dedication, and that they face intense competition and pressure in their fields. moreover, they claim that they create a positive impact on the society by inspiring, motivating, and entertaining millions of people who enjoy their performances and follow their careers. therefore, they deserve to be rewarded accordingly for their talent, effort, and influence.
Outcome.Outcome2: While some people believe that professional athletes and entertainers are paid reasonable salaries, which can be up to millions of dollars each year, others argue that their talents should not be overrated. their careers may have some benefits, such as fame, popularity, and personal satisfaction, but they also face many challenges, such as intense competition, high pressure, and short-lived success. moreover, their careers may expose them to risks of injury, scandal, or exploitation. they also have to deal with the demands and expectations of their fans, sponsors, and media, which may affect their privacy and mental health. therefore, their high salaries may not reflect their actual contributions to the society, but rather the market forces and the public preferences that shape their industry.
Outcome.Outcome3: Some people believe that professional athletes and entertainers are paid reasonable salaries, which can be up to millions of dollars each year. however, that is not equal to their actual contributions to the society. i believe that their salary at a lower level would be more appropriate compared with other peoples in scientific or social, economic fields. on the other hand, some people argue that the contributions of these celebrities are not only unequal, but also insignificant to the society. they claim that their talents are only valuable in aesthetic and entertaining terms, while other professionals play more vital roles in improving the material and social well-being of the nation.
Outcome.Outcome4: Therefore, i argue that the salary level of professional athletes and entertainers is not proportional to their social impact. although they have exceptional skills and talents that can entertain and inspire millions of people, their work does not directly address the pressing issues and challenges that the society faces. unlike scientists, doctors, or policemen, who make significant contributions to the advancement and well-being of the society, their work is mainly focused on providing enjoyment and relaxation, which is less essential and valuable. thus, it is unfair and unreasonable that they earn much more than other professionals who deserve more recognition and reward for their work.
Outcome.Outcome5: To support this view, some arguments can be made based on the comparison between the roles and impacts of professional athletes and entertainers and those of other workers in different fields. while the former group of people may have exceptional skills and talents that attract millions of fans and generate huge revenues for the entertainment industry, their work does not directly benefit the society in terms of solving problems, advancing knowledge, or improving living conditions.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, i disagree with the view that professional athletes and entertainers are paid reasonable salaries, which can be up to millions of dollars each year. i think that such a high level of income is not justified by their actual contributions to the society, which are limited and less essential than those of other occupations. in contrast, many people who work in scientific or social, economic fields, who make significant and valuable impacts on the well-being and progress of the society, are often underpaid and undervalued. this creates a huge gap and imbalance between different sectors of the society, which is unfair and unreasonable.

Context.Right: It is especially true if we consider the fact that a single international language plays a pivotal role in global economic cooperation. As businessmen from different countries have access to the same language, they can communicate with each other more efficiently and deeply on trade, which can intensify the transnational cooperation. In contrast, without the availability of the same language, there might be a chance that misunderstanding and conflicts would ensue over business negotiations, impeding collaborations between them. Therefore, a single international language serves an economic purpose.

Outcome.Outcome1: In today's interconnected world, where people from different countries and cultures interact with each other on various levels, having a common language can bring many benefits. a single international language can facilitate communication, understanding, and cooperation among individuals and groups across borders, and can also promote cultural diversity and mutual respect. one of the most significant benefits of a single international language is its economic impact, as it can enhance the efficiency and quality of global trade and business. (left text) it is especially true if we consider the fact that a single international language plays a pivotal role in global economic cooperation. as businessmen from different countries have access to the same language, they can communicate with each other more efficiently and deeply on trade, which can intensify the transnational cooperation. in contrast, without the availability of the same language, there might be a chance that misunderstanding and conflicts would ensue over business negotiations, impeding collaborations between them. therefore, a single international language serves an economic purpose. (right text)
Outcome.Outcome2: Global communication and interaction are essential for the development and progress of various fields, such as science, culture, education, and politics. however, the diversity of languages in the world can pose a challenge for effective and harmonious exchanges among different nations and regions. therefore, many people advocate for the establishment of a single international language that can facilitate mutual understanding and cooperation across linguistic and cultural barriers. it is especially true if we consider the fact that a single international language plays a pivotal role in global economic cooperation. as businessmen from different countries have access to the same language, they can communicate with each other more efficiently and deeply on trade, which can intensify the transnational cooperation. in contrast, without the availability of the same language, there might be a chance that misunderstanding and conflicts would ensue over business negotiations, impeding collaborations between them. therefore, a single international language serves an economic purpose.
Outcome.Outcome3: Besides the political benefit, a single international language also has a cultural advantage for the world. by sharing a common language, people from different countries and backgrounds can have more opportunities to exchange their ideas, values, and perspectives, which can enhance their mutual understanding and respect. moreover, a single international language can facilitate the dissemination and appreciation of diverse cultural products, such as literature, art, music, and film, across the globe, enriching the human civilization. a single international language, therefore, fosters a cultural harmony and diversity among the world's people. it is especially true if we consider the fact that a single international language plays a pivotal role in global economic cooperation. as businessmen from different countries have access to the same language, they can communicate with each other more efficiently and deeply on trade, which can intensify the transnational cooperation. in contrast, without the availability of the same language, there might be a chance that misunderstanding and conflicts would ensue over business negotiations, impeding collaborations between them. therefore, a single international language serves an economic purpose.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, the benefits of a single international language are not limited to the economic sphere. a common language can also foster cultural diversity and understanding among people from different backgrounds and regions. for instance, a single international language can enable people to access and appreciate a variety of literary and artistic works from different cultures, enriching their knowledge and perspectives. it can also facilitate intercultural dialogue and exchange, allowing people to share their values, beliefs, and experiences, and to learn from each other. moreover, a single international language can promote tolerance and respect for diversity, as people can communicate with each other more effectively and empathetically, and overcome stereotypes and prejudices. therefore, a single international language serves a cultural purpose as well.
Outcome.Outcome5: Besides the social and cultural benefits, a single international language can also have a significant impact on the economic development of the world. it is especially true if we consider the fact that a single international language plays a pivotal role in global economic cooperation. as businessmen from different countries have access to the same language, they can communicate with each other more efficiently and deeply on trade, which can intensify the transnational cooperation. in contrast, without the availability of the same language, there might be a chance that misunderstanding and conflicts would ensue over business negotiations, impeding collaborations between them. therefore, a single international language serves an economic purpose. moreover, a single international language can also facilitate the dissemination of scientific and technological knowledge, which is essential for innovation and progress in various fields. by sharing the same language, researchers and experts from different regions can exchange ideas and information more easily and effectively, which can enhance the quality and diversity of scientific research and development. furthermore, a single international language can also promote the education and learning of people across the world, as they can access a wider range of resources and opportunities in different disciplines and domains. thus, a single international language can contribute to the advancement of human civilization in multiple aspects.
Outcome.Outcome6: Another benefit of having a single international language is that it can foster cultural exchange and mutual understanding among people from diverse backgrounds. by sharing a common linguistic tool, people can access and appreciate the cultural products and values of other nations, such as literature, art, music, and philosophy. moreover, they can also engage in dialogue and debate on various issues that affect the global community, such as human rights, environmental protection, and peace. thus, a single international language can enhance the intercultural awareness and respect among people.

Context.Left: It is undeniable that children have an innocent mind, and they requires a proper guidance at a specific time to make them understand the value of life. Some people think that it is better to make them competitive, while other believes to make them co-operative. Both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below:
Context.Right: However, those who wants to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead. Although, they will not be having a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do, but they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team.

Prompt.Prompt1: Talk more about the benefits of making children competitive in the first paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt2: Elaborate on the drawbacks of making children co-operative in the second paragraph.
Prompt.Prompt3: Add a connecting paragraph that makes the transition from the advantages and disadvantages of both approaches to the thesis statement of your essay.
Prompt.Prompt4: State your thesis statement clearly and concisely at the end of the introduction. It should indicate your position on whether children should be made competitive or co-operative.
Prompt.Prompt5: Write a paragraph to connect the left text and right text.
Prompt.Prompt6: Insert a passage connecting the two passages

Outcome.Outcome1: Making children competitive can have many benefits for their future success and development. by encouraging them to strive for excellence, challenge themselves, and learn from their mistakes, parents can foster a positive attitude and a strong work ethic in their children. competitive children can also develop confidence, resilience, and leadership skills, as well as a sense of achievement and satisfaction. moreover, competition can stimulate creativity, innovation, and problem-solving abilities, which are essential in the modern world. therefore, some people think that it is better to make children competitive, as it can prepare them for the demands and opportunities of life.
Outcome.Outcome2: On the other hand, making children co-operative has some drawbacks as well. by focusing too much on the importance of teamwork and harmony, children may lose their individuality and creativity. they may also become dependent on others and lack the confidence and initiative to pursue their own goals and interests. moreover, they may face difficulties in coping with the challenges and competitions that they will inevitably encounter in the real world. therefore, making children co-operative may not prepare them adequately for the diverse and dynamic situations that they will face in their future.
Outcome.Outcome3: Both competitiveness and co-operation have their positive and negative aspects for the development of children's personality and skills. however, the choice of which one to foster depends on the goals and values of the parents and the society. in this essay, i will argue that (insert your thesis statement here). for example, you could say that a balance of both traits is necessary for children to succeed in the modern world, or that co-operation is more important than competitiveness in the long run, or that competitiveness is essential for innovation and progress.
Outcome.Outcome4: Children's development and personality are influenced by the way they are taught and encouraged by their parents and teachers. some people think that it is better to make them competitive, while other believes to make them co-operative. both these factors have their own values, and have been discussed in detail below: however, those who want to create a sense of co-operation in their children is a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead. although, they will not have a pace and an eager to get on the top as the competitors do, but they shall have an art of managing different situations of life with the help of a team. in this essay, i will argue that both competitiveness and co-operation are important for children's growth, but they should be balanced and applied according to the context and the goal.
Outcome.Outcome5: Both competitiveness and co-operation are important aspects of human development, and children need to learn how to balance them according to different contexts and situations. however, some people may have different preferences and opinions on which one should be emphasized more in the early stages of education and upbringing. those who favor competitiveness believe that it can motivate children to excel, challenge themselves, and achieve their goals. they may also argue that competitiveness can prepare children for the realities of a competitive world, where they have to face and overcome obstacles and rivals. however, those who want to create a sense of co-operation in their children are a symbol that they want to make them sensible enough in their lives ahead.
Outcome.Outcome6: Both competitiveness and co-operation are important skills that children need to develop in order to succeed in their future endeavors. however, different parents may have different preferences and approaches in fostering these qualities in their children. some parents may emphasize the benefits of being competitive, such as having a strong motivation, a high self-esteem, and a sense of achievement. others may focus on the advantages of being co-operative, such as having good interpersonal skills, a respect for others, and a sense of responsibility.

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the benefits of having more kinds of public transportation is that it can reduce traffic congestion and pollution in cities. traffic congestion is a common problem in urban areas, where many people drive their own cars and compete for limited road space. this causes delays, stress, and waste of time and fuel. pollution is another negative consequence of excessive car use, as it emits harmful gases and particles that affect the air quality and the health of the residents. by using public transportation, people can avoid these problems and enjoy a faster, safer, and cleaner way of traveling. public transportation can carry more passengers per vehicle, which means fewer cars on the road and less traffic jams. moreover, public transportation can use cleaner and more efficient energy sources, such as electricity, hybrid, or natural gas, which can lower the carbon footprint and the environmental impact of transportation. therefore, public transportation can be a sustainable and beneficial solution for urban mobility.
Outcome.Outcome2: One way to have more kinds of public transportation is to expand the existing networks of buses, trains, subways, and trams, and to make them more accessible, affordable, and reliable. another way is to introduce new modes of transportation that are more environmentally friendly, such as electric vehicles, bike-sharing, or carpooling services. these options can offer more convenience, flexibility, and diversity to the commuters, and reduce the traffic congestion and pollution caused by private cars.
Outcome.Outcome3: Public transportation is not only a convenient and affordable way to travel, but also a beneficial solution for reducing environmental problems and energy consumption. lastly, having more kinds of public transportation can dwindle the number of people using their own cars. also, it provides many advantages. for instance, people can save their expenses from gasoline, which nowadays is getting more expensive. the necessary energy will slowly be used up, since people use less their own cars. moreover, public transportation can help decrease air pollution, traffic congestion, and greenhouse gas emissions, which are harmful for the health and the climate. by choosing public transportation, people can contribute to a cleaner and greener society.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, the issue of traffic congestion and pollution is a serious one that requires urgent and effective solutions. increasing the number of public transportation options is a feasible and beneficial way to address this problem, as it can reduce the demand for private vehicles and their negative impacts on the environment and the economy. by choosing to use public transportation, people can not only save money and energy, but also contribute to a more sustainable and livable society.
Outcome.Outcome5: These benefits of public transportation are not only beneficial for individuals, but also for the environment and the society. by reducing the use of private cars, public transportation can help lower the emissions of greenhouse gases and air pollutants, which contribute to global warming and health problems. moreover, public transportation can ease the traffic congestion and improve the mobility and accessibility of people, especially those who live in remote areas or have low incomes. therefore, public transportation can enhance the quality of life and the social equity of the communities.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, promoting public transportation is not only beneficial for the individual commuters, but also for the environment and the society. by reducing the traffic congestion, air pollution, and greenhouse gas emissions, public transportation can enhance the quality of life and health of the urban population. moreover, public transportation can create more job opportunities, support local businesses, and foster social interaction and inclusion.

Outcome.Outcome1: One of the main reasons why i favor spending money on improving facilities over hiring famous teachers is that facilities have a direct impact on the quality of education and the well-being of students. facilities, such as libraries, laboratories, sports centers, and dormitories, provide students with the necessary resources, opportunities, and environments to learn, practice, explore, and socialize. these facilities can stimulate students' curiosity, creativity, and motivation, as well as enhance their physical and mental health. on the other hand, hiring famous teachers does not necessarily guarantee that they are effective, engaging, or compatible with the students' needs, interests, and backgrounds. famous teachers may have high academic credentials and reputations, but they may also have high expectations, rigid methods, or limited availability. therefore, i believe that improving facilities is more conducive to students than hiring famous teachers.
Outcome.Outcome2: In addition to the benefits of better facilities for the school's reputation and competitiveness, there are also direct impacts on students' learning outcomes and satisfaction. for instance, by having access to modern laboratories, libraries, and equipment, students can conduct more advanced and diverse experiments, research, and projects, which can enrich their knowledge, skills, and creativity. furthermore, by having comfortable and spacious classrooms, dormitories, and cafeterias, students can enjoy a more conducive and pleasant learning environment, which can reduce their stress, enhance their motivation, and foster their social interactions. therefore, by spending money on improving facilities, schools can not only attract more students, but also improve their academic performance and well-being.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, some may argue that hiring famous teachers is more beneficial for students' academic achievement and future prospects. they may claim that famous teachers have more expertise, reputation, and connections in their fields, and that they can inspire and motivate students to pursue their goals. they may also point out that famous teachers can attract more students and funding to the school, enhancing its prestige and competitiveness. while these points are not without merit, they do not outweigh the advantages of improving facilities for several reasons. first, famous teachers are not necessarily good teachers, as they may lack pedagogical skills, empathy, or availability for their students. second, famous teachers are not always affordable or accessible for schools, especially for those in remote or disadvantaged areas. third, famous teachers are not the only source of learning and inspiration for students, as they can also benefit from other resources, such as libraries, laboratories, or online platforms. therefore, hiring famous teachers is not a sufficient or sustainable strategy for improving education quality.
Outcome.Outcome4: To sum up, i have argued that universities should spend money on improving facilities rather than hiring famous teachers, because facilities can enhance students' learning outcomes, motivation, and well-being. i have supported my claim with evidence from academic research, personal experience, and hypothetical scenarios. i believe that improving facilities is a more effective and sustainable way to foster a high-quality education for students, who are the main stakeholders of the university. therefore, i strongly advocate that schools should prioritize facilities over teachers in their budget allocation.
Outcome.Outcome5: In order to support my preference for spending money on improving facilities, i would like to present some reasons and examples. first of all, i think that improving facilities can enhance the quality of education and learning environment for students. for instance, if schools have modern and well-equipped laboratories, libraries, and computer centers, students can access more resources and conduct more experiments and researches. these facilities can stimulate students' curiosity, creativity, and critical thinking skills, which are essential for their academic and professional development. furthermore, improving facilities can also benefit the teachers, as they can use more advanced and diverse methods and tools to deliver their lectures and interact with their students. therefore, improving facilities can improve both the input and output of the educational process.
Outcome.Outcome6: In order to support my viewpoint, i would like to present some reasons and examples. first of all, i think that improving facilities can benefit students in various aspects, such as enhancing their learning environment, stimulating their creativity, and satisfying their diverse needs. for instance, a well-equipped library can provide students with abundant resources and information, a modern laboratory can enable students to conduct experiments and explore scientific phenomena, and a comfortable dormitory can offer students a cozy and safe place to rest and socialize. these facilities can not only facilitate students' academic performance, but also enrich their campus life and cultivate their holistic development.

Context.Left: There is a hotly debated issue over whether successful people usually take risk or try new things, and the topic can be approached from several different angles due to its complexity. Some people tend to believe that to be successful, they should do something they are unfamiliar with, while others seem to stand on the opposite place. After deeply pondering over this issue, I develop my own perspective as well. I favor the latter; that is, successful people still do things they already know.
Context.Right: Moreover, another equally crucial aspect is that it depends on the capability of one to decide whether he can succeed or not. At least, a successful person should be able to dismantle the hurdles prohibiting him to success. For instance, the sports stars do not have to take some drugs to win a game or show their extraordinary skills. The same reason why they succeed is that they all have the predominated abilities in sports realm. In contrast, those athletes try to have distinctive performance by taking risks of taking drugs are failed to succeed. Hence, from this case, we are capable of stating that it is not necessary for successful people to take risks.

Outcome.Outcome1: In this essay, i will argue that successful people usually do not take risks or try new things, but rather rely on their existing knowledge and skills to achieve their goals. i will support this claim by providing two main reasons: firstly, taking risks or trying new things often involves uncertainty and unpredictability, which can hinder one's performance and outcome; and secondly, one's capability and talent are more important factors than one's willingness to experiment or challenge oneself. in the following paragraphs, i will elaborate on these reasons and illustrate them with relevant examples.
Outcome.Outcome2: To illustrate my point that successful people still do things they already know, i would like to draw some examples from different fields of human endeavor. for example, in the business world, many successful entrepreneurs and innovators are not those who constantly venture into unknown territories, but those who apply their existing knowledge and skills to create value and solve problems. steve jobs, for instance, did not invent the personal computer, the smartphone, or the tablet, but he used his design and marketing expertise to revolutionize these products and industries. similarly, in the artistic field, many successful writers, musicians, and painters are not those who experiment with radical forms and styles, but those who master their craft and express their unique vision and voice. j.k. rowling, for example, did not invent the fantasy genre, but she used her storytelling and imagination to create the harry potter series, which captivated millions of readers around the world. thus, from these examples, we can see that successful people still do things they already know, but they do them in excellent and creative ways.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, some people may argue that taking risks or trying new things is essential for success, as it can help them to discover new opportunities, overcome challenges, and innovate. they may cite examples of entrepreneurs, inventors, or explorers who achieved remarkable feats by venturing into the unknown and breaking the norms. they may claim that doing things they already know can limit their potential and make them complacent or stagnant.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, some might argue that taking risks or trying new things is essential for success, because it can help people discover new opportunities, challenge themselves, and innovate. they might cite examples of entrepreneurs, inventors, or explorers who achieved great things by venturing into the unknown and overcoming difficulties. they might also claim that doing things one already knows can lead to stagnation, boredom, or complacency, and that success requires constant learning and adaptation.
Outcome.Outcome5: In addition to the above argument, one might also consider the role of experience and expertise in achieving success. successful people usually have a deep and comprehensive knowledge of their fields, which enables them to apply their skills and strategies effectively and efficiently. doing things they already know allows them to maximize their strengths and avoid unnecessary mistakes. therefore, they do not need to take risks or try new things that might jeopardize their performance or reputation. instead, they can focus on improving their existing skills and expanding their knowledge through continuous learning and practice.
Outcome.Outcome6: In addition to the argument that successful people still do things they already know, another reason to support this view is that taking risks or trying new things does not guarantee success, but rather exposes one to potential failures and challenges. in fact, success often requires not only innovation and creativity, but also mastery and competence in one's field of expertise. therefore, instead of venturing into unknown territories or experimenting with unproven methods, successful people tend to focus on honing their skills and improving their performance in what they are good at. this can be illustrated by the following example.

Outcome.Outcome1: Technology has a profound impact on many aspects of culture, such as language, communication, education, and entertainment. some people might argue that there are some cultures such as making foods which are unique in each culture, and technology cannot affect them. this point has some merits on the surface; however, many countries such as canada, the usa, and british have many restaurants which serve many foods from different countries and cultures. in fact, cooks can find many new food recipes easily on the internet. for example, two days ago, i went to a canadian restaurant, and i ate noodle, sushi, which are chinese foods, and greek salad. in this essay, i will discuss how technology influences cultural diversity and exchange, and whether it has positive or negative effects on preserving and promoting cultural identity.
Outcome.Outcome2: Technology not only influences the way people make and consume food from different cultures, but also affects other aspects of culture, such as language, communication, and education. technology enables people to learn new languages, access diverse information, and interact with people from different backgrounds and perspectives. for instance, people can use online platforms, apps, and devices to learn foreign languages, watch movies and shows, read books and articles, and listen to podcasts and music from various cultures. they can also communicate with people from different countries and regions through social media, video calls, and online forums. moreover, technology enhances the quality and accessibility of education, as people can enroll in online courses, use digital tools and resources, and collaborate with teachers and peers from different locations and disciplines. therefore, technology plays a significant role in shaping and changing the cultural landscape of the world.
Outcome.Outcome3: Therefore, technology has a significant impact on the diversity of food cultures in the world. by using the internet, people can access a vast amount of information and resources about different cuisines and cooking techniques. they can also share their own recipes and experiences with other food enthusiasts online. this facilitates the exchange and fusion of culinary traditions and innovations across borders and regions. according to a survey by statista, 71% of canadians and 66% of americans use online sources to find new recipes, while 44% of canadians and 37% of americans use them to learn about foreign cuisines. moreover, technology also enables people to enjoy a variety of foods from different cultures in their local restaurants, as i observed in my recent visit to a canadian restaurant. this shows how technology enriches and expands the food choices and preferences of people in different countries.
Outcome.Outcome4: While technology can influence many aspects of culture, such as communication, education, and entertainment, some people might argue that there are some domains that are more immune to its effects, such as food, art, and religion. these people might claim that these cultural expressions are unique to each group and reflect their identity, history, and values. they might also suggest that technology cannot capture the nuances, flavors, and meanings of these forms of creativity and spirituality. this point has some merits on the surface; however, it overlooks the fact that technology can also facilitate the exchange, adaptation, and innovation of these cultural aspects. many countries, such as canada, the usa, and britain, have many restaurants that serve foods from different countries and cultures. in fact, cooks can find many new food recipes easily on the internet. for example, two days ago, i went to a canadian restaurant and i ate noodles, sushi, which are chinese foods, and greek salad.
Outcome.Outcome5: Therefore, the claim that technology cannot affect some aspects of culture such as making foods is not convincing. technology has enabled people to access and share information about different cuisines and ingredients from around the world. as a result, many restaurants and individuals can offer and enjoy a variety of dishes from different cultures. this shows that technology has a significant impact on the diversity and fusion of food cultures.
Outcome.Outcome6: Therefore, it is clear that technology has a significant impact on the diversity and preservation of cultures, especially in the aspect of food. while some people might argue that making foods is a unique cultural expression that technology cannot affect, the reality is that technology enables people to access and experiment with foods from different countries and cultures. this can have both positive and negative consequences, depending on how people use and appreciate the cultural diversity of foods.

Outcome.Outcome1: Celebrities are often admired and idolized by children, who look up to them as role models and sources of inspiration. however, the media portrayal of celebrities may not always reflect the reality of their lives, and may create unrealistic and distorted images of success and happiness. how does this affect the values and expectations that children develop in life? one possible consequence is that children may underestimate the importance of hard work and education, and overestimate the benefits of fame and wealth. the left text and the right text illustrate this point with an example.
Outcome.Outcome2: One of the sources of the celebrities' influence on children is the media, which often glamorizes their lifestyles and achievements, or exposes their controversies and problems. for example, children may admire celebrities who are known for their lavish spending, glamorous fashion, or extravagant parties, such as kim kardashian, paris hilton, or kylie jenner. they may also be fascinated by celebrities who are involved in scandals, such as justin bieber, britney spears, or lindsay lohan. these examples may give children the impression that success and happiness are measured by money, fame, or popularity, rather than by hard work, talent, or character. they may also make children think that celebrities can get away with anything, or that their problems are not serious or can be easily solved.
Outcome.Outcome3: However, not all celebrities are bad role models for children. fortunately, there are also some famous people who use their fame and influence to promote positive values and causes, such as education, charity, environmental protection, and social justice. these celebrities can inspire children to pursue their dreams and passions, while also being responsible and compassionate citizens. on the other hand, parents and educators can also play a vital role in helping children develop critical thinking and media literacy skills, so that they can distinguish between reality and fantasy, and evaluate the messages and images they see in the media. by doing so, they can prevent children from being misled or manipulated by the unrealistic and harmful representations of celebrities.
Outcome.Outcome4: However, this impression of the celebrities is often distorted and misleading, as many of them have to face intense competition, criticism, and pressure in their fields, and some may also struggle with personal issues, such as addiction, mental health, or family problems. therefore, it is important that parents, teachers, and media can help children develop more realistic and positive values and expectations in life, and not base their self-worth and goals on fame and fortune alone. for example, parents can encourage their children to pursue their passions and talents, but also teach them the value of hard work, resilience, and responsibility. teachers can expose their children to a variety of role models and careers, and help them develop critical thinking and media literacy skills to evaluate the information and messages they receive. media can also play a positive role by featuring more diverse and inspiring stories of people who have made a difference in their communities and the world, and who have overcome challenges and adversity with courage and integrity. by doing so, they can help children appreciate the diversity and complexity of human experiences, and foster their curiosity, empathy, and social awareness.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, this impression of the celebrities is often misleading and unrealistic. the left text does not consider the challenges and difficulties that many celebrities face in their profession, such as intense competition, public scrutiny, pressure to maintain their image and reputation, and the risk of losing their popularity and income. the right text also ignores the positive aspects of celebrities, such as their talents, skills, creativity, dedication, and social influence. some celebrities use their fame and wealth to support various causes and charities, to inspire and educate their fans, and to contribute to the society and culture. therefore, children should not blindly idolize or imitate celebrities, but rather learn from their strengths and weaknesses, and develop their own goals and values.
Outcome.Outcome6: However, this impression is often misleading and harmful for children's development. celebrities may appear to have glamorous and easy lives, but they also face many challenges and pressures that are not always visible to the public. they have to deal with intense competition, high expectations, media scrutiny, and personal issues. many of them have worked hard to achieve their fame and success, and some of them have also used their influence to support various causes and charities. therefore, children should not idolize celebrities blindly, but rather learn from their positive qualities and achievements, as well as their mistakes and struggles.

Outcome.Outcome2: Judging people by their appearance is a common practice that many of us do unconsciously or consciously, based on our stereotypes, biases, or preferences. however, this practice can have negative consequences for both the judge and the judged, as it can lead to misunderstanding, discrimination, or missed opportunities. sometimes, we might form an impression of someone based on their skin color, body shape, facial expression, or clothing, without knowing anything about their personality, character, or values. this impression might not reflect the reality of who they are or what they can offer. second of all, there are some people who are black skin, fat and frown, nonetheless they might be a great person for leaving and colleague. for instance, i have a neighbor who are old, black skin and frown and i had always panicked of her. one day in a cold winter while i was getting back to home from school i realized that i lost my keys, so i could not do anything before my parents getting back home. she asked me to stay with her till my parents come, also she was great in hospitality and her behavior was unforgettable. after that i understood, i had to never judge with people's appearance.
Outcome.Outcome3: This example shows how judging people by their appearance can be misleading and unfair. i had assumed that my neighbor was a mean and scary person just because of her skin color, weight and facial expression. however, when i needed her help, she was kind and generous to me. she offered me a warm place to stay, food and drinks, and friendly conversation. she treated me like a friend, not a stranger. from this experience, i learned that i should not judge people by their appearance, but by their character and actions. i realized that appearances can hide the true personality and values of a person.
Outcome.Outcome4: In conclusion, judging people by their appearance can lead to unfair and inaccurate assumptions that can harm our relationships and ourselves. we might miss out on valuable opportunities to learn from and connect with others who have different backgrounds, cultures, and personalities than us. moreover, we might hurt the feelings of those who are already facing discrimination and prejudice because of their looks. therefore, we should try to be more open-minded and respectful of people's diversity and individuality. we can do this by getting to know them better, listening to their stories, and finding common interests and values. we can also challenge our own stereotypes and biases and recognize that appearance is not a reliable indicator of someone's character, intelligence, or worth. by doing so, we can enrich our lives and promote a more inclusive and harmonious society.
Outcome.Outcome5: However, judging people by their appearance can be misleading and unfair, as it does not reflect their true personality and character. for example, i once had a neighbor who was old, black-skinned and frowning and i had always been afraid of her. but when i lost my keys one winter day and she invited me to stay with her until my parents came home, i realized how kind and hospitable she was. this experience taught me not to judge people by their looks.
